schemeName: Patrakar Kritadnyata Nidhi Scheme (Journalist Benevolent Fund)
Details:
Launched in 2010, the scheme "Patrakar Kritadnyata Nidhi Scheme (Journalist Benevolent Fund)" by the Department of Information and Publicity, Government of Goa aims to provide immediate financial assistance to needy journalists in indigent circumstances for various emergencies such as medical treatment, marriage expenses, funeral costs, and self-employment ventures. The scheme offers benefits like financial aid up to ₹2,00,000/per case and scholarships for journalists' wards. Eligible applicants must be journalists born or working in Goa for at least three years and registered with the Department of Information and Publicity. The scheme is implemented by a Sub-Committee constituted by the Government of Goa, which includes representatives from the Goa Union of Journalists and the Goa Editors Guild.
The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to journalists in Goa for emergencies like medical treatment, marriage, and education. Benefits include aid up to ₹2,00,000/and scholarships for dependents. Eligible journalists must be registered and working in Goa for at least three years.
Benefits:
> **Financial Assistance and Purpose**


- Marriage of Daughter: Up to ₹2,00,000/-
- Major/Minor Operation/Medical Treatment for Self or Family: Up to ₹2,00,000/-
- Funeral Expenses of the Journalist: Up to ₹2,00,000/-
- Travel/Incidental Expenses for Treatment: Up to ₹2,00,000/-
- Medical Reimbursement for General Expenses: Up to ₹2,00,000/-
- Scholarship/Incentives for Wards Pursuing Higher Education: Up to ₹2,00,000/-
- Financial Assistance for Self-employment Ventures: Up to ₹2,00,000/-
- House Repair/Construction Due to Natural Calamities: Up to ₹2,00,000/-
- Lump-sum Grant on the Death of the Journalist to Next Kin: Up to ₹2,00,000/-

_*All disbursements are made through cheques._
> **Conditions for Disbursement**


- Original bills and photocopies of hospital/institution documents must be submitted for medical claims.
- For super-specialty treatment, bills must be submitted within three months.
Eligibility:
- The applicant should be a journalist.
- The applicant should have been born and brought up in Goa.
- The applicant should be working in a newspaper establishment in Goa for at least three years continuously.
- The applicant should be registered with the Department of Information and Publicity, Government of Goa, and renew registration by June 30th every year.
- The applicant should not be engaged in any other profession.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should take print of the [prescribed format](https://dip.goa.gov.in/wp-content/uploads/2021/03/The-Patrakarb-Kritadnyata-Nidhi-Scheme.pdf) of the application form.
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the Director of Information and Publicity, Government of Goa.
> **Post-Application Processes**

**Step 1:** The Director will scrutinize the application and forward it to the Sub-Committee for review. The Sub-Committee will decide the quantum of assistance and seek government approval.
**Step 2:** Once approved, the financial assistance will be disbursed via cheque to the eligible applicant.

Documents Required:
- Proof of Working in an Established Newspaper/periodical Magazine for at Least Three Years (Certificate From Employer).
- Birth Certificate or Proof of Working in Goa for Three Years.
- Declaration Stating No Financial Assistance Has Been Availed From Other Government Schemes.
- Original Bills and Photocopies of Hospital/institution Documents (for Medical Claims).
- Doctor's Certificate for Specific Treatments (if Applicable).
- Recommendation Letters From Two Persons/institutions With Technical Knowledge of the Applicant's Work.
- Attested Copy of Birth Certificate.
- Details of Dependents (Name, Age, Relationship, Occupation, Income).

schemeName: Merit Scholarship: Polytechnic Institutions
Details:
"Merit Scholarship: Polytechnic Institutions" is a scholarship scheme by the Technical Education Department, Government of Chhattisgarh. The scheme provides ₹600/- per month to eligible students for pursuing education from recognized polytechnic institutions in Chhattisgarh. Eligible applicants include (a) Students who have passed the 10th/12th class examination under the 10+2 system from any recognized institution located in Chhattisgarh with a minimum of 60% marks, (b) Students newly admitted to the second year of the Diploma program who are ITI / 12th vocational certificate holders and have passed the qualifying examination with a minimum of 60% marks.
"Merit Scholarship: Polytechnic Institutions" is a scholarship scheme by the Technical Education Department, Government of Chhattisgarh. The scheme provides ₹600/- per month to eligible students for pursuing education from recognized polytechnic institutions in Chhattisgarh.
Benefits:
(a) For students newly admitted to the first year of the Diploma program: ₹600/- per month.
(b) For students admitted to the second year through lateral entry: ₹600/- per month.
Eligibility:
- The applicant must be a native resident student of Chhattisgarh. - The applicant must be currently studying in a recognized polytechnic institution in Chhattisgarh. - The applicant must have secured a minimum of 60% marks in the qualifying examination. - Students who have passed the 10th/12th class examination under the 10+2 system from any recognized institution located in Chhattisgarh with a minimum of 60% marks will be eligible. - Students newly admitted to the second year of the Diploma program who are ITI / 12th vocational certificate holders must have passed the qualifying examination with a minimum of 60% marks.
**Other Conditions -** - Without special approval from the government, no student will receive more than one scholarship at the same time. However, if the institution where he is studying has given him any fee concession, then he will be entitled to continue receiving it. - If any scholarship becomes vacant during its duration, then the approving authority can give such scholarships for its unexpired period to the next eligible and deserving candidate from the merit list. - Only those students will be eligible to receive scholarships who have passed the qualifying examination from any testing body of Chhattisgarh. But children of such permanent government employees of Chhattisgarh can be exempted from this condition who are on deputation to the Government of India or any other state government. - Such students will not be eligible to receive scholarships who are in full-time employment. In this regard, only one concession can be given that any such student, who is regularly studying in a recognized institution and is receiving any scholarship, can be allowed to do part-time work.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should visit the **Office of the Principal of the Institution** and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the institute staff.
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the staff. The Principal will verify the documents and forward the application to the Directorate for approval (New applications) or process the renewal (for existing beneficiaries).
**Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the staff to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).

Documents Required:
- Residential Certificate of Chhattisgarh.
- Mark sheet of the Qualifying Examination.

schemeName: Subsidy to Purchase E-Bike for Journalists
Details:
The scheme “Subsidy to Purchase E-Bike for Journalists” by the Department of Information and Publicity, Government of Goa, aims to provide journalists based in Goa with e-bikes at a subsidised rate, facilitating easier access to essential technology for their profession. This initiative acknowledges the crucial role of journalists in educating the public and the time they spend gathering news. Two significant benefits of the scheme are providing financial assistance for purchasing e-bikes and empowering journalists with better means to disseminate information vital for a democratic system. Two significant eligibility criteria include being a resident of Goa for at least 15 years and being a full-time working journalist for at least eight years. The scheme is implemented by the Department of Information and Publicity. Every year, the Government will grant subsidies to purchase 65 e-bikes to 65 beneficiaries based on their years of working.
The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to journalists in Goa for purchasing e-bikes at a subsidised rate. The benefits include making it more convenient for journalists to gather and disseminate news, with the intended beneficiaries being eligible Goa-based journalists.
Benefits:
- Subsidy up to 50% of the value on quotation or ₹ 50,000/-, whichever is less, and the remaining 50% value shall be borne by the beneficiaries. 
- The payment shall be effected directly to the beneficiaries upon receipt of the purchase of the e-bike document. 
- The subsidy shall be disbursed in a single instalment to the beneficiary, i.e., 100% on the purchase of the vehicle and production of purchase documents, i.e., the Registration Certificate book and insurance by the Beneficiary.
- Disbursement of subsidy for the purchase of e-bikes will be done on a first-come-first-served basis or a maximum of two for each organisation per meeting, also considering eligibility criteria.
Eligibility:
- The applicant should be a journalist.
- The sole livelihood of the applicant should be through journalistic activities.
- The applicant should be residing in Goa for at least 15 years.
- The applicant should be working for a Media organisation.
- The applicant should not be more than 58 years of age.
- The applicant should not have availed benefit to purchase an e-bike (two-wheeler) under any other Government scheme.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should take a printout of the [prescribed format](https://dip.goa.gov.in/wp-content/uploads/2024/01/notification-e-v-bike.pdf) of the application form. 
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and enclose the copies of all the mandatory documents (endorsed, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the Director, Department of Information and Publicity, Udyog Bhavan, 3rd floor, Panaji.
> **Post-Application Processes**

**Step 1:** After approval of the application, the Beneficiary will have to provide purchased documents (Registration Certificate book and insurance) along with bank details to release the subsidy directly to the beneficiary.
**Step 2:** The Screening Committee, constituted under the Chairmanship of the Director of Information and Publicity, will scrutinize/sanction applications and may ask for additional documents if required.
**Step 3:** The subsidy will be disbursed in a single instalment upon purchase of the vehicle and production of the necessary documents.

Documents Required:
- Birth Certificate.
- Residence Certificate issued by the Mamlatdar.
- Aadhaar Card.
- Valid Driving License Number.
- Experience Certificate from Editor/Head of Organisation.
- Latest Payslip from the Organisation.
- Quotation from a Reputed Dealer.
- Purchased Documents for the E-bike.
- Bank Details.
- Two Passport Size Photographs.
- Declaration.

schemeName: Rajya Pratibha Khoj Pariksha Chhatravriti Yojana
Details:

Under this scheme, students are provided with scholarships or a one-time incentive for pursuing education up to the postgraduate level, after being selected through the State Talent Search Examination organized by the Board of Secondary Education Rajasthan, Ajmer.
Students studying in Classes 10 and 12 in all government schools, recognized private schools, and Swami Vivekanand Model Schools in the state, who have secured a minimum of 50% marks in Classes 9 and 11 respectively, are eligible to apply for the examination. Students selected through this examination will be entitled to the benefits provided under the scheme.
Under this scheme, students are provided with scholarships or a one-time incentive for pursuing education up to the postgraduate level, after being selected through the State Talent Search Examination organized by the Board of Secondary Education Rajasthan, Ajmer.
Benefits:

schemeName: Ambedkar International Scholarship - SC
Details:
The "Ambedkar International Scholarship - SC" scheme by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Rajasthan aims to support meritorious scheduled caste (SC) students in pursuing Ph.D. studies in foreign universities. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to SC students enrolled in Ph.D. programs in Humanities and Social Sciences. The scheme is implemented by the Rajasthan Residential Educational Institutions Society (RAJEDU).
The "Ambedkar International Scholarship - SC" Scheme by the Rajasthan Social Justice and Empowerment Department provides financial assistance to meritorious SC students for pursuing Ph.D. studies in foreign universities in Humanities and Social Sciences.
Benefits: **Financial Assistance:** ₹25,00,000/- is granted to selected candidates in three installments: - ₹10,00,000/- in the first year - ₹10,00,000/- in the second year - ₹5,00,000/- in the third year **Scholarship Validity:****** Up to three years.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Rajasthan. 1. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category. 1. The applicant must have completed a postgraduate degree from a recognized Indian university with a minimum of 55% marks. 1. The applicant must have secured admission to a Ph.D. program in a foreign university accredited by the respective country's authority. 1. The applicant's age must be below 35 years as of the application deadline. 1. The applicant’s family annual income should not exceed ₹6,00,000/-. 1. The applicant should not be beneficiary of any other govt scholarship program. 1. The Ph.D. program must be in one of the following fields: - Sociology. - Public Administration. - Law. - Economics. - Political Science. - Anthropology.

Application Process.process:
> **Application Process:** Applicants related to the scheme must apply as per the following: 1. Applicants must apply within one month from the date of advertisement issued by the State Government for the scholarship. 1. The application form must be accompanied by documents related to age, annual income, caste, and proposed syllabus/subject for the Ph.D. program. 1. Income certificate must be submitted in the prescribed format issued by the State Government. 1. The application form for the scholarship should be sent to: Secretary, Ambedkar Peeth, Mundla, Jamdoli, Jaipur (Email ID: secretaryapj@gmail.com) 1. Every year, the student must submit progress reports and details of the research work undertaken to the concerned department. The department will review and record the completed research work accordingly.
> **State-Level Approval Committee:** 1. From the completely received application forms, a maximum of five applicants will be selected and approved by the State-Level Approval Committee,
> ***Process for Disbursement of Scholarship Funds:*** 1. Selected candidates under the scheme will be awarded scholarships for a maximum period of three years. 1. The candidate must submit a certificate of admission from the educational institution/university where they are pursuing the Ph.D., duly signed by the institution head. 1. A certificate of attendance from the institution/university where the candidate is pursuing the Ph.D. must be submitted. 1. Upon approval of the scholarship amount, the Director & Special Secretary, Social Justice & Empowerment Department, Rajasthan, Jaipur will issue the funds either through a cheque or direct bank transfer into the account of the concerned student. 1. Additionally, from time to time, Director & Special Secretary, Social Justice & Empowerment Department, Rajasthan will receive academic progress reports of the selected Ph.D. students from the respective universities/institutes.

Documents Required: - Domicile Certificate. - Caste Certificate. - Non-Judicial Affidavit of ₹100 Stating No Other Scholarship is Availed. - Bank Account Details. - Postgraduate Degree Certificate & Marksheet (Minimum 55% Marks Required). - Proof of Admission to a Foreign University (Offer Letter or Admission Confirmation Letter). - Accreditation Proof of the Foreign University. - Income Certificate (Issued by the Rajasthan Government in the Prescribed Format). - Age Certificate (Birth Certificate/10th Certificate). - Annual Research Progress Report (After Each Year of Ph.D. Study).

schemeName: Additional Financial Assistance for the Children of Persons Engaged in the Cleaning Profession
Details:
The &quot;Additional Financial Assistance for the Children of Persons Engaged in the Cleaning Profession&quot; scheme was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Rajasthan. The scheme provides an additional financial assistance of ₹500/- per month to children of individuals working in the cleaning or sanitation profession. This assistance is given to students already receiving a scholarship under the Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme, ensuring their continued education.
This scheme aims to provide additional financial assistance of ₹500/- per month to children of individuals working in cleaning/sanitation profession. This assistance is given to students already receiving a scholarship under Post-Matric Scholarship Scheme, ensuring their continued education.
Benefits:
**Financial Assistance:** 

  - This scheme provides ₹500/- per month as additional financial assistance to children of individuals working in the cleaning/sanitation profession.

**Note:** Assistance will be provided for a maximum of 10 months per year.

schemeName: Marriage Assistance Scheme (MPBOCWWB)
Details:
"Marriage Assistance Scheme" by the Madhya Pradesh Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board, Department of Labour, Government of Madhya Pradesh, provides financial assistance for the marriage of a registered female worker herself (including one-time remarriage) and for up to two daughters of a registered worker. The scheme applies to the marriage of the female beneficiary herself or the legal, adopted, or stepdaughter of a registered construction worker, provided that the bride is at least 18 years old at the time of marriage.
The scheme provides financial assistance for the marriage of a registered female worker herself (including one-time remarriage) and for up to two daughters of a registered worker. The scheme applies to the marriage of the female beneficiary herself and the legal, adopted, or stepdaughter of worker.
Benefits:
- ₹55,000/- Total Assistance
- ₹11,000/- Cash Support
- ₹38,000/- For Materials
- ₹6,000/- For Mass Marriage Organizer
Eligibility:
**For Registration**

- The applicant should be a resident of Madhya Pradesh.
- The applicant should be a Building/ Construction Worker.
- The applicant should be between 18 and 60 years.
- The applicant should have engaged in any building or other construction work for at least 90 days during the preceding 12 months.
- The registration of the applicant should be renewed annually.

**For Application**

- The applicant should be a registered female worker or the daughter of a registered worker.
- The applicant should participate in the "Chief Minister Kanya Vivaah/Nikah Scheme".
- The bride should be at least 18 years old.
- The applicant should not have received similar assistance before.

schemeName: Transgender Utthan Kosh - Training Programme for Transgender
Details:
The scheme &quot;Transgender Utthan Kosh - Training Programme for Transgenders&quot; was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Rajasthan, to provide financial assistance, skill training, and employment opportunities to transgender individuals, promoting their inclusion in society.
Under this scheme, vocational and technical training is provided to transgender persons through Rajasthan Skill and Livelihood Development Corporation (RSLDC), Rajasthan Knowledge Corporation Limited (RKCL), Jan Shikshan Sansthan, Industrial Training Institutes (ITIs), or other training providers recognized by the State or Central Government. Transgender individuals can avail a maximum of two training programs under this scheme. The Social Justice and Empowerment Department implements the scheme in collaboration with recognized training institutes and organizations.
The scheme aims to support the socio-economic development of transgender individuals by providing financial assistance, skill training, and employment opportunities.
Benefits:
***Skill Development:***

  - Vocational/technical training will be provided to transgender persons through the Rajasthan Skill and Livelihood Development Corporation (RSLDC), Rajasthan Knowledge Corporation Limited (RKCL), Jan Shikshan Sansthan, Industrial Training Institutes (ITIs), or training providers recognized by the State or Central Government.

***Financial Assistance:***

- After receiving skill development training, each trainee will be given a lump sum amount of ₹5,000/- per month for one course (for maximum three months and for two courses).
- Transgender persons can avail maximum 2 training programmes only.

***Training Fee Coverage:********* 

- The state government reimburses the training fee directly to the training institutions.

schemeName: Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Antyodaya Parivar Suraksha Yojana (DAYALU-II)
Details:
The scheme “Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Antyodaya Parivar Suraksha Yojana (DAYALU-II)” was launched by Planning Department, Haryana Government. The aim of this scheme is to provide financial assistance to residents of Haryana in case of accidental death or permanent disability occurred due to stray cattle/animal such as such as cow, bull, oxen, donkey, dog bite, mule, nilgai and buffalo that roam freely. This scheme will provide assistance which would vary depending on the age of the person at the time of accidental death/permanent disability. The implementing agency for this scheme will be Haryana Parivar Suraksha Nyas (HPSN).
The aim of this scheme is to provide financial assistance to residents of Haryana in case of accidental death or permanent disability occurred due to stray cattle/animal such as such as cow, bull, oxen, donkey, dog bite, mule, nilgai and buffalo that roam freely.
Benefits:
The scheme provides financial assistance based on the age of the beneficiary at the time of accidental death or permanent disability:
**Sr. No.****Age****Assistance**1Upto 12 years₹ 1 Lakh2Above 12 years and upto 18 years₹ 2 Lakh3Above 18 years and upto 25 years₹ 3 Lakh4Above 25 years and upto 40 years₹ 5 Lakh5Above 40 years₹ 2 Lakh**Mode of Disbursement:**
The assistance amount will be directly transferred to the beneficiary&#39;s bank account registered in the Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP) database or Aadhaar-seeded bank account.
Eligibility:
The benefits of assistance under the scheme shall be made available to the beneficiary if:
1. The applicant should be a resident of Haryana.
2. The applicant refers to either:
•	The beneficiary (in case of permanent disability), or
•	An eligible relative (in case of the beneficiary’s death) applying for financial assistance.
3. The applicant should possess a Family ID/Parivar Pehchaan Patra (PPP) number.
4. The applicant should have suffered accidental death or permanent disability (70% or above) due to a stray cattle/animal bite (such as cow, bull, oxen, donkey, dog bite, mule, nilgai and buffalo that roam freely.)
5. The claim should be filed within three months of the accident.
6. The scheme is effective from 24th May 2023, as per the official gazette notification. Claims for deaths or permanent disabilities occurring before this date will not be entertained.
7. Financial assistance will be provided only for cases of death or permanent disability caused by stray cattle/animal/dog bites.
> **In case of death, the assistance amount shall be paid**

1. In case Member of family is deceased then assistance will be given
•	Head of the Family (HOF) below the age of 60 years
•	In case HOF is above 60 years then eldest of the family member below the age of 60 years.
•	In case no elder family member/HOF is below 60 years then the family member immediate above the age of 60 years.
2. In case Head of Family is deceased then assistance will be given
•	Eldest of the family below the age of 60 years.
•	In case no elder family member is below the age of 60 years then the family member immediate above the age of 60 years.
3. In case no family member is alive after the death in the family then no assistance will be paid.
4. In case the alive family member are below the age of 18 years then the assistance will be paid only at the time of any member attaining the age above 18 years.
5. In case assistance is sanctioned by suppressing true information or making wrong claim or on the basis of wrong information given by the claimant in the claim form then the assistance amount would be recovered alongwith interest @ 12% per annum.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** Visit the official [DAYALU](https://dapsy.finhry.gov.in/) scheme portal.
**Step 2:** Select the Apply Option: Click on "Apply Scheme" to begin your application.
**Step 3:** On the registration page, select the scheme DAYALU-ll and enter your Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP) number. Register using the OTP sent to your registered mobile number.
**Step 4:** Select the family member who has passed away or is permanently disabled.
**Step 5:** Fill in the necessary information, including Date of Death (if applicable), Registration Number, and Issuing Authority and Attach the relevant death or disability certificate.
**Step 6:** Click "Apply Scheme" to complete the application submission.
> Note: Submit the claim within three months of the death or permanent disability.

Documents Required:

1. Death Certificate
1. Copy of FIR/DDR indicating death due to an accident caused by stray cattle, animal, or dog bite
1. Family ID/Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP) number

1. Family ID/Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP) number
1. Proof of age
1. Domicile Proof

schemeName: Bhavantar Bharpai Yojana
Details:
The scheme “Bhavantar Bharpai Yojana”, implemented by the Department of Horticulture, Government of Haryana, aims to protect horticultural farmers from market price fluctuations and compensate them if they receive low prices for their produce in the market.
***Objectives:***

  - To reduce the financial risk for farmers during periods of low market prices for vegetables and fruits by ensuring a protected price.
  - To encourage diversification in agriculture by supporting horticultural farmers.

***Crops covered under the scheme:***

  - 21 Crops: Ladyfinger, Chilli, Bottle Gourd, Bitter Gourd, Cabbage, Radish, Tomato, Onion, Potato, Cauliflower, Carrot, Peas, Capsicum, Brinjal, Turmeric, Garlic, Mango, Kinnow, Guava, Litchi, Plum
The scheme is implemented by the Department of Horticulture, Government of Haryana, aims to protect horticultural farmers from market price fluctuations and compensate them if they receive low prices for their produce in the market.
Benefits:
1. To make vegetable growers risk free.
   1. To fix protected price for the crops (Ladyfinger, Chilli, Bottle Gourd, Bitter Gourd, Cabbage, Radish, Tomato, Onion, Potato, Cauliflower, Carrot, Peas, Capsicum, Brinjal, Turmeric, Garlic, Mango, Kinnow, Guava, Litchi, Plum)
   1. In case of selling of fruits/vegetables at lower prices in the market within the prescribed period, the difference in price upto the protected price will be compensated by the Government to the registered farmers.

Note: The incentive amount will be released into the Aadhar linked bank account of the farmer.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a landowner, lessee, or tenant farmer in Haryana.
   1. The farmer should cultivate one of the 21 listed crops.

**Note 1:** Registration on the [Meri Fasal, Mera Byora portal](https://fasal.haryana.gov.in/) during the sowing period is mandatory.
**Note 2:** The land and crop details must be certified by the Horticulture Department.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** Farmers should register themselves on the [Meri Fasal, Mera Byora Portal](https://fasal.haryana.gov.in/) during the sowing period. It is mandatory for the farmer to avail the benefits under this scheme.
**Step 2:** On the homepage, click the link for &quot;Farmer Registration (Kisan Panjikaran).&quot;
**Step 3:** Go through the guidelines and click on &quot;Proceed for Registration.&quot;
**Step 4:** Complete the form by entering all the required details accurately.
**Step 5:** After verifying the entered details, click on &quot;Submit for Registration.&quot; Upon successful registration, the farmer will receive a username and password for portal access.
**Note 1:** Free registration of producer.
**Note 2:** Registration will be open only during the stipulated period.
**Note 3:** Registration facility will be available at Sarva Seva Kendra/e-Disha Kendra/ Marketing Board/Horticulture Department/ Agriculture Department and Internet Kiosk.
***Steps to Make Claims and Check Status:***

  - **Login to e-Kharid Portal:** Visit the [e-Kharid login](https://ekharid.in/Account/LogIn#no-back-button) page, enter your username, password, and the captcha code.  - **Access the Dashboard:** Once logged in, farmers can make claims and track the status of their applications or complaints.
***J-Form - Sale Voucher:***
To receive compensation under the scheme:

  - Sale on J-Form will be mandatory for Incentive.
  - The &quot;J-Form,&quot; a sale voucher, must be obtained upon selling the produce.
  - After sale on J-Form, the sales details will be uploaded on BBY e-portal ([http://www.bby.hortharyana.gov.in/](http://www.bby.hortharyana.gov.in/)), for which facility will be available in the office of each concerned Market Committee.  - Incentives will be payable on sale at J-Farm and the determined production per acre (whichever is less) as per the scheme guidelines.
  - Incentive will be payable by multiplying the difference in price.
  - The average daily wholesale price will be determined based on the daily prices of the Mandis identified by the Mandi Board as per the standards and guidelines of the scheme.

Documents Required:
1. Identity Proof i.e. Aadhaar Card
1. Proof of land ownership or lease agreement (for tenant farmers)
1. Registration proof from the Meri Fasal, Mera Byora portal
1. J-Form for the sale of produce
1. Bank account details linked with Aadhaar
1. Any other documents if required

schemeName: Free Supply of Text Books
Details:
The scheme "Free Supply of Text Book" by the Department of Education (DoE), Government of NCT of Delhi, aims to provide textbooks or cash in lieu of textbooks and writing material to students of Government and Aided Schools, ensuring equitable access to educational resources. The scheme offers financial assistance for purchasing textbooks and geometry boxes, with varying amounts based on class levels. Eligible beneficiaries include all students from Nursery to XII in Government and Aided Schools, irrespective of gender or income. The scheme is implemented by the Department of Education, GNCT of Delhi.
The scheme provides textbooks or cash subsidies for textbooks and writing materials to students of Government and Aided Schools. Benefits include financial assistance ranging from ₹550/- to ₹830/- per annum, with additional support for geometry boxes. All students from Nursery to 12th are eligible.
Benefits:
> **Cash Subsidy for Textbooks and Writing Materials**


- Class 1st to 5th: ₹550/- per annum.
- Class 6th, 7th, 11th, and 12th (Without Math): ₹800/- per annum.
- Class 8th, 11th, and 12th (With Math): ₹830/- per annum.
- Class 5th: ₹630/- per annum.
- Class 10th: ₹730/- per annum.

> **Additional Support**

Cash subsidy of ₹30/- per student for classes VIII, IX, and X, and for students of classes XI and XII who opt for Mathematics, for purchasing a Geometry Box.
**Mode of Disbursement**

- For Cash Subsidies: The amount is transferred directly to the student’s/parent’s bank account.
- For Textbooks: The school distributes the books to eligible students.
Eligibility:
- The applicant should be a resident of Delhi.
- The applicant should be a student from Nursery to Class 12th.
- The applicant should be enrolled in a Government or Aided School in Delhi.
- The applicant should be attending classes regularly according to school norms.

Application Process.process: The scheme "Free Supply of Textbooks" does not require any formal application from students, as the process is managed by the school authorities. The school verifies the students' enrollment and class details, compiles a list of eligible students, and submits it to the Department of Education.

- Class-wise Enrollment Details
- Bank Account Details

schemeName: Scholarship for Children of Ex-Servicemen for Vocational and Technical Education
Details:
The scheme &quot;Scholarship for Children of Ex-Servicemen for Vocational and Technical Education&quot; was introduced by the Department of Sainik Welfare, Government of Rajasthan. Under this scheme, a scholarship of ₹15,000/- per year is provided to the children of ex-servicemen, from the rank of Sepoy to Havildar, who are pursuing vocational and technical education and have not received scholarship assistance under the Prime Minister&#39;s Scholarship Scheme or from any other source. A maximum of 50 children can be granted this scholarship each year, based on merit, from the Amalgamated Fund. The scheme came into effect from 1st July 2020.
Under this scheme, a scholarship of ₹15,000 per year is provided to the children of ex-servicemen, from the rank of Sepoy to Havildar, who are pursuing vocational & technical education & have not received scholarship assistance under the Prime Minister's Scholarship Scheme or from any other source.
Benefits:
**Financial Assistance:**

- An scholarship of ₹15,000/- per year per student.

**Mode of Disbursement:**

- Scholarship is disbursed through online payment to the beneficiary’s bank account.

**Note 1:** Only 50 students are selected each year based on merit.
**Note 2:** Scholarship will be payable in the passing year i.e. scholarship of first year will be payable in the second year. Similarly, scholarship of second year will be payable in the third year.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should be an ex-serviceman of the rank of Havildar or below, or his widow/dependent.
1. The applicant should be pursuing a vocational or technical education course included in the [Prime Minister Scholarship Scheme](https://www.ksb.gov.in/writereaddata/DownLoad/List_of_Authorised_professional_degree_courses_under_PMSS.pdf) (PMSS). 1. The applicant should not be receiving benefits under the Prime Minister’s Scholarship Scheme or any other scholarship scheme.
1. This scholarship is not admissible in cases of Battle Casualty/Disability and Physical Casualty (attributable cases), as in such cases, scholarships are already provided by the Army Headquarters.
1. The applicant must have passed the previous academic year successfully; failure to pass results in the discontinuation of the scholarship.
1. The scholarship will not be payable to more than two children of an ex-serviceman.

**Notes:**

- Once selected, the scholarship will continue for the remaining duration of the course, subject to annual renewal.
- In case of failure in any year, the scholarship will be cancelled for the entire course.

Application Process.process:
***Application Process:***
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should visit the office of the District Sainik Welfare Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.
**OR**
The applicant should download the application form from the official website (Link Page No.4).
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the District Sainik Welfare Office.
**Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the District Sainik Welfare Office to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission and a unique identification number (if applicable).
**Note:** Applicants must submit their applications to the District Soldiers Welfare Officer by November 30.
***Post Application Process:***
**Step 1:** The District Soldiers Welfare Officer verifies applications and forwards them to the Director, Soldiers Welfare Department, Jaipur by December 31.
**Step 2:** A committee reviews and approves the applications by March 31.
**Step 3:** The approved scholarship amount is sent to the District Soldiers Welfare Officer for disbursement.
**Step 4:** The scholarship amount is transferred online to the beneficiary’s bank account within one month.
***Yearly Renewal Process:***
**Step 1:** The scholarship, after initial approval, must be renewed every year of the course.
**Step 2:** The renewal application needs to be provided with a copy of the original marks sheet.
**Step 3:** The application must be done within 1 year from the date of the published result. If a university does not give the final marks sheet on the end of the course, a passing certificate is needed.

Documents Required:
1. Discharge book or service certificate of the ex-serviceman parent
1. Ex-Serviceman/Widow Identity Card
1. Previous Year’s Marksheet/Educational qualification certificates
1. Self-declaration (not receiving any other scholarship)
1. Pension Payment Order (PPO)
1. Bank Account Details
1. Proof of Admission
1. Residence Proof (Domicile certificate or any valid document confirming residency in Rajasthan.)
1. Any other documents if required

schemeName: Transgender Utthan Kosh - Self Employment Programme for Transgender
Details:
The scheme &quot;Transgender Utthan Kosh - Self Employment Programme for Transgender&quot; was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Rajasthan, with the aim of providing financial support for self-employment or business establishment to transgender individuals, promoting their economic independence.
Under the scheme, transgender persons aged between 21 and 50 years are eligible to take a loan from any nationalized or cooperative bank to set up their self-employment or business. The loan amount may be revised by the state government from time to time. The benefit of the scheme is available to a transgender person only once.
The scheme objective is to provide financial assistance to transgender individuals for self-employment/business establishment. Eligible beneficiaries can receive up to ₹50,000/- or 25% of the project cost.
Benefits:
- **Financial Assistance:** 25% of the total business cost or ₹50,000/- (whichever is lower) for self-employment/business establishment.- **Loan Support:** The beneficiary must secure a loan from a nationalized/cooperative bank to avail of the grant.- **One-Time Benefit:** The assistance is available only once per individual.
**Note:** The grant is disbursed only after the beneficiary starts the business and gets it verified by the lending agency.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a resident of Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should be a transgender person.
1. The applicant should be between 21 and 50 years of age.
1. The applicant should secure a loan from a nationalized/cooperative bank.
1. The gross annual income of applicant should not exceed ₹8,00,000/-.
1. Each transgender individual can avail the benefits of this scheme only once.

Application Process.process:
Step 1: The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Social Justice and Empowerment Office and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in application.
Step 2: In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
Step 3: Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Social Justice and Empowerment Office. 
Step 4: Request a receipt or acknowledgment from the Social Justice and Empowerment Office to whom the application has been submitted.
**Note 1:** After a transgender person takes a loan from any nationalized / cooperative bank, on the basis of loan approval, the District Magistrate will deposit the grant amount in the loan account of the transgender person.
**Note 2:** The applicant will receive the said amount only on the condition that he starts the related business and gets its physical verification done by the related lending agency.

schemeName: Educational Study Scheme
Details:
The &quot;Educational Study Scheme&quot; introduced by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat, aims to support students pursuing undergraduate and postgraduate professional courses by providing affordable education loans. The loan is available for courses accredited by the relevant councils and is applicable for students studying within Gujarat as well as in other states/UTs for select higher education institutions like IIM, IIT, NID, NIFT, IRMA, and TISS. The scheme is being implemented by the Gujarat Unreserved Education and Economical Development Corporation.
The "Educational Study Scheme" provides financial assistance in the form of loans for self-supporting graduate-level courses in professional fields such as Medical, Dental, Engineering, Technology, Pharmacy, Architecture, Nursing, Homeopathy, Veterinary, and similar disciplines.
Benefits:
**Financial Assistance:** A loan of the total tuition fee of the entire course or ₹10,00,000/-, whichever is less, will be provided by the Corporation at a simple interest of 4%.
**Collateral:**


    - For loans of total loan amount of ₹7,50,000/- or less for the entire course, a charge of one and a half times the loan amount will have to be registered on the beneficiary&amp;#39;s own or relative&amp;#39;s property.
    - If the total loan amount for the entire course is more than ₹7,50,000/-, the immovable property of oneself or any other relative equal to that total amount will have to be mortgaged in favor of the Corporation.


**Loan repayment:**


    - In case of total loan up to ₹5,00,000/-, the loan amount along with interest will have to be repaid in equal monthly installments over 5 (five) years, 1 year after completion of studies.
    - In case of loan of more than ₹5,00,000/-, the loan amount along with interest will have to be repaid in equal monthly installments over 6 (six) years, starting 1 year after completion of studies.
    - The loan amount being repaid will be credited first as interest.
    - The borrower can repay the loan even before the specified time limit.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant must be from Gujarat 1. The applicant must belong to the unreserved category. 1. The applicant must have passed Standard 12 with 60% or more from any school in the state of Gujarat. 1. The annual family income limit for state educational loan schemes will remain at ₹6,00,000/- or less.
**Note:** 1. Priority is given to widows and orphans when sanctioning loans under this scheme. 1. The loans of those who drop out mid-studies or fail to obtain a degree within the stipulated time frame will be subject to recovery at once and interest subsidy will not be available.

schemeName: Schemes for welfare of School Children belonging to BPL and BC(A) families: Monthly Stipend for BPL Students
Details:
The scheme &quot;Schemes for Welfare of School Children Belonging to BPL and BC(A) families: Monthly Stipend for BPL Students&quot; was launched by the Government of Haryana during the financial year 2009-10. It aims to provide financial assistance to students from Below Poverty Line (BPL) families to support their education. Under this scheme, a monthly stipend is provided to students from BPL families studying in classes 1 to 12 in Haryana Government schools.
The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to students from BPL students to support their education. Under this scheme, a monthly stipend is provided to students studying in classes 1 to 12 in Haryana Government schools.

schemeName: Merit Scholarship: Engineering University
Details:
"Merit Scholarship: Engineering University" is a welfare scheme by the Technical Education Department, Government of Chhattisgarh. The scheme provides ₹1000/- per month to eligible students for pursuing B.E. from a recognized engineering college in Chhattisgarh. The applicants can either be students who have passed their 10th and 12th standard examinations with a minimum of 60% marks, or Diploma holders newly admitted to the second year of B.E. must have passed the final year examination of their diploma with a minimum of 60% marks.
The scheme provides ₹1000/- per month to eligible students for pursuing B.E. from a recognized engineering college in Chhattisgarh.  The applicants can either be students who have passed their 10th and 12th standard examinations, or Diploma holders newly admitted to the second year of B.E.
Benefits:
- For studying in the first year of the B.E. (Bachelor of Engineering) program: ₹1,000/- per month.
- For students newly admitted to the second year of B.E. through lateral entry: ₹1,000/- per month.
Eligibility:
- The applicant must be a native resident student of Chhattisgarh. - The applicant must be currently studying in a recognized engineering college in Chhattisgarh. - The applicant must be pursuing an engineering degree course. - Students who have passed their 10th and 12th standard examinations with a minimum of 60% marks from any recognized institution located in Chhattisgarh will be eligible. - Diploma holders newly admitted to the second year of B.E. must have passed the final year examination of their diploma with a minimum of 60% marks will also be eligible.
**Other Conditions -** - Without special approval from the government, no student will receive more than one scholarship at the same time. However, if the institution where he is studying has given him any fee concession, then he will be entitled to continue receiving it. - If any scholarship becomes vacant during its duration, then the approving authority can give such scholarships for its unexpired period to the next eligible and deserving candidate from the merit list. - Only those students will be eligible to receive scholarships who have passed the qualifying examination from any testing body of Chhattisgarh. But children of such permanent government employees of Chhattisgarh can be exempted from this condition who are on deputation to the Government of India or any other state government. - Such students will not be eligible to receive scholarships who are in full-time employment. In this regard, only one concession can be given that any such student, who is regularly studying in a recognized institution and is receiving any scholarship, can be allowed to do part-time work.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should visit the **Office of the Principal of the Institution** and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the institute staff.
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the staff. The Principal will verify the documents and forward the application to the Directorate for approval (New applications) or process the renewal (for existing beneficiaries).
**Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the staff to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).

Documents Required:
- Residential Certificate of Chhattisgarh.
- Mark Sheet of the Qualifying Examination.

schemeName: Assistance of Concentrate Feed After Parturition (Scheduled Caste Category)
Details:
The scheme &quot;Assistance of Concentrate Feed After Parturition (Scheduled Caste Category)&quot; introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat,  is designed to support livestock owners during the critical post-parturition period, one month after delivery. This time is crucial for the health of the mother cattle and the calf. Under the scheme, 150 kg of BIS Type II concentrate feed is provided free of cost to livestock owners belonging to the Scheduled Caste Category.
The scheme "Assistance of Concentrate Feed After Parturition (Scheduled Caste Category)" provides 150 kg of BIS Type II concentrate feed to Scheduled Caste Category livestock owners after parturition to support cattle health, increase milk production, and enhance calf development.

schemeName: Tiatr Cantaram Singing Competition
Details:
The "Tiatr Cantaram Singing Competition", organised by the Kala Academy under the Department of Art, Culture and Museums, Government of Goa, aims to promote singing talent, preserve and revive the tradition of Tiatr songs, and encourage both traditional and new compositions that reflect Goa’s rich Tiatr heritage. schemeName: Samajik Sewa Bhatta Scheme
Details:

Under this scheme, traditional faith healers receive a monthly pension to recognize and support their cultural and social contributions. It covers a total of 1,500 beneficiaries and seeks to preserve the traditional healing practices that are integral to the cultural heritage of Sikkim.
The scheme aims to support traditional faith healers by providing a monthly pension. Under this scheme, ₹1,500 is provided to each eligible traditional healer across the state.

Details:

In this scheme, persons aged between 60 and 79 years receive a pension of ₹200/- per month, while those aged 80 years and above receive ₹500/- per month. The scheme applies only to persons belonging to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category.
In this scheme, persons aged between 60 and 79 years receive a pension of ₹200/- per month, while those aged 80 years and above receive ₹500/- per month. The scheme applies only to persons belonging to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category.

schemeName: Aapki Beti Yojana
Details:
The &quot;Aapki Beti Yojana&quot; scheme was launched by the School Education Department, Government of Rajasthan, to support girls in continuing their education in government schools from Class 1 to 12. Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹2,100/- per year is provided to girls studying in Class 1 to 8 in government schools who belong to families living below the poverty line (BPL) and whose one or both parents have passed away. For girls studying in Class 9 to 12, the assistance is ₹2,500/- per year. The scheme is implemented by the Rajasthan Balika Shiksha Foundation.
Under the scheme, financial assistance of ₹2,100/- per year is provided to girls studying in Class 1 to 8 in government schools, belonging to families living below the poverty line (BPL) and whose both or one parent has passed away. Girls studying in Class 9 to 12 receive ₹2,500/- per year.
Benefits:
> **Financial Assistance:**


- ₹2,100/- per annum for girl students in classes 1st to 8th.- ₹2,500/- per annum for girl students in classes 9th to 12th.
> ***Mode of Disbursement:***


- Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the bank account linked with Jan Aadhaar of the family head or the girl child.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should be a girl student 
1. The applicant should be studying in a government school in Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should be studying in classes 1st to 12th.1. The applicant’s family should fall under the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category.
1. The applicant should have lost either one parent (single parent) or both parents.

Application Process.process:

- School authorities log in through the [Shala Darpan School Login](https://rajshaladarpan.rajasthan.gov.in/SD2/BSP/Home/HomePage.aspx).- Navigate to the "Student" tab and fill required details in Form-9.

**Category Selection for Eligible Girls:**

- Under the “Mandatory Student Information for Beneficiary Schemes” section, select class-wise eligible girls under “BPL” and “Orphan/Single Parent” categories.

**Beneficiary Approval:**

- Visit the Beneficiary Scheme Portal through School Login.
- Select the appropriate scheme and approve and lock the displayed list of eligible girls.

schemeName: Operation of Sports Hostels

schemeName: Rajasthan Varishth Patrakar Samman Yojana
Details:
The &quot;Rajasthan Varishth Patrakar Samman Yojana&quot; was implemented by the Information and Public Relations Department, Government of Rajasthan, to recognize and support the contributions of senior accredited journalists. Under this scheme, a monthly financial assistance of ₹15,000/- is provided to full-time accredited journalists who are 60 years of age or older and have served continuously for at least 20 years in daily, weekly, fortnightly newspapers, independent publications, electronic media, or news agencies (including editors, publishers, and owners).
Under this scheme, a monthly financial assistance of ₹15,000/- is provided to full-time accredited journalists who are 60 years of age or older & have served continuously for at least 20 years in daily, weekly, fortnightly newspapers, independent publications, electronic media, or news agencies.
Benefits:
**Financial Assistance:**

- Monthly Honorarium: ₹15,000/- per month to the senior accredited journalists.
- In case of the journalist's death, 50% of the amount is provided to the widow.

**Duration:** 

- Paid for a maximum period of 5 years, subject to review.

**Mode of Disbursement:**

- Direct Bank Transfer to the journalist’s savings account.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant must be a full-time accredited journalist.
   1. The applicant must have continuously worked for at least 20 years in daily newspapers, weekly newspapers, fortnightly news publications, independent journalism, electronic media, or news agencies, including roles such as editor, publisher, or owner of such media organizations.
   1. Accredited journalists who have been regularly accredited with the Department of Information and Public Relations, Rajasthan for at least 10 years will be eligible for this scheme.
   1. The journalist should be 60 years of age or older as of the application date.
   1. The applicant should not be receiving any salary, pension, or regular financial assistance from any newspaper, institution, or any other regular assistance from the State Government.

schemeName: Laado Protsahan Yojana
Details:
The Scheme &quot;Laado Protsahan Yojana&quot; was launched on 1st August 2024 by the Department of Women Empowerment, Government of Rajasthan. The scheme aims to encourage the birth of girl children in poor families and promote their holistic development. Under this scheme, financial support is provided in seven installments to the parents or guardians of girls born in Government/authorized Medical Institutions.
> **Objectives:**


- Promote a positive mindset towards the birth of a girl child and ensure her holistic development.
- Eliminate gender discrimination in childcare, education, and health.
- Promote institutional deliveries and reduce maternal mortality.
- Reduce infant mortality among girls and improve the child sex ratio.
- Ensure enrollment and retention of girls in schools.
- Encourage higher education for girls and reduce child marriage.
The scheme aims to encourage the birth of girl children in poor families and promote their holistic development. Under this scheme, financial support ₹1,50,000/- is provided in seven installments to the parents or guardians of girls born in Government/authorized Medical Institutions.
Benefits:
> **Monetary Benefit:**


- **Total financial benefit of ₹1,50,000/- disbursed in 7 installments:**

**Installment****Description****Amount (₹)**1Girl&amp;amp;#39;s birth in eligible medical institutions2500/-2Girl completes one year of age and all vaccinations2500/-3Girl&amp;amp;#39;s admission to Class 1st in a government/government-recognized private school4000/-4Girl&amp;amp;#39;s admission to Class 6th in a government/government-recognized private school5000/-5Girl&amp;amp;#39;s admission to Class 10th in a government/government-recognized private school  11000/-
6Girl&amp;amp;#39;s admission to Class 12th in a government/government-recognized private school25000/-7Girl passes graduation from government-recognized educational institutions and completes 21 years of age   1,00,000/-
**Total Amount                                                                                                                                 ₹1,50,000**> **Mode of Disbursement:**


   1. A commitment letter of ₹1.50 lakh will be issued at the birth of a girl child.
   1. The entire amount will be disbursed online through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) in seven installments.
   1. Until the girl attains adulthood, the first six installments will be transferred to the bank account of her parents or guardian, and the seventh installment will be transferred to the girl&#39;s own bank account through DBT.

> **Notes:** 


  - If the benefit of any installment is not availed at any stage after the first two installments of the scheme, the eligible girl child may still be granted the next installment, provided a valid and reasonable justification is given.
  - There is no limit on the number of girl children eligible to receive the third and subsequent installments under the scheme. All girls who have already received the first two installments will be entitled to continue receiving benefits under the scheme.
  - The Rajshree Yojana will be merged with the Laado Protsahan Yojana, and the remaining installments of the Rajshree Yojana will be provided under the Laado Protsahan Yojana as per eligibility.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a woman who is a native of Rajasthan.
1. The applicant should deliver the girl child in a government medical institution or a private medical institution authorized under the Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY).
1. The applicant should ensure full immunization of the child (for second installment).
1. The applicant's child should be enrolled in a recognized school or institution for subsequent installments.
1. The applicant’s daughter should graduate from a recognized higher education institution and attain the age of 21 to receive the final installment.

Application Process.process:
> **Application process for the Applicant:**

**Step 1:** The applicant should gather copies of the necessary documents needed to apply for the concerned scheme.
**Step 2:** The applicant should visit the nearest office of the Department of Medical, Health & Family Welfare. 
> **Application process for the Department of Medical, Health & Family Welfare**

**For First and Second Installments:**

- Data is entered on PCTS portal during antenatal checkups and post-institutional delivery.
- DBT is done automatically by the Department of Medical, Health & Family Welfare.

**For Second Installment:**

- Full immunization record must be uploaded on the [PCTS](https://pctsrajmedical.rajasthan.gov.in/private/login.aspx)/[OJAS](https://ojspm.rajasthan.gov.in/Private/login.aspx) portal.- Based on verification, payment is made to parent/guardian’s account.

**For Installments 3 to 6 (School Admissions):**

- Automatically tracked by schools through the portal using earlier installment IDs.
- No fresh application is required from parents/guardians.

**For Final (Seventh) Installment:**

- The Department of Higher Education uploads the girl’s graduation documents.
- Payment is made to the girl’s own bank account after verifying she is 21 years old.

Documents Required:
1. Permanent Resident Certificate of Rajasthan
1. Marriage Registration Certificate
1. Bank Account Details of Mother/Father/Guardian
1. Birth Certificate of the Girl Child
1. Institutional Delivery Proof from Government or JSY-Authorized Medical Facility
1. Age Proof Document (for verifying completion of 21 years of age)
1. Unique ID/PCTS ID issued at birth
1. Any Other Document if Required

schemeName: Scheme to Provide Electric Scooter to Disabled Person
Details:
The &quot;Scheme to Provide Electric Scooter to Disabled Person&quot; is a welfare scheme by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department of Gujarat. The scheme aims to promote mobility and independence for orthopedically disabled individuals in Gujarat by offering a financial subsidy. The beneficiary can purchase an electric scooter through an agency approved by JEDA. After verification, the financial assistance amounting to ₹25,000 (or 50% of the scooter and kit cost, whichever is lower) will be directly deposited into the beneficiary&#39;s bank account.
The "Scheme to Provide Electric Scooter to Disabled Person" provides financial assistance of up to ₹25,000 for the purchase of electric scooters to eligible persons with orthopedic disabilities.
Benefits: - **Financial Assistance:** Up to the limit of 50% of the basic cost of the electric scooter + 50% of the disability kit or ₹25,000/-.
Eligibility:
- The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat.
- The applicant must be between 18 to 50 years of age.
- The applicant must have an orthopedic disability of 40% or more, certified by a civil surgeon.
- The applicant must possess a Disability Identity Card issued by the Social Security Department.
- The applicant must be listed in the BPL (Below Poverty Line) category with a score of 0 to 20.
- The applicant must not have already availed benefits under this scheme in the last five years, unless the previously allotted electric scooter is damaged and the applicant remains otherwise eligible.
- The applicant must purchase the electric scooter from an agency approved by JEDA at the government-approved price.

**Note:** The applicant will be given priority if their name appears in the SECC-2011 (Socio-Economic Caste Census) data.

schemeName: PMMSY: Live Fish Vending Centres Scheme - Haryana
Details:
The "Live Fish Vending Center" Scheme was launched by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY). It aims to promote hygienic fish vending and improve fish transportation and marketing infrastructure. Under this scheme, financial assistance in the form of a subsidy is provided for setting up a live fish vending center, which may be a fixed center, mobile unit, or a combination of both.
The scheme aims to support fishers by providing financial assistance for live fish vending centers. A subsidy per unit is provided under PMMSY.
Benefits: **Monetary Benefit:** - Financial assistance of ₹20,00,000/- per unit for setting up a live fish vending center. - Subsidy of 40% of unit cost for general category beneficiaries. - Subsidy of 60% of unit cost for Scheduled Caste and women beneficiaries.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a fisherman.
1. The applicant must have a valid Family Identity Card (Parivar Pehchan Patra).
1. The applicant should be engaged in fishery-related activities.
1. The applicant must ensure proper operation and maintenance of the vending center.
1. The applicant will receive assistance for only one live fish vending center.
1. The government will not be responsible for any operational loss or damage.

schemeName: Sindhu Darshan Scheme
Details:
Launched in 2017, the scheme "Sindhu Darshan Scheme" by the Tourism Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance to pilgrims from Gujarat undertaking the Sindhu Darshan Yatra in Leh-Ladakh, promoting cultural unity. The scheme provides a one-time financial assistance of ₹15,000/- to eligible pilgrims and supports a maximum of 300 pilgrims per financial year. To be eligible, the applicant must be a native of Gujarat and must submit proof of completing the yatra within 60 days of its conclusion. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat Holy Pilgrimage Development Board. The applications are accepted offline via a prescribed form available on the official website.
The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹15,000/- to pilgrims from Gujarat undertaking the Sindhu Darshan Yatra in Leh-Ladakh, fostering national unity. Intended beneficiaries include native Gujaratis who complete the yatra and apply within 60 days.
Benefits:
**Financial Assistance:** One-time grant of ₹15,000/- per pilgrim.
**Beneficiary Cap:** Limited to 300 pilgrims per financial year.
**Disbursement Condition:** Proof of yatra completion must be submitted within 60 days.
**Validity:** Once in a lifetime per pilgrim.
Eligibility:
- The applicant must be a native of Gujarat.
- The applicant must have completed the Sindhu Darshan Yatra.
- The applicant must submit the application within 60 days of completing the yatra.
- The applicant must not have availed the benefit before under this scheme.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should take a printout of the [prescribed format](https://yatradham.gujarat.gov.in/Documents/Scheme_2022-8-23_752.pdf) of the application form. **Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields (details of the authorized travel agent/organizer, details of the pilgrims), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). **Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to **"Gujarat Holy Pilgrimage Development Board, Old Secretariat, Gandhinagar"** within 60 days of yatra completion. _*Retain a copy of the submitted application for future reference._
**Verification & Disbursement** The board processes applications, and financial assistance is credited to the beneficiary’s account.

schemeName: Handicraft Mela Participation
Details:
The scheme "Handicraft Mela Participation" by the Industrial Extension Cottage (iNDEXT-C), Industries & Mines Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to promote traditional handicrafts by providing artisans and organizations with platforms to showcase and sell their products at state and national-level fairs. The scheme facilitates participation in designated melas (fairs) by covering logistical support and stall allocations. Eligible applicants include individual artisans, self-help groups (SHGs), and registered handicraft organizations. The scheme is implemented by Indext-C (Industrial Extension Bureau, Gujarat), and applications are accepted offline through district offices or the Indext-C portal.
The scheme enables artisans and handicraft organizations to participate in government-sponsored melas across Gujarat and other states, fostering market access and preserving traditional crafts. Benefits include subsidized stall fees, promotional support, sales opportunities for handmade products.
Benefits:
**Stall Allocation:** Free or subsidized stalls at designated melas.
**Promotional Support:** Marketing and branding assistance for participants.
**Sales Platform:** Direct access to customers and bulk buyers.
**Logistical Aid:** Basic infrastructure (tables, signage) provided at mela venues.
**Financial Incentives:** Priority for artisans from SC/ST/SEBC/EWS categories.
Eligibility:
**For Individual Artisans** - The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant must possess a valid Artisan ID Card issued by Indext-C or a recognized authority. - The applicant must specialize in a traditional handicraft listed under the scheme (e.g., embroidery, pottery, woodwork).
**For Organizations/SHGs** - The applicant must be a registered cluster/cooperative society/NGO. - The applicant must have a minimum of 10 artisans affiliated with the organization. - The applicant must submit audit reports and registration certificates.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should take a printout of the [prescribed format](https://craftofgujarat.gujarat.gov.in/Documents/SubDeal__2025-2-13_96.pdf) of the application form from the Indext-C website.
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields ( personal/organization details, artisan ID, and handicraft category, etc), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form, along with the documents, either to your nearest [District Industries Office](https://www.cottage.gujarat.gov.in/Home-2140795B5D2D-282472282472-2824725B5D2D) or to the following address: **Indext-C Headquarters, Industrial Extension Cottage, Block No. 7, 1st Floor, Udyog Bhavan, Sector-11, Gandhinagar - 382 011.**
The Indext-C will review the applications and notify the selected participants via SMS/email.

- Artisan ID Card (for Individuals).
- Aadhaar Card (Proof of Residence).
- Caste Certificate (if applying under SC/ST/SEBC/EWS Quota).
- Organization Registration Proof (for SHGs/Clusters).
- Bank Account Details (for Disbursements).
- Recent Passport-Sized Photograph.
- Handicraft Samples (Photographs or Physical Samples, if requested).
- Audit Reports (for Organizations).

schemeName: PMMSY: Fish Feed Plants of Production Capacity of at least 100 Ton/Day - Haryana
Details:
The Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Fish Feed Plants of Production Capacity of at least 100 Ton/Day, introduced by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to provide capital subsidy for setting up fish feed plants with a minimum production capacity of 100 tons per day. The objective is to enhance the availability of high-quality and affordable feed for fish farmers, supporting the expansion of aquaculture in Haryana. This is a Centrally Sponsored Scheme, under which the project is jointly funded by the Central and State Governments: 50% of the subsidy amount is contributed by the Central Government, and 50% is provided by the State Government. Beneficiaries are expected to operate and maintain the plant independently and ensure the supply of feed to fishers at affordable prices.
This scheme provides capital subsidy for setting up fish feed plants with a minimum production capacity of 100 tons per day, under the Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY) to general , schedule caste and women beneficiaries .
Benefits:
- The project cost is ₹650,00,000/-

> **Subsidy Distribution :**


1. A 40% subsidy is available for the General Category.
1. A 60% subsidy is offered for SC (Scheduled Caste) and Women beneficiaries.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant must be a resident of Haryana and possess a valid Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).
1. The applicant must own land or hold a registered lease of at least 10 years.
1. The applicant must be willing to operate, maintain, and manage the feed plant after its construction.
1. The applicant must ensure that the feed plant provides an affordable feed supply to fishers and fish farmers.
1. The applicant must submit a valid Detailed Project Report (DPR) or Self-Contained Proposal (SCP) in accordance with PMMSY guidelines.
1. The applicant must hold a valid training certificate relevant to feed mill operation and maintenance.
1. The applicant must ensure that the land is free from legal disputes and must provide a valid land title.

schemeName: Gunwatta Evam Navachar Nishulk Pathya Pustak Yojana
Details:
&quot;Gunwatta Evam Navachar Nishulk Pathya Pustak Yojana&quot; implemented by the Department of Education, Uttarakhand, ensures the free distribution of textbooks each year to all students from Class 1 to 8. This initiative applies to government schools, government-aided institutions, and recognized madrasas that follow the curriculum prescribed by the state government. There is no selection process involved; all enrolled students, both boys and girls, automatically receive the textbooks at no cost.
Under "Gunwatta Evam Navachar Nishulk Pathya Pustak Yojana", free textbooks are provided to all boys and girls studying from Class 1 to 8 in government and government-aided schools and recognized madrasas that implement the state-prescribed curriculum.

schemeName: ICSSR Doctoral Fellowship
Details:
The Fellowship is aimed at promoting original, socially relevant, and policy-focused research in the social sciences. The fellowship provides financial support through a monthly grant of ₹20,000 and an annual contingency grant of ₹20,000 for up to two years, with an initial award period of one year, which is renewed for the second year subject to fulfilment of requisite criteria. It also offers institutional and short-term fellowships including a six-month short term fellowship for scholars nearing Ph.D. submission (minimum three years of completed PhD research) and a standalone contingency grant of ₹62,500 for specific research needs. Applications are invited through ICSSR’s website and social media platforms. Fellows are expected to pursue full-time research, submit regular progress reports, and provide a final submission that includes published work, a book-length thesis, and audited financial records.  Given India's social science ecosystem, it seeks to promote research excellence, evidence-based research, and scholarship that is also relevant to policymakers.
The Indian Council of Social Science Research (ICSSR) offers Doctoral Fellowships to support full-time Ph.D. scholars engaged in high-quality research in the field of social and human sciences. These fellowships are awarded to Indian research scholars registered in Ph.D. programs at UGC-recognized u
Benefits:
1)	Monthly Fellowship amount @ Rs.20,000 per month
2)	Contingency Grant @ Rs.20,000 per annum
Eligibility:
1)	Applicant must be an Indian citizen.
2)	Must be a full-time bonafide Ph.D. scholar in a social science discipline in a UGC-recognized university, deemed-to-be university, institute of national importance, ICSSR Research Institute, or college with approved Ph.D. programme.
3)	The Ph.D. topic must have been confirmed by the DRC/authorised statutory body of the institution on or before the last date of call for applications.
4)	Age must be below 40 years as on the last date of application.
5)	Age relaxation of 5 years allowed for SC/ST/OBC-(NCL) candidates and Persons with Benchmark Disabilities (PwD).
6)	Must have secured a minimum of 55% marks in post-graduation, with 5% relaxation for reserved categories (SC/ST/OBC-(NCL)/PwD).

Application Process.process:
Step 01: Visit [ICSSR website](https://www.icssr.org) - www.icssr.org - and navigate to Fellowships section.
Step 02: Click on Doctoral Fellowship Scheme.
Step 03: Register/Login to the ICSSR portal.
Step 04: Fill the online application form.
Step 05: Upload documents and submit.

Documents Required: The list of documents required will be given in the Application Form when the Call is announced.

schemeName: Pandit Dindayal Upadhyay Awas Yojana (Developing Caste Welfare) (EBC)

The scheme aims to support Economically Weaker Sections (EWS) by offering financial aid up to ₹1,20,000/- for house construction. This scheme also ensures that the Economically Weaker Sections receive support in securing shelter.
The scheme aims to support Economically Weaker Sections (EWS) by offering financial aid up to ₹1,20,000/- for house construction. This scheme also ensures that Economically Weaker Sections receive support in securing shelter.

schemeName: Contract Khel Prashikshakon Ki Niyukti
Details:
The scheme “Contract Khel Prashikshakon Ki Niyukti” implemented by the Department Of Sports, Uttarakhand, aims to appoint contract-based sports coaches to conduct local training camps for various sports across the state, benefiting approximately 250 coaches annually with employment. Coaches aged 21-70 years, with relevant qualifications, can apply, and permanent residency is not mandatory.
The scheme facilitates the annual appointment of contract-based sports trainers for conducting various local training camps across Uttarakhand, thereby promoting employment opportunities and strengthening grassroots sports infrastructure.
Benefits: - **Employment Opportunity:** Provides annual employment to approximately 250 sports coaches on a contract basis.  - **Promotion of Sports:** Facilitates the organization of local training camps for various sports, contributing to sports development.  - **Skill Utilization:** Offers a platform for qualified individuals with sports expertise to contribute to athlete development.
Eligibility:
- The applicant must be a sportsperson or a coach.
  - The applicant must be between 21 -70 years of age.
  - The applicant must possess relevant educational qualifications.
  - The applicant must possess relevant sports qualifications.

> Note: The applicant is not required to be a permanent/native resident of the state.
