schemeName: Chief Minister's Higher Education Research Promotion Scheme
Details:
The scheme &quot;Chief Minister&#39;s Higher Education Research Promotion Scheme&quot; was launched by the Department of Higher Education, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote high-quality, interdisciplinary research in higher education institutions across the state. Under this scheme, a one-time research grant of up to ₹15,00,000 is provided, which may be extended to ₹18,00,000 in special cases. Additionally, a monthly stipend of ₹5,000 is offered for research assistants.
The broad subject areas eligible for research include Science, Arts and Humanities, Home Science, Commerce, and Management. However, interdisciplinary research proposals are also encouraged. Priority will be given to research proposals focusing on specific problems and those falling under the Problem and Action-Based Research Programme.
The scheme aims to promote high-quality, interdisciplinary research in higher education institutions across the state. Under this scheme, a one-time research grant of up to ₹15 lakhs (extendable to ₹18 Lakhs in special cases) is provided, alongwith a monthly stipend of ₹5,000 for research assistant.
Benefits:
**One-Time Research Grant:**

- Up to ₹15,00,000/- per project, extendable to ₹18,00,000/- in special circumstances.

**Monthly Stipend:**

- ₹5,000/- per month for research assistants from the start to the completion of the research.

**Disbursement Details:**

- **Mode:** Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the institution's Research & Development cell.- **Frequency:** In three installments - 50% upon approval, 30% after submission of the utilization certificate, and 20% upon completion of the research.- **Validity:** Funds must be utilized within the approved research timeline.
**Note 1:** Research must be original and align with UGC standards.
**Note 2:** The research duration is up to 2 years, extendable by 1 year in special cases.
**Note 3:** Only one research project is permissible per researcher at a time.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.
   1. The applicant should be a regular faculty member, student, or research scholar in government colleges or state university campuses.
   1. Research proposals should fall under Science, Arts and Humanities, Home Science, Commerce, Management, or interdisciplinary areas.
   1. Research proposals related to Uttarakhand that demonstrate productivity and utility in social, economic, contemporary, or other areas of special importance will be encouraged.
   1. Priority will be given to proposals that focus on specific problems and fall under the Problem and Action-Based Research Programme.
   1. Research proposals may also be invited based on specific requests from state government departments.

**Note:** A co-research investigator can also be included along with the principal research investigator in the research proposal.

schemeName: Financial Assistance to Permanent Residents of Uttarakhand for Religious Pilgrimages
Details:
The scheme "Financial Assistance to Permanent Residents of Uttarakhand for Religious Pilgrimages" by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Uttarakhand, aims to promote religious travel and pilgrimage by providing financial assistance to eligible permanent residents of the state who participate in and complete the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra. Through this scheme, monetary benefits are provided to Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes, and other permanent residents of Uttarakhand. The scheme is implemented by Kumaon Mandal Vikas Nigam. The financial assistance is processed after the submission and verification of required documents and confirmation of successful Yatra completion.
The scheme aims to promote religious tourism by supporting eligible residents who complete the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra. Financial assistance is provided upon completion.
Benefits:
1. A financial grant of ₹50,000 is provided to eligible Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe residents of Uttarakhand who participate in the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra organised by the Government of India. 1. Permanent residents of the state from other categories who complete the Yatra via the Uttarakhand route are also eligible for financial support through Kumaon Mandal Vikas Nigam.
> **Mode of Disbursement:** - Direct benefit transfer (DBT) post-verification and approval. > **Frequency of Disbursement:** - One-time benefit.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant should have successfully completed the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra organised by the Government of India. 1. The applicant should have undertaken the Yatra via the Uttarakhand route.
> **Preference / Priority / Reservation / Relaxation:** - The applicant belonging to the Scheduled Castes or the Scheduled Tribes is entitled to financial assistance of ₹50,000.

Application Process.process:
> **Registration Process:**

**Step 1:** Visit [Apuni Sarkar](https://eservices.uk.gov.in/) and click on the “Sign Up Here” button.
**Step 2:** Fill in the required details, i.e. Email ID, Gender, Name, Mobile Number, Date of Birth, District, Tehsil, Address of Applicant, and  Notifications Language Preference.
**Step 3:** Click on “Submit”.
<br>

> **Post-Registration Process:**

**Step 1:** Visit [Apuni Sarkar](https://eservices.uk.gov.in/) portal.
**Step 2:** In the “Citizen Login” window, enter your phone number/mail id, correct password and captcha code.
**Step 3:** Click on the  “Sign In” button.
**Step 4:** From the left side menu button click on “DBT Services”, then choose the &quot;Department of Culture.&quot;
**Step 5:** Now, click on the scheme “Financial Assistance to Permanent Residents of Uttarakhand for Religious Pilgrimages”.
**Step 6:** Enter the mobile number and verify with the OTP.
**Step 7:** Click on the checkbox for WhatsApp Verification (for receiving updates regarding your application via WhatsApp).

Documents Required:

1. Certificate issued by Kumaon Mandal Vikas Nigam confirming completion of the Yatra via the specified route
1. Copy of the applicant’s passport, visa, boarding pass, and entry-exit stamp
1. Aadhaar card copy of the applicant

schemeName: Training and Tour Unit
Details:
"Training and Tour Unit" Scheme by the Department of Agriculture Extension, Government of Uttarakhand aims to enhance agricultural knowledge and practices among farmers, rural youth, and extension workers. Through this scheme, training and informational sessions on agriculture and allied subjects are provided to the intended beneficiaries to strengthen their practical understanding and skills. The scheme is implemented by the Extension Education Directorate of the concerned university. These training programs include both classroom learning and field visits, ensuring practical exposure. The initiative contributes to rural development by building human resource capacity in agriculture. It also ensures the timely dissemination of agricultural innovations and best practices.
"Training and Tour Unit" scheme by the Department of Agriculture Extension, Government of Uttarakhand aims to provide agricultural training to farmers, rural youth, and extension workers through university-led programs and field tours.
Benefits:
- Beneficiaries receive hands-on training in agriculture and related fields like horticulture, animal husbandry, and rural entrepreneurship.
- Helps participants improve their practical skills and understanding of government agricultural schemes.
- Includes educational tours to top agricultural institutes, farms, and exhibitions to learn best practices.
- Training Mode: Conducted offline through workshops, seminars, and field visits at university or selected locations.
- Training Frequency: Held every year as per the university's annual plan; extra sessions are arranged when needed by local departments.
Eligibility:
The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.
The applicant should be a farmer, rural youth, or an extension worker.
The applicant should have a basic interest or background in agriculture or allied fields.

Application Process.process:
Step 1: The university issues an annual training action plan.

Step 2: Interested beneficiaries must register for the desired program/module through the university extension office or designated platform.

Step 3: Selection is based on requirement, priority group, and availability of seats.

Step 4: Additional training is also arranged as per the requirement of regional departments, especially during exhibitions and agriculture fairs.

Documents Required:
- Residential Proof (e.g., Voter ID, Electricity Bill)
- Passport Size Photograph
- Educational Qualification Certificate (if applicable)
- Certificate of Occupation (for Extension Workers or Farmers)
- Previous Participation Certificate (if applying for advanced level or refresher training)
- Application Form as per University Guidelines

schemeName: Deen Dayal Upadhyay Grah Aawas Vikas Yojana
Details:
Launched in 2018, the scheme "Deen Dayal Upadhyay Grah Aawas Vikas Yojna" by the Department of Tourism, Government of Uttarakhand, aims to prevent continuous migration in the state, providing employment, familiarising them with local culture and products. Through this scheme, the government aims to provide an unprecedented experience to domestic and foreign tourists visiting Uttarakhand, as well as for the prosperity of the local people. Now you can improve your financial condition by using your home as a tourist resting place. The scheme is implemented by the Uttarakhand Tourism Development Board (UTDB).
> **Objectives:** 1. To prevent continuous migration in the state. 1. To provide employment to local residents. 1. To introduce tourists to local culture and products. 1. To offer financial incentives for homestay renovations and operations. 1. To train homestay operators in hospitality. 1. To promote the scheme through a dedicated, separate website and mobile app. The Scheme aim to provide an unprecedented experience to domestic and foreign tourists visiting Uttarakhand, as well as for the prosperity of the local people. Now you can improve your financial condition by using your home as a tourist resting place.
Benefits:
> **Monetary Subsidies:-** 1. 25% of the project cost in the plains or ₹7,50,000 (whichever is less), will be payable as a subsidy. 1. 50% of the interest payable on the loan will be payable at a maximum rate of ₹1,00,000 per annum, in the first five years. 1. 50% of the interest payable on the loan will be payable at a maximum rate of ₹1,00,000 per annum, in the first five years. > **Non-Monetary Benefits:-** 1. For the setup of Homestay/Home renovation, Government assistance will also be provided to eligible applicants in case of a loan taken from the bank for renovation of the house. 1. The amount of SGST on the income received from home stay will be reimbursed by the department for the first three years. 1. Reimbursement of the chargeable fee payable on the bond deed against the sanction of a business loan up to a limit of ₹30,00,000. 1. No change of land will be required for upgradation, furnishing, maintenance and construction of new toilets up to a limit of ₹2,00,000 in old buildings. 1. Hospitality training is provided to homestay operators. 1. Promotion through a dedicated website and mobile app.
> **Mode of Disbursement:** > Through nationalised/scheduled commercial banks, state cooperative banks, or regional rural banks.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a native/permanent resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant should reside in the same building where the homestay is being operated.
1. The applicant’s homestay building should be located outside the limits of the Municipal Corporation.
1. The applicant should provide a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 6 rooms for guests.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1: Visit the Official Portal** - Go to the [official website](https://msy.uk.gov.in) of Uttarakhand Swarojgar Yojnaie. **Step 2: Select the Scheme** - On the homepage, click on “Deen Dayal Upadhyay Grah Aawas Vikas Yojana”, it will redirect to the [Scheme](https://msy.uk.gov.in/frontend/web/index.php) Page. **Step 3: Apply for the Scheme** - Click on the “[Apply for Scheme](https://msy.uk.gov.in/frontend/web/index.php)” button. **Step 4: Register Using Mobile Number** - You will be redirected to the [[login](https://msy.uk.gov.in/frontend/web/site/mobilelogin) page.](https://msy.uk.gov.in/frontend/web/site/mobilelogin)- Enter your mobile number and verify using OTP. - Click “Register” to proceed. - After registration, you will get a unique user ID. **Step 5: Fill in Applicant Details** - Enter your Aadhaar Number, Full Name, Email ID, Mobile Number, Gender, Date of Birth, PAN Number, Educational Qualification, Caste Category and Special Category (if any), Full Address including District, Block, and Location and PIN Code. **Step 6: Enter Unit/ Project details:** - Fill in details about your proposed unit: Type of Unit: New or Existing, Nature of Unit: Manufacturing / Service / Trade, Name of the Unit, Land/Plot Details (Area, Ownership Type – Self/Leased/Family), Location: District, Tehsil, Block, Village/Town, Tourism/Natural Importance of the Site (if applicable) and Availability of Infrastructure: Road, Electricity, Water, Communication. **Step 7: Add Production/Service Details:** - Select the appropriate NIC Code (industry classification), and mention the name of the product/service, estimated annual production, and unit of production. **Step 8: Enter Financial & Scheme Details:** - Choose the Scheme Category (e.g., Dairy, Boutique, Food Processing), Investment Breakdown: Capital Investment (₹), Applicant’s Own Contribution (₹), Loan Requirement (₹), Total Project Cost (₹). - Also included are working capital, machinery/equipment quotations, construction/furniture Costs, and miscellaneous expenses. - Mention projected details, i.e, Monthly Income, Monthly Expenditure, and Net Profit. **Step 9: Employment Projection:** - Mention the number of workers to be employed: Skilled / Unskilled and Male / Female **Step 10: Add Bank Details** - Fill in the Bank Name, IFSC Code, Account Number, Branch Name & Address. **Step 11: Upload Required Documents** - Attach clear scanned copies of: Aadhaar Card, PAN Card, Educational Certificates, Caste Certificate (if applicable), Land Ownership/Lease Document, Bank Passbook Copy, Quotation for Equipment/Furniture, Passport-size Photograph, and Affidavit and Detailed Project Report (DPR) (as per format) **Step 12: Save and Proceed** - Click “Save & Next” after entering all the necessary information. **Step 13: Final Submission** - Review the entire application form carefully. - Click on “Final Submit” to complete your application.
> **Track Your Application** > You can log in anytime using your mobile number and OTP to: - Check the status of your application - View or download your submitted application form

Documents Required:
1. Aadhaar Card
1. PAN Card
1. Educational Certificates
1. Caste Certificate (if applicable)
1. Land Ownership/Lease Document
1. Bank Passbook Copy
1. Quotation for Equipment/Furniture
1. Passport-size Photograph
1. Affidavit and Detailed Project Report (DPR) (as per format)

schemeName: Kailash Darshan Yatra
Details:
Launched in 2001, the scheme "Kailash Darshan Yatra" by the Gujarat Holy Pilgrimage Development Board, Tourism Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance to pilgrims from Gujarat undertaking the sacred Kailash Mansarovar pilgrimage. The scheme offers one-time financial assistance to selected applicants who complete the yatra. To be eligible, the applicant must be a selected pilgrim from Gujarat and submit proof of yatra completion within 90 days. Applications for this scheme are accepted offline.
The scheme provides financial assistance to pilgrims from Gujarat undertaking the Kailash Darshan Yatra. To be eligible, the applicant must be a selected pilgrim from Gujarat and submit proof of yatra completion within 90 days. Applications for this scheme are accepted offline.
Benefits:
One-time financial assistance is provided to the pilgrim for undertaking the Kailash Darshan Yatra.
**Validity:** Once in a lifetime per pilgrim.
_*The scheme guidelines do not specify the amount of the benefit; applicants should verify with the authorities._
Eligibility:
- The applicant must be a pilgrim from Gujarat.
- The applicant must have completed the Kailash Darshan Yatra.
- The applicant must apply within 90 days of yatra completion.
- The applicant must not have availed of the benefit before under this scheme.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should take a printout of the [prescribed format](https://yatradham.gujarat.gov.in/Documents/SubDeals_2018-9-27_365.pdf) of the application form. **Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields (details of the authorized travel agent/organizer, details of the pilgrims), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). **Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to **"Gujarat Holy Pilgrimage Development Board, Old Secretariat, Gandhinagar"** within 90 days of yatra completion. _*Retain a copy of the submitted application for future reference._
**Verification & Disbursement** The board processes applications, and financial assistance is credited to the beneficiary’s account.

Documents Required:
- Copy of Passport
- Certificate of Participation
- Proof of Selection
- Bank Details (for disbursement)

schemeName: Self-Employment Scheme for Scheduled Castes and Tribes
Details:
The "Self-Employment Scheme for Scheduled Castes and Tribes" scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to promote self-employment and sustainable livelihood among scheduled caste/ scheduled tribe families living below the poverty line. Under this scheme, provides loans through various banks to scheduled caste families living below the poverty line for projects up to ₹20,000 to ₹7,00,000/- in agriculture, services, business, and transport. The scheme offers a government subsidy of 50% of the project cost or a maximum of ₹10,000/-.
> **Illustrative Ventures:** Agricultural Equipment, Automobile Workshops, Band Parties, Orchestras, Beauty Parlors, Bicycle Repair, Biogas Plants, Barber Shops, Bookbinding, Brick Making, Bullock Carts, Cable Tv, Candle Making, Greeting Card Making, Carpet Industry, Cloth Business, Copper Industry, Departmental Stores, Dhabas and Restaurants, Driving Schools, Fruit and Flower Production, Flour and Rice Mills, Goat Rearing, Bakeries, General Stores (Pansari Ki Dukan), Hosiery, Bamboo Furniture Making, Wooden Furniture Making, Leather Goods Manufacturing, Shoe Making, Cement Block Making, Beekeeping, Nursing Homes, Poultry Farming, Printing Presses, Pottery Work, Sweet Shops, Tailoring Shops, Tire Servicing, Lamination, PCO/STD Booths, Tent Houses, Auto-taxis, Marble Polishing, Sale and Repair of Electrical Goods, Fast Food Shops, Etc. The scheme aims to support scheduled castes and scheduled tribes families below the poverty line through concessional loans and subsidies for self-employment in various sectors.
Benefits: > **Financial Assistance:** - **Loan Amount:** Project loans from ₹20,000/- to ₹7,00,000/- through nationalized banks.- **Subsidy:** 50% of the project cost or up to ₹10,000/- as government subsidy.- **Margin Money:** 25% of project cost provided at 4% annual interest.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant must belong to a Scheduled Castes and Tribes community.
1. The applicant must be living below the poverty line.
1. The applicant annual income must not exceed ₹15,975/- in rural areas and ₹21,206/- in urban areas.
1. The applicant must not be a defaulter of any bank or financial institution.
1. The applicant must not have availed any subsidy from any government scheme earlier.
1. The applicant must possess a commercial driving license.
Documents Required:
- Passport-size Photograph.
- BPL Card.
- Caste Certificate (Issued by Tehsildar).
- Income Certificate (Issued by Tehsildar/BDO).
- Bank Details. 
- Any Other Document if Required.

schemeName: Mill Gate Price Subsidy Scheme
Details:
Launched in 2007, the "Mill Gate Price Subsidy Scheme", implemented by the Commissioner of Cottage and Rural Industries, Industries & Mines Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide quality yarn at subsidized rates to handloom weavers, ensuring affordability and improved product quality. The scheme offers freight reimbursement (1–8.5% based on yarn type and region) and a 15% subsidy on yarn purchases from NHDC-recognized depots. Eligible beneficiaries include handloom cooperatives, NGOs, and development centers. The scheme is implemented through District Industries Centers (DICs) and aims to sustain employment for economically weak weavers, especially from Scheduled Castes.
The scheme provides 15% subsidy on yarn purchases from NHDC depots to handloom weavers, cooperatives, and NGOs, along with freight reimbursement (1–8.5%). Intended beneficiaries include weavers below the poverty line.
Benefits:
**Yarn Purchase Subsidy** 15% subsidy on yarn bought from NHDC-recognized depots.
**Freight Reimbursement** - Non-Silk/Jute Yarn: Plain Area: 1.00%, Hills/Remote: 1.75%, North-East: 3.00% - Silk Yarn: Plain Area: 1.00%, Hills/Remote: 1.25%, North-East: 1.50% - Jute/Jute Blended Yarn: Plain Area: 7.00%, Hills/Remote: 8.00%, North-East: 8.50% _*Additional 2.5% depot operating charges._
**Disbursement Mode** 15% subsidy credited via RTGS/e-payment. Freight reimbursement is processed separately.
Eligibility:
- The applicant must be a handloom cooperative society, NGO, or development center.
- The applicant must purchase yarn from NHDC-recognized depots (e.g., Gujarat State Handloom & Handicrafts Development Corporation).

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should first purchase the yarn from NHDC-recognized depots (e.g., 12 depots in Surendranagar, 1 in Ahmedabad).
**Step 2:** Visit the District Industries Centre (DIC) of his district, and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the designated staff.
**Step 3:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents, within the prescribed period (if any), to the designated staff at the DIC.
**Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned staff to whom the application has been submitted.

Documents Required:
- Purchase Invoices From NHDC-recognized Depots.
- Proof of Registration (for Cooperatives/NGOs).
- Freight Receipts (for Reimbursement Claims).
- Bank Details for Subsidy Disbursement.

schemeName: Free Training for Vehicle Drivers
Details:
The &quot;Free Training for Vehicle Drivers&quot; scheme was implemented by the Transport Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to enhance driving skills and promote self-employment among scheduled caste and scheduled tribe individuals. Under this scheme, free professional driving training is provided to candidates for light, heavy, and refresher vehicle courses. The scheme also aims to reduce road accidents and improve driving capabilities in the SC/ST communities. The scheme is implemented by the Institute of Driving and Traffic Research (IDTR), Dehradun.
Under this scheme, free driving training is provided to scheduled caste and scheduled tribe candidates to improve driving skills and promote self-employment.
Benefits:
> **Free Driving Training:**


- Training is offered in Light Motor Vehicle (Commercial), Heavy Motor Vehicle (Commercial), and Refresher Courses.

> **Validity**


- There is no fixed validity period.

> **Renewal**


- No renewal is required.

> **Fees**


- **Free Training** – Training under this scheme will be completely free of cost. No fee will be charged from the applicant.
Eligibility:
**General Eligibility:**

1. The applicant should belong to a Scheduled Caste or Scheduled Tribe category.
1. The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant must possess a valid light or heavy motor vehicle license.

**Eligibility for Light Motor Vehicle (Commercial Course):**

- The applicant must possess a valid light motor vehicle (non-transport) license that is at least 1 year old.

**Eligibility for Heavy Motor Vehicle (Commercial Course):**

- The applicant must possess a light motor vehicle (transport) license that is at least 1 year old.

**For Refresher Courses:**

- Applicant must possess a valid license to drive either a light or heavy motor vehicle.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Institute of Driving and Traffic Research (IDTR), Dehradun and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the concerned Institute of Driving and Traffic Research (IDTR).
> **Notes:**


- After scrutiny of the received applications, admission to the training program will be provided on a first-come, first-served basis.
- Applications can be submitted at any time of the year, and training will commence once a batch is formed.

Documents Required:
**For Light Motor Vehicle (Commercial Course):**

1. Aadhaar Card of the Applicant
1. Caste Certificate
1. One Passport Size Photograph
1. High School Certificate or 8th Class Transfer Certificate
1. Valid Non-Transport Light Motor Vehicle License (Minimum 1 year old)

**For Heavy Motor Vehicle (Commercial Course):**

1. Aadhaar Card of the Applicant
1. Caste Certificate
1. One Passport Size Photograph
1. High School Certificate or 8th Class Transfer Certificate
1. Valid Transport Light Motor Vehicle License (Minimum 1 year old)

**For Refresher Courses:**

1. Aadhaar Card of the Applicant
1. Valid Driving License for Light or Heavy Motor Vehicle

schemeName: Pension Scheme for Artisans
Details:
The &quot;Pension Scheme for Artisans&quot; was launched by the Department of Industries, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to provide financial security and dignity to senior traditional artisans aged 60 years and above. Under this scheme, artisans who are already receiving an old-age pension and belong to a family living below the poverty line are granted an additional incentive of ₹400/- per month.
> **Objective**

The scheme supports artisans involved in traditional crafts like stone, wood, iron, bamboo, ringaal, natural fibres, etc., particularly those from below-poverty-line (BPL) families.
Under this scheme, an additional monthly incentive of ₹400/- is provided to senior artisans aged 60 or above who are already receiving old-age pension and belong to below-poverty-line (BPL) families.
Benefits:
- The monthly incentive of ₹400 is provided to senior artisans who are already receiving old-age pension. 

> **Note:**

Payment is made quarterly (every 3 months) via the bank account or post office account of the beneficiary.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant should be an artisan.
1. The applicant should be engaged in traditional profession crafts like stone, wood, iron, bamboo, papermaking, ringaal, natural fibre crafts, etc.
1. The applicant's age should be 60 years or above. 
1. The applicant is already receiving an old-age pension from the government.
1. The applicant should belong to a BPL (Below Poverty Line) family.
1. If the artisan's son or grandson is aged 20 years or more and the family still lives below the poverty line, the applicant remains eligible.
1. The applicant should be approved as an artisan under criteria set by the state government from time to time.

Application Process.process:
> **Application Process:**

**Step 1:** The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the General Manager, District Industries Centre and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.
**OR**
The interested applicant downloads the application form from the [official website](https://doi.uk.gov.in/mysite/home). 
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the General Manager, District Industries Centre.
> **Post-application Process:**

**Step 1:** A district-level committee, chaired by the General Manager, DIC, reviews and verifies all applications.
**Step 2:** Eligible artisans are selected based on documents and eligibility norms.

Documents Required:
1. Aadhaar Card Copy
1. Bank Account Details
1. Old-Age Pension Certificate
1. BPL Certificate
1. Date of Birth Proof (Birth Certificate or Aadhaar)
1. Certified Copy of Family Register
1. Proof of Being a Recognized Artisan (Certificate from authorized body)

schemeName: Assistance for Purchase of Traditional Musical Instruments and Costumes for Scheduled Caste/Tribe Individuals
Details:
The &quot;Assistance for Purchase of Traditional Musical Instruments and Costumes for Scheduled Caste/Tribe Individuals&quot; scheme was launched by the Department of Culture and Endowments, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to support scheduled caste and scheduled tribe individuals whose livelihood depends on traditional arts by providing them with essential musical instruments and costumes. Under this scheme, folk artists and performers who do not possess traditional musical instruments and costumes are provided these items free of cost. Assistance is limited to one eligible artist per family.
The scheme aims to support scheduled caste/tribe individuals whose livelihood depends on traditional arts by providing them with essential musical instruments & costumes. Under this scheme, traditional musical instruments & traditional costumes are provided free of cost to folk artists & performers.
Benefits:
**Free Traditional Musical Instruments:**

- Dhol, Damau, Masakbeen, Ransingha, Turahi, Nagada, Dhal Talwar, and other traditional instruments are provided at no cost. 

**Free Traditional Costumes:**

- Traditional attire required for performances is provided free of cost.

**Livelihood Support:**

- Enables artists to continue their traditional art practices and maintain an income source. 

> **Note:**


- Only one instrument was provided per artist in their lifetime.
- A maximum of one artist per family can benefit from the scheme.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant should belong to the scheduled caste or scheduled tribe community.
1. The applicant's monthly income should not exceed ₹2,000/-.
1. The applicant's source of income should be through traditional arts.
1. The applicant should not have traditional musical instruments and costumes.
1. The applicant should be engaged in folk art performances as primary occupation.
1. The applicant should not have received similar benefits from other government schemes.
1. Only one instrument set is provided per artist in a family under this scheme.

Application Process.process:
**To provide assistance under this scheme, an advertisement is issued by the Directorate of Culture. In response to the advertisement, concerned individuals should submit the application.**
> **Application Process**

**Step 1:** The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the office of Directorate of Culture and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.
**Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).
**Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the office of Directorate of Culture.
> **Selection and Approval Process:** 

**Step 1:** Committee headed by the Secretary, Culture Department reviews applications and selects eligible beneficiaries.
**Step 2:** Selected beneficiaries are notified and can collect their musical instruments and costumes from the Directorate office.

Documents Required:
1. Monthly Income Certificate (issued by the Tehsildar)
1. Artist/Musical Instrument Proficiency Certificate
1. Aadhaar Card
1. Caste Certificate
1. Bank Account Number and Bank IFSC Code
1. PAN Card
1. Permanent Residence Certificate
1. Affidavit (stating that no grants have been received from other schemes for similar purposes)

schemeName: Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar Sanskrit Scholarship Scheme for Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe Students
Details:
The "Dr. Bhimrao Ambedkar Sanskrit Scholarship Scheme for Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe Students" implemented by the Department of Sanskrit Education, Uttarakhand, supports Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) students studying in Sanskrit schools and colleges in Uttarakhand. The scheme encourages the continuation of Sanskrit education by providing a monthly scholarship of ₹251/- (₹3,012/- annually) to eligible students from Classes 6 to 12. It aims to uplift students from marginalized communities by ensuring their active participation in traditional and cultural education.

This scheme provides financial assistance to Scheduled Caste (SC) and Scheduled Tribe (ST) students studying in Sanskrit schools from Class 6 to 12 in Uttarakhand to promote Sanskrit education among disadvantaged communities.
Benefits: - **Scholarship Amount:** Monthly ₹251/- (₹3,012/- annually) to eligible students.
Eligibility:
- The applicant must be a Student.
  - The applicant must be studying in a Sanskrit school or college located in Uttarakhand.
  - The applicant must be enrolled in Class 6 to Class 12.
  - The applicant must belong to a Scheduled Caste (SC) or Scheduled Tribe (ST) category.
  - The applicant must possess a valid caste certificate issued by a competent authority.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** Eligible students enrolled in Class 6 to 12 must gather required documents such as Caste Certificate, Aadhaar Card, Bank Account details.
**Step 2:** Submit all documents to the school/college principal.
**Step 3:** The principal forwards applications to the Assistant Director of Sanskrit Education, Uttarakhand.
**Step 4:** The Assistant Director reviews and sends applications to the concerned Director for approval and disbursal.
> **Address and Contact Details:**

**Sanskrit Shiksha Vibhag**
**Uttarakhand Sanskrit Academy, Haridwar – Sanskrit Bhavanam, Ranipuhjalam, Jwalapur, Haridwaram**

<br>

**Uttarakhand Sanskrit Vishwavidyalaya, Haridwar – Bahadrabad, Haridwar, Delhi Rashtriya Rajmarg, P.O. Bahadrabad, Haridwar**
**Phone: 035-2665054**
**E-mail: registrar@usw.ac.in, ssnuk2011@gmail.com**

1. Aadhaar Card.

1. Any other documents as required.

schemeName: Financial Assistance to SC Students Appearing in the Mains Examination of UPSC
Details:
The 'Financial Assistance to SC students appearing in the Mains Examination of UPSC' scheme, administered by the Directorate of Welfare of Scheduled Castes and Backward Classes, Government of Assam, is designed to provide financial grants to Scheduled Caste (SC) students who qualify for the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) Mains Examination. Each eligible beneficiary will receive an amount of up to ₹50,000/-, subject to budgetary provisions. The disbursement of assistance is contingent upon the applicant satisfying the stipulated eligibility criteria and the successful submission of required documentation.
**The applications will be accepted through the myScheme platform from 04/07/2025 to 31/08/2025.** ***A DigiLocker account is required for application. Please refer to the Application Process section for details.***
The scheme provides financial grants to the SC students for appearing in the UPSC Mains Exam. An amount upto ₹50,000/- is provided to each beneficiary, subject to budget provision. The assistance is extended depending on the applicant satisfying the eligibility criteria and the documents submitted.
Benefits: An amount of up to ₹50,000/- is provided to each beneficiary, subject to budget provision.
Eligibility:
- The applicant must belong to a Scheduled Caste (SC) community of Assam.
- The applicant must have recently qualified for the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) Preliminary Examination held in 2025.
- The annual income of the applicant's parents/guardians must not exceed ₹5,00,000/-.

Application Process.process:
**The applications will be accepted through the myScheme platform from 04/07/2025 to 31/08/2025.**

schemeName: Award Scheme for Candidates Selected in NDA, IMA, OTA, INA, IAF
Details:
The scheme “Award Scheme for Candidates Selected in NDA, IMA, OTA, INA, IAF” was introduced by the Higher Education Department, Government of Uttarakhand. This scheme aims to recognize and reward candidates from Uttarakhand who have been selected for service at premier defence academies such as NDA, IMA, OTA, INA, and IAF and are either undergoing training or have been formally inducted into service. Under this scheme, a one-time award of ₹50,000/- is given to each eligible candidate in recognition of their achievement and contribution to national service.
Under this scheme, a one-time award of ₹50,000/- is given to each candidate from Uttarakhand who has been selected for service at premier defence academies such as the NDA, IMA, OTA, INA, and IAF, and is either undergoing training or has been formally inducted into service.
Benefits:
- One-time grant of ₹50,000/- per candidate. 

> **Note:**

The amount is disbursed every 6 months post-verification by the department.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.
   1. The candidate should have been selected for service at one of the premier defence academies, such as National Defence Academy (NDA), Indian Military Academy (IMA), Officers Training Academy (OTA), Indian Naval Academy (INA) or Indian Air Force (IAF).
   1.  The applicant should either be currently undergoing training at the respective academy or have been formally inducted into the defence service.
   1. The award is given only once under this scheme.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** The applicant should apply after being selected for service and completing the training. 
**Step 2:** The eligible applicant should visit (during office hours) the Directorate of Higher Education, Haldwani, and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications.
**OR**
The interested applicant downloads the application form from the [official website](https://he.uk.gov.in/). 
**Step 3:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required).
**Step 4:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Directorate of Higher Education, Haldwani.
***Note:*** _Upon primary verification at the departmental level and post-approval, the amount is disbursed within six months._

Documents Required:
1. Aadhaar Card
1. PAN Card
1. Bank Account details/Passbook
1. Domicile Certificate
1. Appointment Letter
1. Training Completion Certificate
1. Proof of Joining after Training
1. Self-declaration (stating that the benefit has not been claimed earlier under this scheme)

schemeName: Uttarakhand State Andolankari Pension to the Dependants (For Other State)
Details:
"Uttarakhand State Andolankari Pension to the Nominees/Dependents (For Other State)" is a social welfare scheme implemented by the Department of Home, Government of Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹4,500/- to the nominees/dependents of the injured agitators who were jailed for 7 days from other states during the Uttarakhand State Movement. This pension shall be entitled to the dependents of those agitators who are not recipients of any Andolankari Pension Schemes/any other government schemes or not employed in government service after their death.
"Uttarakhand State Andolankari Pension to the Dependants (For Other State)" is a social welfare scheme implemented by the Department of Home that provides a monthly pension to the dependents of the injured/jailed agitators from other states during the Uttarakhand State Movement.
Benefits: - A monthly pension of ₹4,500/-.
Eligibility:
1. Applicant should be a dependent of an agitator who was jailed for 7 days or injured during the Uttarakhand State Movement.
   1. Applicant should not be recipients of any Andolankari Pension Schemes/any other government schemes or not employed in government service.

**Step 3:** Submit the application at the office of the District Magistrate.

schemeName: Mukhya Mantri Agricultural Mechanization Scheme
Details:
The "Mukhya Mantri Agricultural Mechanization Scheme" launched by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to provide financial aid to farmers for the purchase of various modern farm implements and machinery. The scheme promotes mechanized farming and ensures timely agricultural operations for better yield and efficiency.

The "Mukhya Mantri Agricultural Mechanization Scheme" launched by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, offers financial assistance ranging from ₹1,200/- to ₹11,00,000/- to farmers in Gujarat for purchasing agricultural machinery and farm equipment.
Benefits: - **Financial Assistance:** An amount between ₹1,200/- to ₹11,00,000/- for purchasing various farm implements.

It supports sustainable agriculture through water conservation, especially for horticultural practices.
The scheme provides financial assistance to farmers across Gujarat for constructing water storage tanks to support drip irrigation, with cost-sharing benefits based on farmer category.
Benefits: - **Unit cost of construction:** ₹1,00,000/- per tank.  - **For General category farmers:** 50% subsidy, up to ₹50,000/-.  - **For SC/ST farmers:** 75% subsidy, up to ₹75,000/-.

schemeName: Uttarakhand State Shilp Ratna Award
Details:
The scheme &quot;Uttarakhand State Shilp Ratna Award&quot; is implemented by the Department of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to honor exceptionally skilled artisans of the state for their outstanding contributions to the traditional craft sector. This annual award celebrates heritage, promotes excellence, and supports artisans whose expertise has preserved and enriched cultural craftsmanship.
Under this scheme, every year, 25 artisans of Uttarakhand are honored. The award includes a cash prize of ₹1,00,000, a certificate of appreciation, a memento, an angavastra (ceremonial stole), and a citation letter.
Benefits:
**Award Details:**

- A cash prize of ₹1,00,000/-.
- A memento (symbolic representation).
- An angavastra (ceremonial stole).
- A certificate of appreciation.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant should be a skilled artisan. 
1. The applicant should be 45 years of age or above.
1. The applicant should be proficient in traditional or extraordinary art forms and have made significant contributions.
1. The artisans should have contributed to the training of young artisans in the district.
1. The applicant should have a minimum of 15 years of experience in a recognized traditional craft.
1. The applicant should not be employed in government/semi-government/cooperative institutions.

**Note:** Preference will be given to artisans who have received national/state-level awards.

[https://investuttarakhand.uk.gov.in](https://investuttarakhand.uk.gov.in)
[https://doi.uk.gov.in/](https://doi.uk.gov.in/)

The objective of the scheme is to enable the Goan writers to come in close contact with the senior writers of a language-region other than their own within India to acquaint them with the writers and the people of that region, and to widen their awareness and sensibility about the country as a nation.
The objective of the scheme is to enable the Goan writers to come in close contact with the senior writers of a language-region other than their own within India to acquaint them with the writers and the people of that region, and to widen their awareness and sensibility about the country.

schemeName: Employees' Pension Scheme
Details:
Launched on 16th November 1995, the "Employees' Pension Scheme" is a social security initiative by the Government of India, implemented under the Employees' Provident Funds and Miscellaneous Provisions Act, 1952. The scheme ensures financial security for employees post-retirement, disability, or to their families in case of death. Key benefits include superannuation pension, early pension, and family pension. Eligible employees must be members of the Employees' Provident Fund Scheme, 1952, and their pay should not exceed ₹15,000/- per month. The scheme is implemented by the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO). Applications for this scheme are accepted both online and offline through EPFO portals and regional offices.
The scheme ensures retirement security for employees covered under the EPF Act, offering monthly pensions, family pensions, and withdrawal benefits. It targets workers in organised sectors, providing financial support post-retirement, during disability, or to dependents after the member’s death.
Benefits:
- **Superannuation Pension:** Payable to members who retire at 58 years with at least 10 years of eligible service. Calculated as (Pensionable Salary × Pensionable Service) / 70.- **Early Pension:** Reduced pension for members retiring between 50-58 years, with a 4% reduction per year below 58. Payable if the member has rendered eligible service of 10 years or more.- **Monthly Member's Pension:** Calculated as (Pensionable Salary × Pensionable Service) / 70.- **Minimum Pension:** ₹1,000 per month, subject to deductions for commutation or early pension.- **Widow Pension:** 50% of the member's pension or ₹450/month, whichever is higher.- **Children Pension:** 25% of widow pension per child (max 2 children).- **Orphan Pension:** 75% of the widow pension if no surviving spouse (max 2 orphans).- **Permanent Total Disablement Pension:** Minimum ₹250/- per month if the member is permanently disabled during service.- **Withdrawal Benefit:** For members who exit before completing 10 years of service, calculated as per Table D.
> **Disbursement Conditions** - Pension starts from the date following the member's retirement, disablement, or death. - Early pension is reduced by 4% for each year the age falls short of 58 years. - Deferred pension increases by 4% for each year beyond 58 years, up to 60 years. - Family pension ceases on widow's remarriage or death. **Mode of Disbursement:** Through Post Office, Nationalised Banks, or electronic transfer.
Eligibility:
- The applicant must be a member of the Employees' Provident Fund Scheme, 1952, or an exempted establishment under Section 17 of the Act. - The applicant's pay must not exceed ₹15,000/month (unless contributing additional 1.16% above this limit). - The applicant must have a minimum of 10 years of eligible service for pension. - The applicant must have contributed to the Employees' Pension Fund. > **For Superannuation Pension** - The applicant must be 58 years or above in age. - The applicant must have rendered at least 10 years of eligible service. > **For Early Pension** - The applicant must have rendered at least 10 years of eligible service. - The applicant must opt for early pension between 50 and 58 years of age. > **For Family Pension** - The applicant must be the spouse or child of a deceased member who met the eligibility criteria. - The applicant must provide proof of the relationship and the member's death. - The deceased member must have contributed for at least one month. > **Post-Selection Conditions** - The applicant must submit the required documents for verification. - The applicant must comply with EPFO guidelines for pension disbursement.
*International workers are eligible under specific social security agreements.

Application Process.process:
> **For Registration** **Step 1: Activate UAN (Universal Account Number)** Visit the [EPFO Unified Portal](https://unifiedportal-emp.epfindia.gov.in/epfo/). Click "For Employees" > "Member UAN/Online Services (OCS/OTCP)". Enter UAN, mobile number, and CAPTCHA code. Click "Request OTP". Enter the OTP received on your registered mobile and click "Validate OTP". You will be redirected to the UAN activation page. **Step 2: Set Password & Complete KYC** Create a password (8-12 characters, including 1 uppercase, 1 number, and 1 special character). Under "Manage", select "KYC" and upload documents (Aadhaar, PAN, bank details). KYC status will show as "Approved" after verification (takes 3-5 working days).
> **For Application** **Step 1: Login to the EPFO Portal** Go to [EPFO Unified Portal](https://unifiedportal-emp.epfindia.gov.in/epfo/). Click "Member e-Sewa" > Enter UAN, password, and CAPTCHA. Click "Sign In". You will land on the member dashboard. **Step 2: Navigate to Pension Claim** Under "Online Services", select "Pension on Superannuation/Retirement (Form 10D)". The pension application form will open. Fill in all the mandatory fields. Click "Save & Preview" to review entries. **Step 3: Upload Documents** Upload scanned copies (PDF/JPEG/PNG, max 2MB each). Click "Submit" to proceed to OTP verification. **Step 4: OTP Verification & Final Submission** Enter the OTP sent to your registered mobile and email. Click "Validate OTP & Submit". A success message with an acknowledgement number will appear. Save the acknowledgement number and screenshot of submission confirmation for future reference.
> **C. Application Status Tracking** **Method 1:** EPFO Portal > "Track Claim Status" (using UAN + acknowledgement number). **Method 2:** SMS "EPFOHO <UAN> ENG" to 7738299899.
> **D. Help & Support / Grievance Redressal** **EPFO Helpline:** 1800-118-005 (8:00 AM–8:00 PM). **Email:** epfigms@epfindia.gov.in. **Online Grievance Portal:** [EPFiGMS](https://epfigms.gov.in/) (or visit the nearest office for grievances).

Documents Required:
- Identity Proof (Aadhaar/Passport/Voter ID)
- Bank Account Details (Cancelled cheque/passbook copy)
- Proof of Date of Birth (Birth certificate/School leaving certificate)
- Death Certificate (for family pension)
- relationship proof (for family pension)
- Disability Certificate, from EPFO-approved doctors (for disablement pension)
- Service Proof (EPF passbook/employment records)

schemeName: Indira Mahila Shakti Udyam Protsahan Yojana
Details:
The Indira Mahila Shakti Udyam Protsahan Yojana (IMSUPY) is a scheme launched by the Rajasthan government to empower women entrepreneurs by providing them with financial assistance and support. The main objective of the scheme is to ecourage women to start their own businesses and become financially independent. Promote self-employment and reduce unemployment among women in Rajasthan. Support the growth of micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) led by women.
This scheme launched by the Rajasthan government to empower women by providing them with loans and other financial assistance to start or expand their businesses
Benefits:
> **Loan Limit** 1. Loan amount of ₹ 50,00,000/- to individual women. 1. Loan amount of Rs 1,00,00,000/- to self-help groups.
> **Margin Money** - A margin money of 25% of the sanctioned loan amount will be provided under the scheme. For women belonging to Scheduled Castes/Tribes, Scheduled Castes, widows, abandoned women, victims of violence and disabled women, the margin money will be 30% of the sanctioned loan amount. - **Note**: 1. The maximum limit of margin money will be ₹ 15,00,000/-. 1. The applicant's own contribution (5% / 10% of the project proposal) will be considered for margin money. 1. Land value will not be included in the project proposal. The maximum limit of loan amount payable for construction of workshop/building will be up to 20% of the sanctioned amount of the project proposal. 1. The maximum limit of loan for business will be Rs. 10 lakh. Business refers to wholesale or retail purchase-sale of commercial products.
> **Promotion of collateral security free loans:** - As per the guidelines of the Reserve Bank of India, collateral security will not be required for loans up to Rs. 10 lakh. Loans above Rs. 10 lakh can be linked with the Credit Guarantee Trust Fund for Micro and Small Enterprises (CGTMSE). The fee amount will be borne by the beneficiary. If the applicant voluntarily wants to give collateral security on the loan, they can do so.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant's age should be 18 years or more.
1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Rajasthan.
1. The women's self-help group or group of these groups (cluster/ federation) must be registered under any department of the state government and in case of cluster/federation of groups, it will be necessary to be registered under the Cooperative Act as per the rules.

The registration page will appear with the following options. - Citizen **Step-4:** Choose the either one option from the Jan Aadhaar Or Google to process further. - Jan Aadhaar : Enter the Jan Aadhaar number, click on the ‘Next’ button, - Select your name, the name of the head of the family and all the other members and - Click on the ‘Send OTP’ button. > **Apply** **Step-1:** Applicant have to visit the [official portal](https://ssoapps.rajasthan.gov.in/imsupy/Introduction.aspx). **Step-2:** Read the instruction carefullly and click on "[Apply](https://ssoapps.rajasthan.gov.in/imsupy/Form.aspx)". **Step-3:** Click on an "Alert" button and page will redirected to SSO portal. **Step-4:** Now login with credentials. **Step-5:** Now click on "Apply for Scheme" on screen. **Step-6:** Now on the new page you will have to fill out the application form in 7 steps. - Such as a general description - Applicant details - Details of applicant and workplace - Description of the proposed project - Details of proposed financial institution - basis of ranking - Document Upload and Declaration **Step-7:** After filling in all the details in the application form, submit the application form.

schemeName: Rural Sports and Health Promotion Scheme
Details:
The scheme &quot;Rural Sports and Health Promotion Scheme&quot; was launched by the Department of Youth Welfare and Provincial Protection Corps, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to promote physical fitness and well-being among rural youth by establishing open gyms in village communities. An amount is provided to Mangal Dals for the installation of community fitness equipment (open gyms) in each Gram Panchayat.
The scheme promotes fitness among rural youth by providing financial assistance to the mangal dals for setting up open gyms in each Gram Panchayat.
Benefits: - A one-time financial grant of ₹17,960/- is allocated per gram panchayat for installing open gym/community fitness equipment to encourage fitness and well-being.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a Gram Panchayat located within the state of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant should identify and allocate space within the village for the construction of an open gym.

> **Note:** The allocated amount is distributed to the Mangal Dal associated with the Gram Panchayat.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** At the Gram Panchayat level, a suitable location is identified for setting up the open gym, and a proposal is approved by the Gram Sabha.
**Step 2:** The approved proposal is then submitted to the Regional Youth Welfare and Provincial Rakshak Dal Officer along with the required documents.
**Step 3:** Once verified and approved, the allocated amount is disbursed to the Mangal Dal associated with the Gram Panchayat.

Documents Required:
1. Approved proposal by the Gram Sabha
1. Site Selection Details for Open Gym
1. Bank Account Details of the Mangal Dal (for fund transfer)
1. Any Other Document if Required

schemeName: PMMSY: Establishment of New Freshwater Fin Fish Hatcheries-Haryana
Details:
The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana: Establishment of New Freshwater Fin Fish Hatcheries" by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to support the establishment of new freshwater finfish hatcheries. Through this scheme, financial assistance in the form of subsidies is provided to beneficiaries for setting up these hatcheries.

The scheme aims to support the establishment of new freshwater finfish hatcheries. Through this scheme, financial assistance in the form of subsidies is provided to beneficiaries for setting up these hatcheries.
Benefits: > The project cost for one unit is ₹25,00,000/-. - The subsidy will be limited to 40% of the project cost for beneficiaries belonging to the General Category. - The subsidy will be limited to 60% of the project cost for beneficiaries belonging to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category or women beneficiaries.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).
1. The freshwater finfish hatchery should have a minimum capacity of 15 million fry per year per unit or 6.00 crore spawn per year per unit.
1. The hatchery should have a minimum area of 0.50 hectares.
1. The fish hatchery should be managed by qualified technical staff.
1. The applicant will ensure the supply of seed produced from the centrally assisted hatcheries to farmers at an affordable and reasonable price.
1. The fish hatchery will include a brooder pond, nursery ponds, rearing tanks, a small laboratory, water and electric supply, and required infrastructure facilities.
1. The cost of accreditation of the hatchery must be mandatorily included in the project estimates.
1. The projects having land on long-term registered lease will also be considered for Central financial assistance under the scheme.
1. The lease period or agreement shall not be less than a minimum period of 10 years.
1. The applicant, having their own land, must furnish revenue records with a clear land title.

Application Process.process: > **Registration Process on Antyodaya-SARAL Portal:** **Step 1:** Visit the Official Portal: [Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.](https://saralharyana.gov.in/) **Step 2:** For registration, click on “New User/Register Here” and fill in all the mandatory details, i.e. Name, Email ID, Mobile Number & password. schemeName: Varanasi and Amritsar Yatra Scheme
Details:
The "Varanasi and Amritsar Yatra Scheme" is a scheme under the "Celebration of Birth Anniversaries of Great saints Dr. B.R. Ambedkar, Guru Ravidas, Maharishi Valmiki and Sant Kabir Dass Jayanti Scheme", implemented by the Welfare of Scheduled Castes and Backward Classes Department, Government of Haryana. This scheme aims to facilitate pilgrimages to Varanasi and Amritsar for individuals belonging to the Scheduled Castes category. To support their spiritual and cultural engagement, the scheme provides financial reimbursement for second-class train travel, enabling eligible beneficiaries to undertake these religious journeys with ease.
This scheme aims to facilitate pilgrimages to Varanasi and Amritsar for individuals belonging to the Scheduled Castes category. The scheme provides financial reimbursement for second-class train travel, enabling eligible beneficiaries to undertake these religious journeys with ease.
Benefits: - Reimbursement of ₹1,000/- or the actual cost of a second-class train ticket (to and fro) per person, whichever is less, will be provided. **Note:** This facility will be given one time only. **Expected Time of Disbursement:** Reimbursement will be made after the journey on the submission of railway tickets. **Mode of Disbursement:** Payment will be made directly into the bank account of the beneficiary.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Haryana. 1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste. 1. This facility will be given one time only.

Application Process.process: The applicant shall contact the concerned Antodaya Bhawan for registration, along with the required documents and intimation of the expected date of journey for this purpose. > **Notes:** - The number of persons are fixed for registration, i.e. 100 per constituency. Registration will be done on a first-come, first-served basis. - Reimbursement will be made after journey on the submission of railway tickets. - The budget will be allotted to the District Welfare officers for this purpose.

schemeName: State Art Exhibition Competition
Details:
The scheme "State Art Exhibition Competition" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to encourage and appreciate the creative pursuits of artists, art students, and school children through state-level art exhibitions and competitions in disciplines like painting, sculpture, graphic arts, applied arts, and visual arts. Participants are invited through public advertisements in newspapers, and entries are judged by expert panels. Winners receive cash prizes, certificates, and an opportunity to exhibit their work at the Ravi Shankar Rawal Kala Bhavan. Prize-winning art institute students are also eligible for a monthly scholarship. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy. 2 entries each from artists and students of art institutions and a maximum of 14 entries from classes 1 to 5 and 14 entries from classes 6 to 10 from a school are invited through the school in a prescribed format.
The scheme "State Art Exhibition Competition" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to promote fine arts and recognize artistic talents by providing awards and scholarships to artists, art students, and school children across Gujarat.
Benefits: - **Artists Category:** 23 prizes totaling ₹1,74,500/-. - **Art Institute Students Category:** 16 prizes totaling ₹48,000/-. - **School Children Category:** 50 prizes totaling ₹25,000/-. - **Scholarship:** Winning students in the art institution category are eligible for a monthly scholarship of ₹1,000/-.
Eligibility: - Artists/ art institute students and school children in Gujarat are eligible under this scheme. - Students should be studying in classes 1st to 10th in Gujarat.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** The interested applicant should download the prescribed format of the application forms for the "State Art Exhibition Competition" scheme. - [Application Form for State Art Exhibition-Competition](https://lalitkalaacademy.gujarat.gov.in/writereaddata/Portal/Magazine/Document/1_38_3_59th-state-art-form-28112018.pdf). - [Application form for providing Scholarship to Student](https://lalitkalaacademy.gujarat.gov.in/writereaddata/Portal/Magazine/Document/1_13_3_Form_2.pdf). **Step 2:** In the application form, provide all the mandatory details, including career details in the field of art, photographs, or color slides of work (self-attested, if required). **Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the supporting documents to the Gujarat State Fine Arts Academy. **Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority at the Academy office to whom the application has been submitted. > **Contact Us:** > Gujarat State Academy of Fine Arts > Ravi Shankar Rawal Kala Bhavan, > Opposite Bhaikaka Bhavan, > Law Garden, Ellisbridge, > Ahmedabad - 380006. > 079-26425562 > 079-26562558

Copy of Artwork (submitted as per competition guidelines). 1. Certificate of Participation or Merit (if available from past competitions – optional). 1. Proof of Enrollment (for scholarship-eligible art institution students). 1. Any other document as required.

schemeName: Scheme for the Welfare of Schedule Caste Families in Fisheries Sector: Subsidy on Annual Auction of Notified Waters
Details:
The “Subsidy on Annual Auction of Notified Waters” is a scheme component under the Scheme for the Welfare of Scheduled Caste Families in the Fisheries Sector, launched by the Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana. The objective of the scheme is to provide full-time employment to individuals from Scheduled Caste families in the fisheries sector and uplift their socio-economic status by promoting fish farming through subsidization of fishing contract costs in designated water bodies. Under this scheme, a subsidy of up to 50% of the actual auctioned amount of notified water bodies is provided to Scheduled Caste beneficiaries to help them acquire fishing rights in such notified waters.
The objective of the scheme is to provide full-time employment to individuals from Scheduled Caste families in the fisheries sector and uplift their socio-economic status by promoting fish farming through subsidization of fishing contract costs in designated water bodies.
Benefits: - 50% subsidy of the actual auctioned amount with maximum limit of ₹5,00,000/- per auction, whichever is less.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Haryana. 1. The applicant should possess a valid Family ID Card (Parivar Pehchan Patra). 1. The applicant should belong to a Scheduled Caste category. 1. The applicant's age should be 18 years or above.

schemeName: Foreign Study Loan
Details:
The scheme "Foreign Study Loan" implemented by the Gujarat Unreserved Educational and Economical Development Corporation (GUEEDC), Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, provides financial assistance to students from non-reserved categories pursuing higher studies abroad. The scheme provides overseas study loans of up to ₹15,00,000/- for specific courses, including Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery, post-graduation courses (valid even if obtained after diploma), post-graduation diploma, and equivalent courses after Class 12th. To be eligible, the applicant must have scored 60% or more in Class 12 and belong to a family with an annual income of ₹6,00,000/- or less. The loan carries simple interest at the rate of 4% per annum with repayment terms varying based on the loan amount.
The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to students from non-reserved categories for pursuing higher studies abroad in medical and post-graduation courses. It offers loans up to ₹15,00,000/- at 4% simple interest per annum to eligible students.
Benefits:
**Loan Amount:** Up to ₹15,00,000/- for overseas study. **Interest Rate:** Simple interest at 4% per annum. **Repayment Grace Period:** 1 year after completion of study before repayment begins. **Flexible Repayment:** Borrower can repay the loan before the stipulated time limit.
**Repayment Schedule** - For loans up to ₹5,00,000/-: Equal monthly installments over 5 years. - For loans above ₹5,00,000/-: Equal monthly installments over 6 years.
Eligibility: - The applicant must belong to the non-reserved category. - The applicant must be pursuing higher studies abroad. - The applicant must be enrolled in Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery, post-graduation courses (valid even if obtained after diploma), post-graduation diploma, or equivalent courses after Class 12th. - The applicant must have scored 60% or more in Class 12th. - The applicant must belong to a family with an annual income of ₹6,00,000/- or less.

Application Process.process: **Step 1: Register on the Official Portal** - Open the [official website](https://gueedc.gujarat.gov.in). Navigate to the “How to Apply” section and select “Foreign Study Loan.”- You will be redirected to the [e-SamajKalyan](https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/) Portal. On the home page, under the tab ‘Citizen Login’, click on New User ‘[Please Register Here](https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/Registration.aspx)’. Enter your Full Name as per Aadhaar Card, Gender, Date of Birth, Aadhaar Card Number, Email ID, Caste etc. and then click on ‘Register’.- Log in using your credentials once registration is complete. **Step 2: Access and Fill Out the Application Form** - After logging in, locate the application Form. Enter personal, academic, and family information in the respective modules: Name, gender, category, address, educational background, institution details, passport number, family income, occupation of guardians, and bank details (to be used for loan disbursement). - Use dropdown selections in the "Patrata Column" (પાત્રતાની કોલમ) to correctly indicate your eligibility parameters. It is mandatory to select from the dropdown so that your application is processed under the right criteria. **Step 3: Prepare and Upload Required Documents** - Scan and upload clear, legible documents in the upload section. - Ensure each file is within the portal’s size and format limitations (usually PDF, JPEG or PNG) and named properly to avoid confusion during review. **Step 4: Review and Final Submission** - Carefully review each module. Use the preview option to examine the application before final submission. - Save a local PDF copy of the completed form for your records. Click “Final Submit”. **Step 5: Application Verification by GUEEDC** - Upon submission, your application and uploaded documents will be reviewed by GUEEDC officials. - You may be contacted via phone or email if: Any clarification is required, Additional documents are needed, or Corrections must be made. - Maintain active communication channels and respond promptly to any such requests. **Loan Sanction and Disbursement** - If the application is accepted, a formal sanction letter will be issued. - You may be asked to sign an agreement accepting the terms and repayment conditions of the loan. - The sanctioned loan amount will be disbursed directly into your verified bank account. - If any post-sanction verification or usage confirmation is required, comply as per instructions provided by GUEEDC.

Documents Required: - Class 12th Mark Sheet (showing 60% or more marks) - Family Income Certificate (showing annual income of ₹6,00,000/- or less) - Property Documents (for loans up to ₹7,50,000/-: property worth one and a half times the loan amount) - Immovable Property Documents (for loans above ₹7,50,000/-: for mortgage in favor of the Corporation) - Five Post-Dated Cheques (signed in favor of the Corporation) - Course Admission Documents (for overseas higher studies) - Identity Proof - Address Proof

schemeName: Testing Equipment Scheme
Details:
The Government of Haryana launched the Testing Equipment Assistance Scheme to support Micro and Small Enterprises (MSEs) in enhancing product quality through financial aid for procuring testing equipment. Eligible units can receive a 50% subsidy, up to ₹5,00,000/- annually, for purchasing new testing equipment.
In order to ensure, Zero Defect‟ in the quality of products to make globally competitive, the Micro and small enterprises have to upgrade the quality of the products for which they are required to create testing facilities for testing of raw-materials and end products. The Micro and Small entrepreneurs find it difficult to purchase the testing equipment's because of limited resources. In order to meet this objective, State Govt. has made provision for Testing Equipment Assistance Scheme.
The Government of Haryana launched the Testing Equipment Assistance Scheme to support Micro and Small Enterprises (MSEs) in enhancing product quality through financial aid for procuring testing equipment.
Benefits: 1. **50% Subsidy on Purchase of Testing Equipment :** - Financial support of 50% of the cost, limited to a maximum of ₹5 lakh per year, for purchase of new testing equipment. 1. **Support for Quality Enhancement** - Assists Micro and Small Enterprises in establishing testing facilities for raw materials and end products to ensure zero defect and global competitiveness. 1. **Encouragement to Upgrade Infrastructure** - Aims to overcome resource constraints faced by MSEs in acquiring essential testing infrastructure.
Eligibility: 1. The unit should have filed Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) and Haryana Udhyam Memorandum (HUM) on the portal for the statistical purpose, at any stage. 1. The unit should not have been placed in the restrictive list as notified by the State Government from time to time. 1. The unit should have obtained NOC/CLU from competent Authority if applicable. 1. The unit should be in commercial production. 1. The unit should be in regular production at the time of disbursement and the subsidy shall not be released to a closed unit. 1. No subsidy shall be admissible on the secondhand Testing Equipment and the equipment shall not be disposed of for 05 years from the date of purchase without approval of Competent Authority. The Joint Director/ Deputy Director, District MSME Centre shall conduct annual inspection of the unit to ensure that Testing Equipment is intact. 1. The Scheme shall commence with effect from 01.01.2021 for the Testing Equipment Assistance and shall remain in operation for a period of 05 years. The assistance shall be admissible on the purchase of testing equipment on or after 01.01.2021 and before 31.12.2025.

schemeName: Pashu Palan Yojana (GSKVN)
Details:
The scheme 'Pashu Palan Yojana' is implemented by the Gujarat Safai Kamdar Vikas Nigam (GSKVN) under the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide loans to sanitation workers and their dependents to promote self-employment through animal husbandry and related activities.
Under this scheme, loans of up to ₹1,00,000 are provided to sanitation workers and their dependents at an interest rate of 6% for self-employment in animal husbandry or related activities.
Benefits: - Loan up to ₹1,00,000/- is provided at an interest rate of 6% to sanitation workers or their dependents for initiating animal husbandry as a business or occupation.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a native of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should be a sanitation worker or a dependent of a sanitation worker. 1. The age of the applicant (sanitation worker or dependent) should be between 18 and 50 years as on the date of application. 1. Only applicant who has not previously availed any loan under any scheme of this Corporation or the Government, including their family members, are eligible to apply under this scheme. 1. Priority will be given to applicants who are BPL (Below Poverty Line), widowed, abandoned, or persons with disabilities. 1. The applicant should intend to start a self-employment venture in animal husbandry or related activities.

schemeName: Handicraft Rebate Scheme
Details:
The "Handicraft Rebate Scheme" launched by the Commissioner of Cottage and Rural Industries, Government of Gujarat, aims to support artisans and cooperatives by providing financial rebates on the sale of handicrafts. The scheme offers a 5% permanent rebate on retail sales and an additional 10% special rebate during festivals (totaling 15–20% for women-led cooperatives). Implemented via the e-Kutir portal, it ensures transparency through an e-voucher system for toolkit distribution and rebate disbursement. The scheme targets industrial cooperatives, apex societies, and women-led groups, promoting market competitiveness and artisan welfare.
The scheme provides 5–20% rebates on sales of handicraft goods to cooperatives, with higher incentives for women-led groups and during festivals. Applications are submitted online via e-Kutir.
Benefits: **Permanent Rebate:** - 5% on retail sales of handicraft. - 15% for women-led cooperatives. **Special Festival Rebate:** - Additional 10% (total 15% for general cooperatives, 20% for women-led groups) for 120 days during festivals. **Targeted Support:** - Enhanced rebates for Scheduled Castes/Tribes and BPL artisans.
Eligibility: - The applicant must be a registered cooperative society, apex institution, or women-led group. - The applicant must produce handicrafts. - The applicant must obtain prior rebate certification from the Commissionerate.

Application Process.process:
**Steps for New Registration** **Step 1:** Visit the [eKutir portal](https://e-kutir.gujarat.gov.in). In the right pane of the landing page, click "[For New Individual Registration, click Here](https://e-kutir.gujarat.gov.in/Registration.aspx)". **Step 2:** On the registration page, fill in all mandatory fields (marked with an asterisk): Full Name (in English), Aadhaar Card Number, Gender, Date of Birth, Mobile Number, E-mail, Password (confirm the password by typing it again). Fill in the Captcha Code, and click "Register". **Step 3:** A confirmation pop-up will display the entered name, mobile number, and other details. If all the details are correct, click "Confirm" to proceed. If any information is incorrect, click "Cancel", make the necessary corrections, and then click "Register" again. **Step 4:** Upon successful registration, the User ID and Password will be sent to your registered mobile number via SMS. If an email address has been provided, the credentials will also be sent via email.
**Steps for Login Procedure and User Profile Update** **Step 1:** Visit the [eKutir portal](https://e-kutir.gujarat.gov.in). In the right pane of the landing page (in the "Login to Portal" section), provide your User ID, Password, and the Captcha Code. Then click "Login". **Step 2:** Upon first login, the user must complete the "User Profile" by providing personal and organisational details. All fields marked with an asterisk are mandatory. Some fields will already be pre-filled based on the information provided during registration. _*Most of these details can later be updated from the “View Profile” section, except for the fields initially filled during registration._
**Steps for Scheme Application** **Step 1:** After logging in and completing the profile, the system displays schemes relevant to the user on the homepage.
