For each uploaded document, the corresponding document number must be entered wherever required. Click the “Save & Next” button to proceed to the subsequent tabs. **Step 3:** Carefully review all the information provided and the documents uploaded. Make any necessary corrections. Acknowledge and agree to the terms and conditions, declaration, and privacy policy (if any) by ticking the designated checkbox. **Step 4:** Clicking “Save & Next” in the last tab of the application form generates an application number, which is displayed on the screen. The applicant must record this number for future reference. If the applicant wishes to print the application, they may click the “Print Application” button. _*If you do not wish to continue with the application at that point, you may click "Cancel"._
**Application Printing and Modification** - If the user wishes to print the application, they may click “Print Application.” - If the application has been returned for revision, a “Modify” button will appear. The user can then edit the application and resubmit it.
**Helpdesk/Grievance Redressal** - Call 9909926280 / 9909926180. - Connect with the [District Industries Centre (DIC)](https://www.cottage.gujarat.gov.in/Home-2140795B5D2D-282472282472-2824725B5D2D) of your district.
**Check Application Status** Visit the [Application Status](https://e-kutir.gujarat.gov.in/ViewApplicationStatus.aspx) page Provide the Application Number of the scheme, and your Date of Birth. Then click "View Status".

schemeName: Assistance for Planting Vegetable Crops for Raw and Ripe Mandap
Details:
The scheme &quot;Assistance for Planting Vegetable Crops for Raw and Ripe Mandap&quot; introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Cooperation Department, Gujarat, aims to offer financial support to farmers across Gujarat for constructing vegetable trellises (mandaps) using wooden/bamboo supports and GI/plastic wires.
The scheme provides financial assistance to farmers in Gujarat for setting up vegetable trellises (Mandap) for raw, semi-ripe, and ripe vegetables, with varying support for General, SC, and ST farmers.
Benefits: > **Raw Mandap (Tomato/Chilli and other vegetables):** - General Farmers: 50% subsidy, up to ₹26,000/ha. - SC/ST Farmers: 75% subsidy, up to ₹39,000/ha. > **Semi-ripe Mandap (Vine vegetables):** - General Farmers: 50% subsidy, up to ₹40,000/ha. - SC/ST Farmers: 75% subsidy, up to ₹60,000/ha. > **Ripe Mandap (Vine vegetables):** - General Farmers: 50% subsidy, up to ₹80,000/ha. - SC/ST Farmers: 75% subsidy, up to ₹1,20,000/ha. > **Other Support Details:** - Maximum area eligible: 2 hectares per farmer. - Construction material: 1600 wooden/bamboo poles per hectare, 400 kg GI wire (12-18 gauge) or plastic wire. - Recommended spacing: 2.50 x 2.50 meters.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a farmer. 1. The applicant must be residing in Gujarat.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** The applicant may visit and apply online at I-Khedut Portal: [https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/)
**Step 2:** On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’.
**Step 3:** Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button and an application page will open.
**Step 4:** Click on &quot;Apply New&quot; button and submit a new application.
**Step 5:** Click on the &quot;Update Application&quot; button to add corrections to the application.
**Step 6:** Once the application is done, confirm it.

schemeName: "Agricultural Income Tax Holiday" under the "Assam Tea Industries Special Incentives Scheme"
Details:
Launched in 2020, the scheme "Assam Tea Industries Special Incentives Scheme (ATISIS)" by the Finance (Institutional Finance) Department, Government of Assam, aims to ensure long-term financial sustainability of the Tea industry and to incentivize manufacturers to move from Crush, Tear, Curl tea to Orthodox tea production. The scheme is implemented by the Finance Department and the Industries & Commerce Department, Government of Assam, through multiple implementing agencies, including banks and the District Industries & Commerce Centre. The applications for this scheme are accepted online through a dedicated portal with a Direct Benefit Transfer mechanism for reimbursement.
The scheme aims to ensure long-term financial sustainability of the Tea industry and to incentivize manufacturers to move from Crush, Tear, Curl tea to Orthodox tea production. The scheme is implemented by the Finance Department and the Industries & Commerce Department, Government of Assam.
Benefits: **Benefit Period:** 3 years of Agricultural Income Tax holiday. **Applicable Financial Years:** 2022-23 to 2024-25. **Condition:** Returns must be filed within the due date; if not filed on the due date, interest and penalty will be applicable.
Eligibility: - The applicant must be a tea plantation across all sizes. - The applicant must be a tea manufacturing unit manufacturing Crush, Tear, Curl Tea, Orthodox Tea, or Speciality tea including Green tea, Oolong Tea, White tea, Yellow tea and Purple tea. - The applicant must be located entirely in Assam. - The applicant must not have any part of the plantation or manufacturing facility located outside the State of Assam.

Application Process.process:
**Registration Process** **Step 1:** Visit the [dedicated portal](https://atisis.assam.gov.in/atsisver/login.html) of "Assam Tea Industries Special Incentives" Scheme. Click on the "New User Registration" option. **Step 2:** In the registration form, fill in basic details including name, mobile number, and email address. Create a username and password following the portal's password policy. Verify your mobile number through one-time password verification. Complete Captcha Code verification. Submit the registration form. **Step 3:** Check your registered email for the account activation link. Click on the activation link to activate the account. Log in to the portal using registered credentials. **Step 4:** Upload all supporting documents of eligibility in the prescribed format. Fill in complete unit details, including location, type of tea production, and capacity. Submit the unit registration form. Wait for registration approval.
**Application Process** **Step 1:** Log in to the portal using registered credentials. Navigate to the "Apply for Benefits" section. Select the scheme component that you intend to apply for. **Step 2:** Fill in the prescribed application form with all mandatory fields. Upload all supporting documents as mentioned in the portal. Ensure file formats and file size restrictions are followed as per the portal guidelines. Review all entered information for accuracy. **Step 3:** Upload documents in the specified format and size. Ensure all documents are clear and legible. Complete document verification checklist. **Step 4:** Review the complete application before submission. Apply online. _*Note down the application reference number. Save a copy of the submitted application form._ _*Applicants are strongly encouraged to save a copy of the submitted application, confirmation message, and application reference number for future reference and tracking purposes._
**Application Status Tracking** Log in to the portal to check application status. Track application progress through different stages of verification. Receive Short Message Service alerts throughout the process, including registration, fund release, etc. _*For Technical Support, please write to atisis.assam@gmail.com._
**Disbursement Process** The Finance Department releases the benefit directly to the beneficiary's bank account. Short Message Service alerts sent for funds disbursement. The beneficiary receives the Direct Benefit Transfer in a registered bank account.

Documents Required: - Agricultural Income Tax Return Filing Documents. - Tea Estate Registration Certificate. - Common Documents for All Benefits. - Aadhaar Card. - Permanent Account Number Card. - Business Registration Certificate. - Bank Account Details. - Address Proof of Unit Location in Assam.

schemeName: Scheme for Upgradation of Gaushala/ Panjrapole
Details:
The "Scheme for Upgradation of Gaushala/ Panjrapole" launched by the Department of Agriculture, Farmers Welfare & Co-operation, Government of Gujarat, is designed to preserve and promote indigenous breeds of cows in Gujarat, such as Gir and Kankrej, which hold spiritual, scientific, and health value. <br> Objective: The world famous Gir and Kankarej cows of Gujarat state and other indigenous breeds have great importance in terms of spiritual, scientific and health. To preserve these is the main aim by increase the breeding of cows by encouraging gaushalas and panjarapol institutions that ideally keep cows. The scheme also aims to increase the consumption of Panchagavya products of Gir and Kankrej cows and make rearing of cows economically viable.
The "Scheme for Upgradation of Gaushala/ Panjrapole" aims to promote indigenous cow breeds and make cow rearing economically viable.
Benefits: **Component****Standard of Assistance****Minimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming Constituent Benefits**1. Water Fogger; 2. Mechanized Reaper Machine or Reaper Machine; 3. Chaff cutter 4. Drip irrigation; 5. 500 liters bulk milk cooling machine with generator; 6. Mini Tractor or Big Tractor/Hydraulic Trailer or Trailer; 7. Solar Gau Arc Machine/ Gau Arc Machine; 8. Milking machineAssistance upto 75% of the total expenditure incurred by the article up to a maximum of ₹4,00,000/- to be paid.1 Year
Eligibility: 1. Gaushalas and panjrapole registered under the Public Charity Act. 1. A Gaushala should have more than 50 cows of local origin. While Panjarapol must have more than 100 livestock. 1. At least 3 (three) acres of land on which the institution has to purchase/develop the development work, must be in the institution's own name or on a lease of 99 years. There is no maximum land limit.

schemeName: Pashupalan (GBCDC)
Details:
The scheme "Pashupalan (GBCDC)" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, owned by the Centre and the Gujarat Government, aims to provide financial assistance for agriculture-related activities. Through this scheme, a low-interest loan amount is provided to support Pashu Palaks (Animal Rearers) in undertaking animal husbandry activities such as purchasing cows and buffaloes. The scheme's core objective is to offer financial aid at low-interest rates, supporting eligible individuals from socially and educationally backwards classes.
The scheme aims to provide an amount for animal husbandry activities. Low-interest loans are provided to Pashu Palaks.
Benefits:
1. **Low-Interest Loan:** A loan is provided at an interest rate of 6 per cent per annum.1. **Maximum Loan Limit:** The maximum loan limit in this scheme is up to ₹1,00,000/-.1. **Unit Cost Coverage:** 85 per cent of the unit cost will be loaned. - Out of this 85 per cent, 85 per cent will be from the national corporation. - 10 per cent will be from the state government. - 5 per cent will be from the beneficiary's contribution.
> **Intended Use:** The loan is for agriculture-related activities, specifically animal husbandry (cow-buffalo). > **Repayment Terms:** This loan is to be repaid in 60 equal monthly instalments, including interest.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be from a Socially and Educationally Backward Class (SEBC). 1. The total annual income of the applicant's family should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-. 1. The applicant's age should be between 21 and 45 years on the date of application. 1. The applicant must have experience in a business requiring technical and other skills.

Application Process.process: **Step 1: Visit the Official Website:** Go to the [[Official Website](https://ggdconline.gujarat.gov.in/) Gujarat Backwards Caste Development Corporation.](https://gbcdconline.gujarat.gov.in/) **Step 2: Locate and Apply for Scheme:** Scroll down on the homepage, find the "Pashupalan," and click on "Apply Now". **Step 3:** **Access Application Form:** You will be directed to the [application form](https://gbcdconline.gujarat.gov.in/SchemePasupalan/AddEdit). **Step 4: Scheme Selection & Loan Details:** Select "Pashupalan", enter Unit Cost, and specify the Required Loan Amount. **Step 5: Applicant's Details:** Provide Aadhaar, Ration, Voter ID, full name (Last, First, Father/Husband), address, district, taluka, village, PIN, date of birth, age (21-45 as of 14/08/2023), caste, subcaste, phone, mobile, email, gender, and marital status. **Step 6: Income Details:** Enter income certificate number, issue date, issuing officer's name, total annual family income (up to ₹ 3,00,000/-), and parent/guardian's occupation. **Step 7: Disability Details (if applicable):** If "Physically Handicapped," select "Yes" or "No". If you selected "Yes", provide the percentage (in %). **Step 8: Employment Details (if applicable):** Indicate if any family member works in a government or private job. If "Yes," provide their Name, Designation, Place, and Salary details. **Step 9: Educational Qualification:** Select your Education Qualification: Uneducated, Educated, Graduation, Post Graduation, or Other Degree. **Step 10: Loan History:** If you have taken a past loan, select "Yes" or "No". If you selected "Yes" provide loan details (date, amount, paid, remaining) and your account number. **Step 12: Bank Account Details:** Provide bank account number, bank name, branch name, name as per account, account type (Saving/Current), MICR code, and IFSC code. **Step 13: Submission:** Click the "Submit" button to complete your application.

Documents Required: 1. Aadhaar 1. Ration Card 1. Voter ID 1. Birth Certificate 1. Income Certificate 1. School Leaving Certificate 1. Bank Account Details 1. Loan Details (if a past loan has been taken)

schemeName: New Akanksha Scheme (Educational Loan) (GTKVN)
Details:
The "New Akanksha Scheme (Educational Loan)" is implemented by the Gujarat Thakor and Koli Vikas Nigam (GTKVN) under the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial support for higher technical and professional education to students belonging to Thakor and Koli communities. Under this scheme, loans are provided at subsidized interest rates to students for pursuing graduate and postgraduate studies in fields such as engineering, medical, MBA, and MCA.
Under this scheme, education loans are provided at subsidized interest rates to students belonging to Thakor and Koli communities for pursuing graduate and postgraduate studies in fields such as engineering, medical, MBA, and MCA.
Benefits: > **Education Loan Details:** ***Loan Amount:*** Up to ₹15,00,000/-. ***Interest Rate:*** 4% per annum for male students and 3.5% per annum for female students. ***Coverage Includes:*** - Admission fees and tuition fees - Books, writing materials, necessary equipment and examination fees required for the course - Accommodation & food expenses - Travel and insurance premiums ***Contribution:*** - 90% by Central Corporation - 5% by State Government - 5% by the Beneficiary ***Repayment Terms:*** - Repayment Period: 60 equal monthly installments (5 years) - Start of Repayment: Within 6 months from course completion or employment, whichever is earlier.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should belong to the Thakor or Koli caste/community. 1. The family's annual income should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-. 1. The applicant should have secured admission in a recognized institution for: - MBA or equivalent (approved by AICTE) - MCA (Master of Computer Applications or equivalent) - Undergraduate Engineering programs (approved by AICTE/IITs) - MBBS or equivalent (approved by Medical Council of India) **Note:** At least 50% of the total sanctioned loan amount will be reserved for applicants from families earning up to ₹1,50,000 annually.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** Visit the [official website](https://gtkdconline.gujarat.gov.in/) of the Gujarat Thakor and Koli Vikas Nigam. **Step 2:** On the top menu bar, click on "Apply Now". **Step 3:** Click on the loan scheme name. **Step 4:** Select the loan category and fill in the loan amount. **Step 5:** Fill out the Application Form, enter the following details: - Personal Information: Name, gender, date of birth, caste, etc. - Address Information: Permanent and correspondence address - Income Details: Monthly family income and source - Loan Requirement: Amount needed, proposed use (e.g., business, self-employment) - Bank Account Details: For loan disbursement **Step 6:** Upload scanned copies of the Caste certificate, Income certificate, Aadhaar card, Passport-size photo, Bank passbook (first page), and Residence proof. **Step 7:** Double-check all details. Click on “Preview” to verify. If all details are correct, click “Submit”. **Step 8:** Applicant will receive an Application ID/Reference Number. Save or print the acknowledgement for future tracking.

Documents Required: 1. Aadhaar Card 1. Caste Certificate 1. Income Certificate 1. Other Mark sheets/Last Year Mark sheet 1. Ration Card 1. School Leaving 1. Bank Passbook/Cancelled Cheque 1. Identity Card 1. Mark sheet 1. Passport Size Photos 1. Receipt of Fee Paid

schemeName: Educational Loan Scheme (GBCDC)
Details:
The scheme "Educational Loan Scheme" is implemented by the Gujarat Backward Classes Development Corporation (GBCDC) under the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial support for higher technical and professional education to students belonging to belonging to socially and educationally backward classes. Under this scheme, loans are provided at concessional interest rates to eligible students pursuing approved graduate and postgraduate professional & technical courses in fields such as engineering, medical, MBA, MCA, etc.
The scheme provides financial support to students from socially and educationally backward classes for higher technical and professional education. It offers loans at concessional interest rates for approved graduate and postgraduate courses like engineering, medical, MBA, MCA, and more.
Benefits: 1. The maximum loan limit under this scheme is up to ₹ 15,00,000/-. 2. **The interest rate:** - 4% per annum for male students. - 3.5% per annum for female students. 3. **Loan Contribution Breakdown:** - 90% by the National Corporation. - 5% by the State Government. - 5% by the beneficiary. 4. **The loan amount will include the following:** - Admission fees and tuition fees - Accommodation and food expenses > **Validity:** This loan is to be repaid in 60 equal monthly instalments, including interest. The loan must be repaid within 6 months of completing the course or 1 month after getting a job, whichever is earlier.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should belong to a socially and educationally backward class. 1. The total annual family income should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-. 1. The student must have secured admission through a recognized entrance examination conducted by the Central or State Government, or through a selection process, with at least 50% marks in Class 12 or the qualifying examination. 1. The applicant should have secured admission in a recognized institution for one of the following courses: - MBA or its equivalent (recognized by AICTE) - Master of Computer Applications (MCA) or its equivalent (recognized by AICTE) - Graduate-level engineering courses conducted by IITs or other institutions (recognized by AICTE) - Medical or allied education such as Ayurvedic, Homeopathy, Unani, etc., from institutions recognized by the Medical Council of India - Diploma course in Hospitality Management recognized by the National Council of Hotel Management > **Note:** Priority will be given to applicants whose family income is up to ₹1,50,000/- per annum.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** Visit the [official website](https://gbcdconline.gujarat.gov.in/) of the Gujarat Backwards Caste Development Corporation. **Step 2:** On the top menu bar, click on "Apply Online". **Step 3:** If you’re a new user, click on "New Registration" Enter personal details (name, mobile number, email, aadhaar number, etc.), create a password, and complete OTP verification. **Step 4:** Use your registered credentials (User ID and password) to log in. **Step 5:** Click on “New Application”. Select “Educational Loan Scheme” from the list of available schemes. **Step 6:** Fill out the Application Form, enter the following details: - **Personal Information:** Name, gender, date of birth, caste, etc.- **Address Information:** Permanent and correspondence address- **Income Details:** Monthly family income and source- **Loan Requirement:** Amount needed, proposed use (e.g., business, self-employment)- **Bank Account Details**: For loan disbursement **Step 7:** Upload scanned copies of the Caste certificate, Income certificate, Aadhaar card, Passport-size photo, Bank passbook (first page), and Residence proof. **Step 8:** Double-check all details. Click on “Preview” to verify. If all details are correct, click “Submit”. **Step 9:** The Applicant will receive an Application ID/Reference Number. Save or print the acknowledgement for future tracking.

Documents Required: 1. Identity proof 1. Caste Certificate 1. Income Certificate 1. Class 12 Marksheet/Qualifying Examination Marksheet 1. Admission Letter from a government-approved admission committee or under the government quota. 1. Fee Structure Certificate from the institution 1. Bank Account Details 1. Declaration/Proof of Non-Receipt of Assistance under the Hon'ble Chief Minister's Youth Self-Reliance Scheme (if applicable).

schemeName: Educational Loan Scheme (GMFDC)
Details:
The "Educational Loan Scheme" is implemented by the Gujarat Minorities Finance and Development Corporation (GMFDC) under the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance in the form of loans for all types of education, including various technical and non-technical courses, that help beneficiaries gain employment or enhance their job prospects. Under this scheme, low-interest loans are offered to eligible students from minority communities to pursue graduate and postgraduate courses in technical, vocational, professional, and medical fields, either in India or abroad.
The scheme aims to provide financial assistance for technical and non-technical education that creates employment or job opportunities for beneficiaries. Through this scheme, loans are provided to eligible students from minority communities for studies within India and abroad.
Benefits: 1. For studies within India, a maximum loan of ₹1,50,000/- per year and up to ₹7,50,000/- for a five-year course can be obtained. 1. For medical courses within India, ₹2,50,000/- for 1 year and ₹12,50,000/- for 5 years can be obtained. 1. For abroad studies, a maximum loan of ₹3,00,000/- for 1 year and ₹15,00,000/- for 5 years is provided. 1. The annual interest rate on this loan is 3%. **Note 1:** If the applicant’s annual family income is up to ₹98,000 in rural areas or ₹1,20,000 in urban areas, the loan is provided at a concessional interest rate of 3% per annum. **Note 2:** According to the National Corporation's Credit Line-2, for families with an income of ₹1,20,000/- up to ₹8,00,000, the interest rate is 5% for female students and 8% for male students. **Note 3:** The loan and interest amount is to be repaid in 60 equal monthly installments within five years from the date of completion of studies or from the date of getting a job, whichever is earlier. **Note 4:** Penalty interest at the rate of 2% is payable on delayed payments.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should belong to a minority religious community (Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Jain, Buddhist, Parsi, and Jewish) or a linguistic community (Sindhi, Marathi, Urdu) of Gujarat State. 1. The applicant or any family member should not have received a loan from Gujarat Minorities Finance and Development Corporation Limited, Gujarat Backward Class Development Corporation, Gandhinagar, or any other central/state government corporation/institution or bank. 1. The annual income of the applicant's family should be: - ₹98,000/- for rural areas. - ₹1,20,000/- for urban areas. - However, families with income exceeding ₹1,20,000/- and up to ₹8,00,000/- are also eligible, albeit with different interest rates 5. The applicant's age should be between 16 and 32 years.

schemeName: Term Loan Scheme (GMFDC)
Details:
The scheme "Term Loan Scheme" is implemented by Gujarat Minorities Finance and Development Corporation (GMFDC) under the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to promote self-employment among individuals from the minority communities by providing financial assistance for agriculture and allied activities, small-scale businesses, craftsmanship, transport sector, traditional occupations, and service-based businesses/trades. Under this scheme, beneficiaries can avail loans at concessional interest rates to purchase equipment, raw materials, or working capital.
The scheme aims to promote self-employment among individuals from the minority communities by providing financial assistance for agriculture and allied activities, small-scale businesses, craftsmanship, transport sector, traditional occupations, and service-based businesses/trades.
Benefits: 1. **Financial Assistance for Business:** Loans ranging from ₹1,00,000/- to ₹20,00,000/- are provided businesses/trades in various sectors listed below: - Agriculture and allied businesses, such as animal husbandry, fisheries, etc. - Technical & Skilled self-employment businesses. - Service-oriented businesses such as provision stores, ready-made garment shops, cyber cafés, cold drink parlors, auto repairing, beauty parlors, etc. - Handicraft businesses. - Transport sector. 1. **Interest Rates:** - For annual income up to ₹1,20,000/- (rural) and ₹1,20,000/- (urban), the interest rate is 6% per annum. - For families with annual income above ₹1,20,000/- and up to ₹8,00,000/-, the interest rate is 8% for male beneficiaries and 6% for female beneficiaries. **3. schemeName: Scholarship to SC students studying in selected schools under Talentpool Scheme
Details:
The scheme "Scholarship to SC students studying in selected schools under Talentpool Scheme" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide the best education to meritorious Scheduled Caste students in high-quality residential schools to help them build their careers and improve their living standards. Through this scheme, financial assistance per student is provided to the meritorious Scheduled Caste students. The scheme targeted 330 students across 33 districts, with 5 meritorious students from Std-5 and 5 from Std-10 from each district. The scheme is implemented by the Office of the concerned District Deputy Director (Ajak).
The following 8 schools have been empanelled out of 15 schools: 1. Late P.U. Chavda Edu. Trust operated Nalanda Vidyalaya Educational Complex, Bhorigada, Amreli. 1. Futurelink School, operated by Gujarat Child Development Board, Vill. Kharedivav, Tal. Jambughoda, Dist. Panchmahal. 1. Shri J.R. Desai School, operated by Gujarat Bal Vikas Mandal, Mora, Morwa, Dist. Panchmahal. 1. Shri Neelkanth Education and Social Welfare Trust, Bayad, Aravalli. 1. Shri Brahmanand Vidya Mandir, Chaparda, operated by Brahmacharishree Bhagwati Nandji Education Trust 1. Satkeval Vidyamandir, Sarsa, run by Gyan Sampradaya Kelavani Trust 1. Chanakya Education and Charitable Trust (Takshashila Vidyalaya), Halvad, Morbi. 1. Nalanda Vidyalaya, run by Shri Swami Vivekananda Education and Welfare Trust, Puna Village, Ta. Choryasi, Surat.
The scheme aims to provide the best education to meritorious Scheduled Caste students in high-quality residential schools to help them build their careers and improve their living standards.
Benefits: 1. Financial assistance of up to ₹40,000/- per student is provided.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste. 1. The applicant should from Standard 5 and Standard 10. 1. schemeName: Providing Latest Technology to Group of Pottery Artisans (Energy Efficient Kiln)
Details:
The scheme "Providing Latest Technology to Group of Pottery Artisans (Energy Efficient Kiln)" by the Gujarat Matikam Kalakari & Rural Technology Institute, Industries & Mines Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide latest technology and equipment to pottery artisans for better productivity, improved quality and reduce health risks. The scheme provides 100% financial assistance on development of the kiln with unit cost of ₹83,000/- and energy-efficient furnaces to groups of registered clay artisans and potters. The applicant must be directly involved in the pottery business and be in the age group of 18 to 58 years, with at least 800 to 1000 square feet of open space available for pottery business. The scheme is implemented by the relevant Gujarat State Government Department and applications are accepted through prescribed application forms with required details and certificates.
The scheme aims to provide latest technology and equipment to pottery artisans for better productivity, improved quality and reduce health risks. It provides 100% financial assistance for energy-efficient kilns to groups of registered clay artisans and potters in Gujarat state.
Benefits:
**Financial Assistance:** 100% financial assistance is provided on development of the kiln with unit cost of ₹83,000/-. **Technology Provision:** Energy-efficient furnaces are provided to improve productivity and quality. **Health Benefits:** Reduced health risks for pottery artisans through improved technology.
> **Mode and Frequency of Disbursement** - The assistance will be given only in the form of an energy saving furnace. - No assistance related to the kiln will be paid in cash.
> **Conditions for Availment/Continuation** - The energy-saving furnace must be used only for pottery business. - Beneficiaries must send a report about the utility of the furnace to the organization every 3 months after the furnace is ready. - Cost of maintenance and repair of the furnace must be borne by the beneficiaries at their own expense after construction and installation. - Misuse of the furnace will result in legal action by the institute.
Eligibility: - The applicant must be registered clay artisans and potters eligible for the scheme on 100% subsidy basis. - The applicant must be directly involved in the pottery business and carry out pottery activity. - The applicant must be in the age group of 18 to 58 years. - The applicant must be part of a group doing at least 2 (two) pottery. - The applicant must have at least 800 to 1000 square feet of open space in their own rent lease or for at least five years on the date on which they apply for pottery business. - The applicant must be associated with pottery in the state of Gujarat only. **Post-Selection Conditions** - The applicant must adhere to the policy rules of the institute as well as the norms regarding the construction of the kiln. - The applicant must use the energy-saving furnace only for pottery business. - The applicant must compulsorily use the energy-saving furnace as per the guarantee letter given unanimously.

schemeName: Vishesh Katan, Vankari & Vanat Sahay (Spinning & Weaving Assistance Scheme)
Details:
The scheme "Vishesh Katan, Vankari & Vanat Sahay (Spinning & Weaving Assistance Scheme)" by the Gujarat Rajya Khadi Gramodyog Board, Industries & Mines Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance in addition to the central government assistance to spinners and weavers. The scheme provides production incentive for spinning of yarn and weaving of Khadi with additional financial assistance ranging from ₹1/- per hank for general and Scheduled Caste spinners to ₹4/- per square meter for Scheduled Tribe weavers, along with weaving equipment aid of ₹1/- per square meter. The applicant must be Khadi spinners and weavers engaged in production activities. The scheme is implemented by Gujarat Rajya Khadi Gramodyog Board under Industries & Mines Department and applications are accepted as per the board's procedures.
The scheme aims to provide financial assistance in addition to the central government assistance to spinners and weavers. It provides production incentives to Khadi spinners and weavers with category-wise differential assistance rates.
Benefits:
> **For Spinners** - General and Scheduled Caste Categories: Additional ₹1/- per hank for spinning of yarn. - Women and Scheduled Tribe Categories: Additional ₹1.5/- per hank for spinning of yarn. > **For Weavers** - General and Scheduled Caste Categories: Additional ₹3/- per square meter for weaving of Khadi. - Scheduled Tribe Category: Additional ₹4/- per square meter for weaving of Khadi. - Weaving Equipment Aid: ₹1/- per square meter weaving equipment aid.
> **Mode and Frequency of Disbursement** - Production incentive based on actual spinning and weaving output. - Payment structure linked to per hank for spinning and per square meter for weaving. > **Conditions for Availment/Continuation** - Beneficiaries must be actively engaged in Khadi spinning and weaving activities. - Incentives are provided in addition to central government assistance. - Must maintain production records for verification purposes.
Eligibility:
- The applicant must EITHER be Khadi spinners engaged in spinning of yarn activities, OR Khadi weavers engaged in weaving of Khadi activities. - The applicant must be provided production incentive for spinning of yarn/ weaving of Khadi.
> **Categories and Preferences** **General Category:** Eligible for standard assistance rates. **Scheduled Caste:** Eligible for standard assistance rates same as General category. **Women:** Eligible for enhanced assistance rates for spinning activities. **Scheduled Tribe:** Eligible for highest assistance rates for both spinning and weaving activities.

schemeName: Sharodotsav Pandit Nandan Mehta: Plan for Conducting Classical Music Competition and Ceremony
Details:
The scheme "Sharodotsav Pandit Nandan Mehta: Plan for Conducting Classical Music Competition and Ceremony" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to preserve and promote the rich heritage of classical music and percussion through a state-level competitive platform dedicated to the memory of the legendary percussionist Pt. Nandan Mehta. A three-day classical music and percussion competition is held every year on February 26, the death anniversary of Pt. Mehta, where outstanding artists are recognized and awarded monetary prizes for their exceptional performances. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Sangeet Natak Academy. <br>
The scheme "Sharodotsav Pandit Nandan Mehta: Plan for Conducting Classical Music Competition and Ceremony" aims to promote classical music and percussion by organizing a state-level competition and award ceremony on the death anniversary of Pt. Nandan Mehta, through the provision of cash prizes.

Eligibility: - The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant should be an individual participating in the classical music or percussion category.

schemeName: Protection Against Domestic Violence
Details:
The scheme &quot;Protection Against Domestic Violence&quot; by the Women and Child Development Department, Government of Haryana, aims to support women who are subjected to physical, emotional, verbal, sexual, or economic abuse within a domestic relationship. The scheme facilitates timely and confidential intervention by trained counselors and protection officers. Women victims can receive emotional and legal assistance, mediation, and safety measures, including shelter and medical aid where needed.
The scheme "Protection Against Domestic Violence" by the Women and Child Development Department, Government of Haryana, aims to provide legal, emotional, and social support to women facing domestic violence through grievance redressal, offering protection, counseling, and mediation to victims.
Benefits: - **Counseling and Mediation Support:** Victims are provided with trained counselors for psychological support and help in mediation between the victim and the perpetrator if required.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a female. 1. The applicant should be a resident of Haryana.

schemeName: Sero Positive Illness Scheme
Details:
Launched in 2009, the scheme &quot;Sero Positive Illness Scheme&quot; by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat aims to support the education of children affected by or born into families impacted by Sero Positive illness. Through this scheme, financial scholarships and support for school uniform, books, tuition fees, food, and hostel expenses are provided to destitute and orphaned children across education levels—from primary school to postgraduate studies. The scheme is implemented by the Director, Social Security Department, Gujarat State, Gandhinagar, and at the district level, by the District Social Security Officer or District Child Protection Officer.
The scheme "Sero Positive Illness Scheme" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat aims to provide educational scholarships to orphaned and destitute children affected by Sero Positive illness.

schemeName: Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students of Notified Tribes and Denotified Tribes Castes
Details:
The “Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students of Notified Tribes and Denotified Tribes Castes” was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. It aims to reduce school dropout rates and improve educational access among students belonging to Notified Tribes and Denotified Tribes. Under this scheme, annual financial scholarships are provided to students from classes 1st to 10th studying in government and aided primary schools, ensuring they continue their education without financial hardship.
The scheme supports school education by providing annual scholarships to students from Notified Tribes and Denotified Tribes studying in standards 1st to 10th.
Benefits: > **Scholarship Amounts:** - Boys (Class 1st to 8th): ₹750/- per annum- Boys (Class 9th to 10th): ₹1,000/- per annum- Girls (Class 1st to 5th): ₹500/- per annum- Girls (Class 6th to 10th): ₹1,000/- per annum
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must belong to Notified Tribes or Denotified Tribes as recognized by the Government of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must be a student and studying in standard 1st to 10th. 1. The applicant must be studying in a government or government-aided primary or secondary school. 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. There is no income limit for students from standard 1st to 8th. 1. The applicant’s annual family income must not exceed ₹6,00,000/- for classes 9th to 10th.

Application Process.process: > **Application Process:** **Step 01:** The applicant may visit the Digital Gujarat Portal: [https://www.digitalgujarat.gov.in/](https://www.digitalgujarat.gov.in/) **Step 02:** On the home page, click on ‘Register’ and the applicant will be redirected to the registration form page. **Step 03:** Enter your Mobile Number, Email, Set Password, and then click on ‘Save’. **Step 04:** After successful registration, the applicant can login through his/her User Name (Mobile No./Email ID) and Password. **Step 05:** Now, click on ‘My Profile’ to update your profile and fill in all the mandatory information. **Step 06:** After filling in profile details, click on ‘Update Profile’. The profile will be updated after entering the verification Code (OTP). **Step 07:** Now under services, select ‘Scholarship Services’ and then click on ‘SC Scheme’. **Step 08:** Select the Financial Year for which you want to apply for and then click on ‘Change Financial Year’. **Step 09:** Select the scheme, read the interaction carefully, and then click on ‘Continue to Service’. **Step 10:** Fill in the application form completely and upload all the relevant documents. **Step 11:** Now, click on ‘Save as Draft’ and agree with the terms & conditions, and submit the application form by clicking on ‘Confirm & Final Submit’. <br> > **Instructions:** **Note 01:** Photo uploading for all applicants is mandatory. Note 02: Application will be considered complete only when all sections are completed. **Note 03:** Only one application per applicant will be acceptable for a scholarship. If any student submits more than one application either from a single institute or from multiple institutions his/her all applications will be rejected by the competent authority and no request from any side will be entertained. **Note 04:** In case of any wrong/misleading information provided in the application shall lead to rejection of the application by Department Authorities. **Note 05:** All required documents must be carefully scanned as per the instructions given. **Note 06:** The student has to fill his/her application carefully as there is no provision for institution change once the application is submitted successfully. **Note 07:** The unreadable uploaded documents will allow the competent authority to reject the student application. **Note 08:** Direct Individual submission of this application form will not be accepted in case of students studying inside the state. schemeName: "Marketing Incentive" under the "Handloom Marketing Assistance" Component of the National Handloom Development Programme
Details:
The scheme "Marketing Incentive" under the "Handloom Marketing Assistance" Component of the National Handloom Development Programme by the Ministry of Textiles, Government of India, aims to develop and promote marketing channels in domestic and export markets in a holistic and integrated manner to bring greater visibility to the sector and ensure commensurate remuneration to weavers. The scheme provides Marketing Incentive calculated at 10% on average sales of handloom products of the last 3 years with maximum caps of ₹1,00,00,000/- for state level organizations and ₹15,00,000/- lakh for primary societies, equally shared between State Government and Central Government except for National Level Handloom Organizations where entire assistance is borne by Government of India. The scheme is implemented by the Office of Development Commissioner (Handlooms) under Ministry of Textiles with applications accepted through prescribed proformas and State Government recommendations.
The scheme aims to develop and promote marketing channels for handloom products to bring greater visibility to the sector and ensure commensurate remuneration to weavers. It provides Marketing Incentive to eligible handloom agencies for creating conducive conditions for marketing handloom products.
Benefits:
> **Financial Assistance Structure** - Marketing Incentive Rate: 10% on average sales of handloom products of the last 3 years. - State Level Organizations: Maximum ₹100.00 lakh (Central Government share). - Primary Level Organizations: Maximum ₹15.00 lakh (Central Government share). > **Category-wise Maximum Caps** - State Level Organizations (Handloom Corporations, Apex Cooperative Societies, National Level Handloom Organizations): ₹1,00,00,000/- Central Government share. - Primary Handloom Weavers Cooperative Societies, Producer Companies, Self Help Groups, Joint Liability Groups, Federations and Other Eligible Handloom Entities: ₹15,00,000/- Central Government share. > **Financial Assistance Sharing** - General Cases: 50:50 sharing between Government of India and State Government. - National Level Handloom Organizations/Societies: Entire assistance borne by Government of India. - Benefit Distribution: 10% benefits shared equally between Organizations and Member Weavers through Direct Benefit Transfer.
> **Mode and Frequency of Disbursement** - Marketing Incentive will be given maximum for 3 years during the scheme period of 5 years. - Release through Direct Benefit Transfer mechanism. - Nodal Agency must release amount to eligible handloom agencies and their member weavers within 7 days of receipt. > **Conditions for Availment/Continuation** - Amount to be used towards activities that attract consumers to gear up overall sales of handloom goods. - Enable handloom agencies to adjust prices towards increasing cost competitiveness, improve designs, and invest in infrastructure. - State Government recommendation subject to matching contribution by concerned State Government. - Claims must be Goods and Services Tax compliant. - No similar incentive/rebate received under any other Central Government scheme.
Eligibility: The applicant must be one of the following: - Handloom agencies including State level organizations such as Handloom Corporations, Apex Cooperative Societies and National Level Handloom Organizations, Primary Handloom Weavers Cooperative Societies, Producer Companies, Self Help Groups, Joint Liability Groups, Federations and Other eligible Handloom entities. - The applicant must have made the final transaction of product sale to the consumer. - The applicant must use Handloom Mark or India Handloom Brand for their handloom products. - The applicant must have average sales turnover of handloom products for the last 3 years for incentive calculation.

Application Process.process:
> **For State Level and Primary Level Organizations** **Step 1:** **Prepare Claim Documentation** Compile sales bills/invoices, yarn purchase bills, and average sales turnover details for the last 3 years ensuring Goods and Services Tax compliance. **Step 2:** **Complete Application Form** Fill the prescribed proforma (Annexure - B8) with all required details including sales data and beneficiary information. **Step 3:** **Submit to State Government** Submit the completed Marketing Incentive claim to the concerned State Government with all supporting documents. **Step 4:** **State Government Verification** State Government will verify claims, ensure matching contribution availability, and complete prescribed certificates (Annexure - B9). **Step 5:** **State Level Project Committee Recommendation** Obtain recommendations from State Level Project Committee for the Marketing Incentive claims. **Step 6:** **State Government Consolidation** State Government prepares consolidated statement, sanction order for state share release, and certificate as per Annexure - B10. **Step 7:** **Nodal Agency Identification** State Government identifies suitable nodal agency for fund aggregation and onward release to eligible agencies. Step 8: Forward to Development Commissioner (Handlooms) State Government forwards verified claims to Office of Development Commissioner (Handlooms) with all required documentation. **Step 9:** **Central Government Processing** Office of Development Commissioner (Handlooms) processes claims and releases Central Government share to identified Nodal Agency. **Step 10:** **Fund Distribution** Nodal Agency releases amount to eligible handloom agencies and their member weavers through Direct Benefit Transfer within 7 days of receipt.
> **For National Level Handloom Organizations** **Step 1:** **Direct Application Preparation** Prepare Marketing Incentive claim with all supporting documents and prescribed proforma (Annexure - B8). **Step 2:** **Submit to Development Commissioner (Handlooms)** Submit claims directly to Office of Development Commissioner (Handlooms) with complete documentation. **Step 3:** **Central Government Processing** Office of Development Commissioner (Handlooms) processes and approves claims for National Level Organizations. **Step 4:** **Direct Release** Marketing Incentive assistance released directly to National Level Handloom Organizations by Government of India.

Documents Required: **At Application Stage** - Sales Bills/invoices for Handloom Products (Goods and Services Tax Compliant), - Yarn Purchase Bills (Goods and Services Tax Compliant). - Average Sales Turnover Details of Handloom Products for the Last 3 Years. - Handloom Mark or India Handloom Brand Usage Documentation. - Final Transaction Proof of Product Sale to Consumer. **For State Government Processing** - Certificate as Per Prescribed Proforma ([Annexure - B9](https://handlooms.nic.in/assets/img/Final%20Revised%20%20Guidelines%20NHDP%2012.04.2023.pdf)) for Each Individual Claim.- Consolidated Statement of All Claims. - Recommendations of State Level Project Committee. - Sanction Order for Release of State Share. - Documentary Proof of Amount Transferred to Beneficiaries. - Certificate as Per Prescribed Proforma ([Annexure - B10](https://handlooms.nic.in/assets/img/Final%20Revised%20%20Guidelines%20NHDP%2012.04.2023.pdf)).- Identification of Suitable Nodal Agency for Fund Aggregation and Release. **At Verification Stage** - Utilization Certificate From Nodal Agency. - Certificate Of Direct Benefit Transfer Release Within 7 Days. - Details Of Beneficiaries (State Share And Government Of India Share) Uploaded In Public Domain. **NOTE:** All sales bills/invoices and yarn purchase bills must be Goods and Services Tax compliant for claiming Marketing Incentive.

Differently Abled & Senior Citizens Assistance Corporation, Andhra Pradesh, under its Action Plan 2017-18. The walking sticks are distributed by the Assistant Directors, Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled & Senior Citizens, and District Managers, A.P. Differently Abled & Senior Citizens Assistance Corporation.
The "Sanction of Adult Sticks to Senior Citizens" scheme aims to provide walking sticks to senior citizens. This initiative ensures that eligible senior citizens receive the necessary support to enhance their mobility and independence.

schemeName: Mahila Samriddhi Yojana (for women only) GNTDNT
Details:
The scheme "Mahila Samriddhi Yojana" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to create a microfinance scheme for women of target groups and women entrepreneurs doing independent business to create self-employment for women of nomadic and denotified castes. Under this scheme, women beneficiaries will be able to pursue a business/occupation of their choice. Gujarat Nomadic and Denotified Castes Development Corporation implement the scheme.
The scheme aims to create self-employment for women of nomadic and denotified castes and support women entrepreneurs doing independent business. Through this scheme, microfinance is provided to women beneficiaries to pursue a business/occupation of their choice.
Benefits: 1. The maximum loan limit will be up to ₹1,25,000/-. 1. The interest rate will be 4% per annum. 1. Under this scheme, 100% loan of the business/occupation amount is provided. 1. The loan amount will consist of 95% National Corporation contribution, 5% State Government contribution and zero beneficiary contribution. > **Repayment:** The loan amount will have to be repaid in 48 equal monthly instalments, including interest.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a woman from a Nomadic or Denotified Caste. 1. The annual income limit of the family for income eligibility will be up to ₹3,00,000/- with effect from 1/4/2018. At least 50 percent of the total loan amount will be allocated for families having an annual income of up to ₹1,50,000/-. 1. The applicant's age should be at least 21 years and not more than 50 years as on the date of application. 1. The applicant must have experience in a technical and skilled trade/business. 1. The applicant will have to provide suitable collateral to get the loan.

Application Process.process: **Step 1: Visit the Official Portal** - Go to the [Official Website](https://gndcdconline.gujarat.gov.in/) Gujarat Nomadic and Denotified Tribes Development Corporation. - Scroll down on the homepage, find the "Mahila Samriddhi Yojana" and click on "Apply Now". - You will be directed to the application form. **Step 2: Access and Fill Out the Application Form** - Complete all sections under "Applicant information," including full name, father/husband's name, gender, complete address details, contact numbers, Aadhaar No., parents/husband/guardian occupation and income details. Also provide Date of Birth, Age, Caste, and Subspecies. Also, if you are disabled and provide a percentage. - If you have taken a past loan, select "Yes" or "No". If you selected "Yes", provide loan details (date, amount, paid, remaining) and your account number. - Provide bank account number, bank name, branch name, name as per account, account type (Saving/Current), MICR code, and IFSC code. **Step 3: Upload Documents** - Go to "Upload Photo" in the menu, then upload your photograph and signature (each file less than 15 KB). Click "Save Photo and Signature" - Navigate to "Upload Document" in the menu and upload all required files (PDF, JPG, JPEG, PNG only). **Step 4: Review and Final Submission** - Carefully review each module. Use the preview option to examine the application before final submission. Fill out the provided "CAPTCHA" and Click on “Submit”. **Track and Review Status** - Applicant will receive an Application ID/Reference Number. Save or print the acknowledgement for future tracking. - Go to the [Official Website](https://gndcdconline.gujarat.gov.in/) Gujarat Nomadic and Denotified Tribes Development Corporation. - Scroll down and locate the Know App Status. Click on "Know App Status". - Select the Scheme name, Enter App No., and Birth Date. Fill out the Captcha and click on Submit.

Documents Required: 1. Caste Certificate. 1. Income Certificate. 1. Age Proof. 1. Experience Certificate. 1. Collateral Documents. 1. Photograph. 1. Signature.

schemeName: Mukhyamantri Rajya Krishi Vikas Yojana
Benefits: 1. **Breeder Seed Production:** To be carried out at Pantnagar University’s research farms, with 25% nurseries in autumn and 75% in spring. A subsidy of ₹100/quintal is provided, split into two parts—one for input costs and one at the time of seed distribution.1. **Aadhaar (Foundation) Nursery:** Establishment of nurseries with a subsidy of ₹50/quintal, up to a maximum of ₹15,000/-.1. **Primary Nursery**: Subsidy of ₹25/quintal on seed distribution, with a cap of ₹10,000/-.1. **Field Demonstrations:** Demonstration of new sugarcane sowing technologies on 0.5 ha plots, with ₹7,500/- subsidy per farmer.1. **Seed Transportation & Harvesting:** 100% subsidy on actual cost of transporting elite seed from research farms to licensed buyers or development councils.1. **Agricultural Equipment Subsidy**: Distribution of manually operated sugarcane cultivation machines under the Sub-Mission on Agricultural Mechanization scheme.1. **Seed Price Differential Support:** Subsidy on actual cost of sugarcane seed sourced from any recognized research center (within or outside the state).1. **Pest, Disease & Weed Control:** 50% subsidy or up to ₹3,000/- per hectare for weed and pest management.1. **Micronutrient, Organic & Bio-fertilizer Support:** 50% subsidy or up to ₹1,000/- per hectare to improve cultivation and sugar recovery.1. **Farmer Training & Awareness:** Promotion of scientific sugarcane farming through publicity, soil testing, and training at the village and district levels.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant should be a sugarcane farmer.
1. The applicant can be a co-operative sugarcane society.
1. The applicant can be a progressive sugarcane farmer engaged in improved sugarcane cultivation.

Application Process.process: To avail the benefits of this scheme, the selection of sugarcane farmers is done after discussion with public representatives in a Gram Sabha (village assembly) meeting at the village level and a survey by the Sugarcane Supervisor, followed by approval from departmental officers (Sugarcane Development Inspector, Senior Sugarcane Development Inspector, and Assistant Sugarcane Commissioner).

1. Proof of Address
1. Land Records
1. Bank Passbook
1. Farmer Registration Certificate
1. Passport Size Photographs

schemeName: Scholarship for Ph.D. Students of Socially and Educationally Backward Classes
Details:
The “Scholarship for Ph.D. Students of Socially and Educationally Backward Classes” scheme was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to Socially and Educationally Backward Classes (SEBC) students pursuing M.Phil. or Ph.D. to encourage higher education and research.
The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to Socially and Educationally Backward Classes (SEBC) students pursuing M.Phil. or Ph.D. to encourage higher education and research.
Benefits: **Scholarship Assistance:** - ₹25,000/- for students pursuing M.Phil. - ₹1,00,000/- for students preparing Ph.D thesis.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should belong to the Socially and Educationally Backward Classes (SEBC). 1. The applicant should be pursuing M.Phil or Ph.D at a recognized institution. 1. The applicant’s annual family income should not exceed ₹6,00,000/-.

Application Process.process: > **Application Process:** **Step 1:** The applicant may visit the Digital Gujarat Portal: [https://www.digitalgujarat.gov.in/](https://www.digitalgujarat.gov.in/) **Step 2:** On the home page, click on ‘Register’ and the applicant will be redirected to the registration form page. **Step 3:** Enter your Mobile Number, Email, Set Password, and then click on ‘Save’. **Step 4:** After successful registration, the applicant can login through his/her User Name (Mobile No./Email ID) and Password. **Step 5:** Now, click on ‘My Profile’ to update your profile and fill in all the mandatory information. **Step 6:** After filling in profile details, click on ‘Update Profile’. The profile will be updated after entering the verification Code (OTP). **Step 7:** Now under services, select ‘Scholarship Services’ and then click on ‘SC Scheme’. **Step 8:** Select the Financial Year for which you want to apply for and then click on ‘Change Financial Year’. **Step 9:** Select the scheme, read the interaction carefully, and then click on ‘Continue to Service’. **Step 10:** Fill in the application form completely and upload all the relevant documents. **Step 11:** Now, click on ‘Save as Draft’ and agree with the terms & conditions, and submit the application form by clicking on ‘Confirm & Final Submit’. > **Instructions:** **Note 1:** Photo uploading for all applicants is mandatory. **Note 2:** Application will be considered complete only when all sections are completed. **Note 3:** Only one application per applicant will be acceptable for a scholarship. If any student submits more than one application either from a single institute or from multiple institutions his/her all applications will be rejected by the competent authority and no request from any side will be entertained. **Note 4:** In case of any wrong/misleading information provided in the application shall lead to rejection of the application by Department Authorities. **Note 5:** All required documents must be carefully scanned as per the instructions given. **Note 6:** The student has to fill his/her application carefully as there is no provision for institution change once the application is submitted successfully. **Note 7:** The unreadable uploaded documents will allow the competent authority to reject the student application. **Note 8:** Direct Individual submission of this application form will not be accepted in case of students studying inside the state. schemeName: Scheme for Providing Incentives to Coaches of Athletes who have Won Competitions at the National and International Levels
Details:
The “Scheme for Providing Incentives to Coaches of Athletes who have Won Competitions at the National and International Levels” scheme was launched by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to honour coaches who have significantly contributed to the success of athletes in the field of sports. Under this scheme, financial incentives are provided to coaches of athletes who have won competitions at national and international levels.
The scheme aims to honour coaches who have significantly contributed to the success of athletes in the field of sports. Under this scheme, financial incentives are provided to coaches of athletes who have won competitions at national and international levels.
Benefits: Under this scheme, financial incentives of up to 10% of the prize money awarded are provided to coaches of winning players in national and international level competitions, subject to a maximum limit of ₹10 lakh.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be domiciled in the State of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must be a coach of an athlete/player who has won a national or international level competition. 1. The scheme is applicable to coaches of players who have received cash sports talent awards in the year 2015-16 and onwards. 1. The coach should be employed in the Sports Department of the State Government on a permanent or contract basis. 1. The coach must have trained at least five players. 1. The coach must provide supporting evidence from the players who have undergone training. 1. Online, postal, or telephonic coaching will not be considered.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** The interested applicant should visit office of the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. **Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). **Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form, along with the required documents, to the office of the Sports, Youth, and Cultural Activities Department.

Documents Required: 1. Aadhaar Card 1. Affidavit 1. Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque 1. Domicile Certificate 1. Supporting evidence who have undergone training 1. Passport Size Photos

schemeName: Madho Singh Bhandari Cooperative Collective Farming Scheme
Details:
The scheme "Madho Singh Bhandari Cooperative Collective Farming Scheme" by the Cooperative Department, Government of Uttarakhand, aims to uplift the living standards of cooperative society and committee members by enabling large-scale production, storage, and release of finished products at remunerative prices and providing them fair prices for their products. Through this scheme, the establishment of a collective cooperative integrated farming model, conversion of barren and vacant land into cultivable land, increased production through collective farming clusters, promotion of reverse migration, development of M.PAX as a business entity, creation of livelihood opportunities, promotion of diverse crop production, promotion of agri-tourism, and employment generation are provided to the cooperative society and committee members and local villagers.
The scheme aims to uplift the living standards of the cooperative society and committee members by enabling large-scale production, storage, and release of finished products. Through this scheme, integrated farming models, increased production, and livelihood opportunities are provided.
Benefits:
1. Establishment of a collective cooperative integrated farming model that can be replicated in every block of Uttarakhand. 
1. Conversion of barren and vacant land into cultivable land, expanding agricultural areas and increasing potential yield.
1. To increase production by developing collective farming clusters through cooperative societies and to provide a proper market for the crops produced.
1. Initiatives to promote reverse migration within the state, encouraging people to return to their native places for livelihood.
1. To the development of M.PAX as a business entity, likely strengthening the cooperative framework for economic activities.
1. To create livelihood opportunities for local villagers through commercial farming. 
1. To promote the production of vegetables, coarse cereals, pulses, fruits, mushrooms, herbs, fodder crops, etc., through improved agricultural technologies and modern farming practices. 
1. Promotion of agri-tourism under the C.C.F. (Collective Cooperative Farming) model, diversifying income sources and promoting rural tourism.
1. Promotion of other agriculture-related activities in the surrounding area, like agriculture, tourism, dairy, etc. 
1. Employment generation through different activities during project implementation.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a cooperative society member or a committee member of a cooperative society. 1. The unit should be actively engaged in collective cooperative integrated farming, where farmers are organized in clusters to convert barren and vacant land into cultivable land.

Application Process.process:
- Contact Cooperative Society: Approach your local Multipurpose Cooperative Society or District Cooperative Office.
- Submit Proposal: The society submits a proposal for collective farming cluster development to the Cooperative Department.
- Approval & Formation: Upon approval, cooperative members collaborate to convert land, adopt modern techniques, and begin collective farming.

Documents Required:
1. Registration Certificate of the cooperative society.
1. Resolution from the society agreeing to participate in the scheme.
1. List of Member Farmers involved in the proposed collective farming.
1. Land-related Documents (such as lease agreements or ownership proof for the cluster land).
1. Cluster Farming Proposal/Plan (with details of land use, crops, members, budget, etc.).

schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland): Construction of New Grow-out Pond - Gujarat
Details:
The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland)", with the component of Construction of New Grow-out Pond, introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat. Through this scheme, assistance is provided for the construction of new grow-out ponds to individuals and organisations involved in inland fisheries. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries of the State Governments, with 60% contribution from the Government of India and 40% from the Government of Gujarat.
> **Objective:** - Increase fish production by rearing fish in reservoirs and provide employment to people involved in inland fisheries activities. - Assistance is provided for accelerating inland fish farming activities in freshwater bodies, increasing inland fish production and boosting inland fisheries. - Except for water bodies or ponds, in less land, less water, Biofloc with source as well, Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS). By creating fish tanks with this method, more fish production can be obtained in less land and less water. If more beneficiaries get the benefit of the subsidy of this scheme, more fish production can be achieved with less water sources and less land. - Inland fish production capacity can be increased by the establishment of freshwater hatcheries.
The scheme aims to enhance fish production and provide employment through inland fisheries. It offers financial support to construct new grow-out ponds for eligible beneficiaries.
Benefits:
> Financial assistance is provided for the Construction of the New Grow-out Pond (PMMSY). The unit cost of the project is ₹7,00,000/- per hectare. - **General Category:** 40% of the unit cost (₹2,80,000/- per hectare).- **Women/Scheduled Caste (SC)/Scheduled Tribe (ST) Category:** 60% of the unit cost (₹4,20,000/- per hectare).
> **Conditions Associated with Benefits:** 60% of the contribution is from the Government of India and 40% from the State Government. > **Frequency of Disbursement:** Once in a lifetime.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant must be an individual, society, self-help group, association, reservoir lease holder, or private entity involved in inland fisheries activities. 1. The applicant must be above 18 years of age. 1. The applicant must have their own bank account. 1. The applicant must have their own private land or a minimum 10-year lease agreement for land to avail construction-related assistance on land. In case of co-owners, the consent form of co-owners must be submitted. 1. The applicant must have a Voter ID/Ration Card/Aadhar Card/Passport as proof of identity.
> **Preference/Priority/Reservation/Relaxation:** - All categories (General, Women, Scheduled Caste, and Scheduled Tribe) will receive benefits under the Inland Schemes. - Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries are required to have a Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe certificate to avail benefits under the inland components.

Application Process.process:
> **Registration Process:** **Step 1:** The applicant may visit and apply online at the [I-Khedut Portal](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/). **Step 2:** Click on 'Login' from the top right-hand side, then click on "Beneficiary Registration" and select any one from the 'Farmer' or 'Institutional' or 'Except For the Farmer' as the Beneficiary Type. **Step 3:** Enter the 'Company Name' and Address if you have selected 'Institutional' or 'Except For the Farmer' as the Beneficiary Type. And for all select the District, Taluka, and Village, choose 'what type of account holder you are?', enter your Account Number and Name, solve the Captcha, and click 'Save and Next'. **Step 4:** Enter your Mobile Number and E-mail address, click 'Send OTP', enter the received OTP, create and confirm a Password, solve the Captcha, and click 'Submit'.
> **Login Process:** **Step 1:** The applicant may visit and apply online at the [I-Khedut Portal](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/). **Step 2:** Click on 'Login' from the top right-hand side of the homepage. On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’. **Step 3:** Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button, and an application page will open. **Step 4:** Click on the "Apply New" button and submit a new application. **Step 5:** Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application. **Step 6:** Once the application is done, confirm it. **Step 7:** Take a printout of the confirmed application.
> **Contact Us:** [**Click here**](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/Public/frm_Public_Contacts.aspx)**.**

Documents Required: 1. Voter ID/Ration Card/Aadhaar Card/Passport (as proof of identity). 1. Bank Account Details. 1. Land Ownership Documents (if applicant has own private land). 1. Lease Agreement (minimum 10 years, if applicable). 1. Consent Form of Co-owners (in case of co-owned land). 1. Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe Certificate (for Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries).

schemeName: Lakshya Scheme
Details:
The state scheme "LAKSHYA" was launched by the Directorate of Higher Education, Government of Tripura. The objective of the scheme is to provide financial support in the form of Scholarship to the candidates having permanent residence in Tripura, clearing Civil Services Examination (CSE) conducted by Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) to adequately equip them, to mould them to acquire such knowledge and skill to compete with the candidates of other states in the civil services examination. The intervention will be in the form of direct financial support to candidates clearing the Civil Services, which includes Part I (Prelims to main), candidates who cleared prelims and are appearing for the mains. Part II (Mains to Interview candidates who are invited to appear for the interview) is conducted by UPSC.
The scheme aims to provide financial support in the form of scholarships to candidates who are permanent residents of Tripura and clear the Civil Service Examination (Prelims/Mains) conducted by UPSC.
Benefits: > **Part I: Candidate Clears the Civil Services Prelims Exam and Will Be Appearing for the Mains Exam** - ₹1,00,000/- (₹70,000/- for coaching centre fee & study material cost­, and ₹30,000/- for travelling cost), extended from the date of publication of result till the date of Mains examination (date of last paper) > **Part II: Candidate Clears the Mains Exam and is Invited for an Interview by UPSC** - ₹20,000/-, extended from the date of publication of results of Mains and the date of interview. > **Mode of Disbursement** - The monthly payment will be done in the Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) mode by the Implementing Agency. - The financial support will be given to a candidate once for Part I and once for Part II. - The candidate needs to tell the Implementing Agency about the Main exam date two months before it happens. - If the candidate gets called for an interview, he/she should also inform them before the interview date.
Eligibility: 1. The Candidates should be a domicile of Tripura. 1. The Candidate should have cleared the Civil Services Exam (Prelims Exam) conducted by the UPSC. 1. The combined annual family income of the candidate should not exceed ₹10,00,000/-. 1. A candidate can receive assistance only twice, regardless of how many times he/she attempts to pass the exam.

Application Process.process: > **Registration Process:** - Applicant should visit the Beneficiary Management Ecosystem (BMS) Govt. of Tripura [portal](https://bms.tripura.gov.in/bms/). - Click on "Citizen Login" and then select "Register here." - Student fill in the required fields: Full Name, Email ID, and Mobile Number. - Enter the OTP received on the registered mobile number to complete the registration process. - After registration, login using either the registered Mobile Number or Email ID and enter the received OTP. > **Apply on Departmental Schemes:** -
