schemeName: Kanyashree Prakalpa
Details:
The scheme "Kanyashree Prakalpa" by the Department of Women Development and Social Welfare and Child Development (DWD), Government of West Bengal, aims to improve the status and well-being of girls, specifically those from socio-economically disadvantaged families. Through this scheme, Conditional Cash Transfers are provided to incentivise girls to continue their education for a longer period and disincentivise early marriage. > **Objectives:** 1. Incentivising girls to continue in education for a longer period of time, and complete secondary, higher secondary, higher education, or equivalent in technical, vocational, or sports streams, thereby giving them a better footing in both the economic and social spheres. 1. Disincentivising marriage until at least the age of 18, the legal age of marriage, thereby reducing the risks of early pregnancies, associated risks of maternal and child mortality, and other debilitating health conditions, including those of malnutrition. 1. It was also decided that the Scheme should confer more than just monetary support; it should be a means of financial inclusion and a tool of empowerment for adolescent girls. The schemes' benefits are therefore paid directly to bank accounts in the girls' names, leaving the decision of utilisation of the money in their hands. 1. To reinforce the positive impact of increased education and delayed marriages, the scheme also works to enhance the social power and self-esteem of girls through a targeted behaviour change communication strategy. The communication strategy not only builds awareness of the scheme, but includes adolescent-friendly approaches like events, competitions and Kanyashree clubs, and the endorsement of strong women figures as role models to promote social and psychological empowerment.
The scheme to improve the status and wellbeing of girls, specifically those from socio-economically disadvantaged families, through Conditional Cash Transfers by: Incentivising them to continue in education for a longer period of time, and complete secondary or higher secondary education.
Benefits: Kanyashree Prakalpa offers two types of benefits: 1. **Annual Scholarship (K1):** A cash benefit of ₹1,000/- is paid annually to the girls in the age group 13 to 18 years (studying in Class VIII equivalent or above for every year that they remain in education, provided they are unmarried at the time.1. **One-Time Grant (K2):** A grant of ₹25,000/- is paid after a girl turns 18, provided that she was engaged in an academic or occupational pursuit and was unmarried.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a resident of West Bengal. 1. The applicant should be enrolled and regularly attending an educational institution. 1. The applicant should be unmarried. 1. The applicant should be from a family where the total income is not more than ₹1,20,000/- per year. 1. The applicant for the Annual Scholarship (K1) should be between the ages of 13 and 18 years. 1. The applicant for the One-Time Grant (K2) should be between the ages of 18 and 19 years. 1. The applicant should have a bank account opened in their own name, and the name on the application form must match the name on the bank account. 1. The educational institution that the applicant is studying in must be registered in West Bengal and recognized by the government.
> **Educational Institution Type Eligibility:****** The applicant will be eligible for Kanyashree's Annual Scholarship or the One-Time Grant if they are studying in any of the following: - In Class VIII or above in a school, madrassah, or equivalent open school course. - In a college or an equivalent open university course. - A Vocational Training Centre, Technical Training Centre, or Industrial Training Centre. - Girls enrolled in Sports Institutes may apply for the One-Time Grant; however, they cannot apply for the Annual Scholarship. > **Relaxations:** Girls who are specially-abled (with a disability of 40% or more), or are living in a Home registered under the Juvenile Justice Act, 2000, or have lost both parents, may apply for Kanyashree even if their family's income is more than ₹1,20,000/- per year.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1: Obtain the application form from the educational institution where the applicant is studying.** - For the Annual Scholarship, request the K1 form, which is printed on light green paper. - For the One-Time Grant, request the K2 form, which is printed on light blue paper. - If you have previously received a K1 and are still below 18 years and fulfilling other conditions (renewal), get in touch with your Head of Institution (HOI), who will verify your unmarried status and age and process your renewal. - If you have received K1 and have crossed 18 years (up-gradation), collect a pre-printed K2 Up-gradation form from the institution, fill it up, and submit it. Do not fill up the colored K2 form if you have already received K1, as you will be treated as a duplicate applicant. **Step 2:** **Open a bank account in your name :** - You must have a bank account in your name when applying for the Scheme. This is because Kanyashree's benefits will be sent by the government DIRECTLY to your bank account. If you do not have a bank account, ask your institution's head teacher to assist you in opening one. - Please ensure the spelling of your name do not differ in the bank account and that of the application form. **Step 3:** **Fill up the application form :** - You or your parents need to fill up all the details in the form. Again, your teachers and head teacher may be approached to help if you are not sure what to do. Your form needs to be signed by several people – check page 3 of the application form. > **Caution:** - Check the spelling of your name that you are going to enter in the application form. It must be the same as that of your bank account. - Please enter your mobile number correctly because you will get updates regarding the status of your application on your mobile number entered in the form. - Put your signature on pages 1,2, and 3 of the form. - Preserve the acknowledgement form for further tracking of your application. **Step 4:** **Provide Necessary Documents:** - Submit photocopies of the required documents (refer to the "DOCUMENTS REQUIRED" section). **Step 5:** **Collect Acknowledgement Receipt:** - The Kanyashree application form has a tear-off section on Page 3 titled "Acknowledgement as per WBRTPS Act 2013." When the completed application form is submitted to the Head Teacher, they will fill in the details, sign it, apply an official stamp, tear off that portion, and hand it over to the applicant. Keep this acknowledgement slip carefully as it contains the Form No., name, and other details, serving as proof of application for Kanyashree.
> **Track Your Application:** Once the complete application with all supporting documents is handed over to the institution, the application is uploaded onto the [Kanyashree Portal](https://www.wbkanyashree.gov.in/). Applicants can track their application status on the portal using their Form No. (found on the Acknowledgement Slip). If the applicant changes institutions after receiving the annual scholarship, the previous Head of Institution must transfer the Kanyashree record online to the new institution to enable processing of further applications.

Documents Required: 1. Birth Certificate (mandatory for K2; for K1, school record certification allowed if unavailable initially) 1. Unmarried Status Declaration (signed by parent) 1. Family Income Certificate (not required for those eligible under the relaxed criteria) 1. Disability Certificate (only for specially-abled applicants, if applicable) 1. Death Certificates of Parents (if both parents are deceased, along with guardian’s statement) 1. Juvenile Justice Act Home Residence Proof (if applicable) 1. Bank Passbook Copy (showing name, account number, and address)

schemeName: Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students of Socially and Educationally Backward Class
Details:
The scheme "Pre-Matric Scholarship for the Students of Socially and Educationally Backward Class" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance to promote education among socially and educationally backwards students. Through this scheme, scholarships per annum are provided to boys and girls studying in Standards 1 to 10 in government and aided schools. The scheme is implemented by the Director, Developing Caste Welfare, Gandhinagar, Gujarat.
The scheme aims to provide financial aid to promote education. Scholarships are provided to eligible students of Standards 1 to 10.
Benefits: 1. **For Boys (Std. 1 to 8):** ₹750/- scholarship.1. **For Boys (Std. 9 to 10):** ₹1000/- scholarship.1. **For Girls (Std. 1 to 5):** ₹500/- scholarship.1. **For Girls (Std. 6 to 10):** ₹1000/- scholarship.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to the Socially and Educationally Backward Class (SEBC). 1. The applicant should be studying in Standard 1 to 10. 1. The applicant should be enrolled in a Government or Aided Primary/Secondary School. 1. For applicants studying in Standard 1 to 8, there is no family income limit. 1. For applicants studying in Standard 9 to 10, the annual family income of the applicant’s family should not exceed ₹6,00,000/-.

schemeName: Scheme for Integrated Development for Horticulture (HRT-2)
Details:
The scheme "Scheme for Integrated Development for Horticulture (HRT-2)" by the Agriculture and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat aims to ensure the integrated development of horticulture in the state by providing financial support to farmers for activities such as post-harvest management, farm mechanization, crop processing, market linkage, and infrastructure development. The scheme enables support for exhibitions, seminars, krishimelas, stall rentals, sea/air fridge subsidy for exports, electricity subsidy for greenhouse and tissue culture labs, and assistance for hi-tech greenhouse/polyhouse/net house development.
The scheme "Scheme for Integrated Development for Horticulture (HRT-2)" aims to promote holistic horticultural growth through financial assistance for production, processing, marketing, and infrastructure support to farmers across Gujarat.
Benefits: - **Promotional Activities Support:** Provides assistance for publications, exhibitions, competition seminars, Krishi Mela, and stall rental payments related to horticultural crops. - **Farm Mechanization:** Offers support for farm mechanization, including subsidies for power tillers and mini tractors. - **Processing Unit Establishment:** Facilitates the establishment of new distillation units for medicinal/aromatic crops and new processing units for cashew and other fruit crops. - **Export Subsidies:** Provides sea freight subsidy for the export of fruits, vegetables, flowers, and plants, and air freight subsidy for the export of horticultural produce. - **Market Rate Control:** Supports Minimum Support Price (MSP) to horticultural crops for control of market rates. - **Utility Bill Subsidies:** Offers subsidy on electricity bills for Greenhouse and Tissue Culture Laboratory. - **Equipment Provision:** Aids in the provision of harvesting equipment, processing equipment, and crop protection equipment. - **Post-Harvest Management:** Provides subsidy on packing materials for Post-harvest management of horticultural produce. - **Protected Cultivation Infrastructure:** Supports the establishment of various structures including Hi-tech Greenhouse (Fan and Pad), PolyHouse (Naturally Ventilated), Net House, kaccha mandap of tomato/chili and other vegetable trellises, Half-lined pedal for climber vegetables, Lined pedal for climber vegetables, and Plug Nursery. - **Irrigation Infrastructure:** Supports the establishment of Water storage tanks for Drip Irrigation.
Eligibility: - The applicant should be a farmer based in Gujarat. - The applicant should be engaged in horticultural activities eligible under the scheme. - The applicant must possess valid land ownership records such as 7/12 Certificate.

schemeName: State Level Awards for Divyang Persons
Details:
The scheme “State Level Awards for Divyang Persons” is implemented by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand, to honor the exceptional achievements and contributions of persons with disabilities in various fields. Under this scheme, a cash prize of ₹8,000, along with a medal and a certificate of appreciation, is awarded to outstanding individuals in categories such as disabled employees, outstanding sportspersons, and best self-employed service providers. The awards are distributed annually on the occasion of World Disability Day (December 3) to recognize and encourage excellence among persons with disabilities.
Under this scheme, a cash prize of ₹8,000/-, along with a medal and a certificate of appreciation, is awarded to outstanding individuals in categories such as disabled employees, outstanding sportspersons, and best self-employed service providers.
Benefits:
**Award Details:**

- An amount of ₹8000/- is given as a cash prize. 
- Medal and Certificate of Appreciation.

**Mode of Disbursement:**

- The amount disbursed through the cheque or bank draft at the award ceremony.

**Expected Time of Disbursement:**

- Awarded annually on December 3 (World Disability Day).
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant should be a person with a disability.
1. The applicant should have verifiable records of achievements or work.
1. The applicant should be in any one of the following categories:


- Differently-abled (Divyang) employee
- Outstanding Sportsperson
- Best Self-Employed Service Provider

Application Process.process: These awards are distributed on the occasion of World Disabled Day, observed on 3rd December. For these awards, applications are invited through newspapers. The applicant must submit the application form to the office of the District Social Welfare Officer along with the disability certificate and details of the special work done by them. After the necessary verification at the district level, and on the recommendation of the Director, Social Welfare, the Screening Committee at the government level finalizes the eligible person in each category. The award includes a certificate, a medal, and a bank draft/cheque of ₹8,000/-.

Documents Required:
1. Identity proof
1. Photographs
1. Disability Certificate
1. Detailed Description of Achievements or Contributions (in the relevant category)
1. Any Other Documents If Required

Details:

The scheme provides targeted subsidies on equipment, units, and inputs to ensure sustainable horticultural growth in tribal areas.
The scheme "Integrated Horticulture Development Program for Tribal Area Farmers (TASP) HRT-3" by the Agriculture and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to enhance the horticulture sector through financial assistance and subsidies to tribal area farmers across the state.
Benefits: > **Capacity Building & Promotion:** - Assistance for publication and promotional materials related to horticultural crops. - Financial support for organizing and participating in exhibitions, competitions, and seminars. - Subsidy for organizing or participating in Krishi Melas and payment for stall rentals. > **Farm Mechanization Support:** - Subsidy for purchase of power tillers and mini tractors to enhance horticultural productivity. - Financial aid for harvesting equipment and crop protection equipment. > **Processing & Value Addition:** - Support for establishment of new distillation units for medicinal and aromatic crops. - Subsidy for setting up new processing units for cashew and other fruit crops. - Assistance for processing equipment for value addition. > **Export Promotion:** - Sea fridge subsidy for export of fruits, vegetables, flowers, and plants. - Air fridge subsidy to promote export of horticultural produce. > **Price Stabilization:** - Minimum Support Price (MSP) assistance to ensure stable market prices for horticultural crops. > **Infrastructure & Utilities Support:** - Subsidy on electricity bills for operating greenhouses and tissue culture laboratories. - Support for hi-tech greenhouses (with fan and pad system). - Support for naturally ventilated polyhouses and net houses. > **Post-Harvest Management:** - Subsidy for packing materials used in post-harvest handling of horticultural produce. - Support for setting up kaccha mandaps for tomato/chilly and other vegetable marketing. - Construction of vegetable trellises and half-lined pedestrian paths for climbing vegetable crops.
Eligibility: - The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant should be a farmer. - The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribe (ST) category. - The applicant should be practicing horticulture in tribal areas.

schemeName: Incentive Scheme for Marrying a Disabled Young Man/Woman
Details:
The scheme "Incentive Scheme for Marrying a Disabled Young Man/Woman" is implemented by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to individuals with 40% or more disability when they marry a non-disabled person, or when both partners have disabilities.
The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹25,000/- to couples on marriage, where at least one partner has 40% or more disability and marries a non-disabled person, or where both partners have disabilities.
Benefits: On marriage, the couple is given ₹25,000/- as incentive.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant couple should be residents of Uttarakhand or have been domiciled in the state for at least five years. 1. The couple must be citizens of India. 1. The couple should not be income tax payers. 1. Neither partner should have a living spouse at the time of marriage. 1. No member of the couple should have been convicted in any criminal case. 1. The benefit is provided when a person with 40% or more disability marries a non-disabled person, or when both partners have disabilities. 1. At the time of marriage, the groom should be between 21 and 45 years of age. 1. At the time of marriage, the bride should be between 18 and 45 years of age. 1. The marriage should be conducted in accordance with prevailing social customs and traditions or be legally registered.

Application Process.process: - At present, applications for this scheme are submitted offline. The application form can be obtained from the office of the Assistant Social Welfare Officer or downloaded from the departmental website ([https://socialwelfare.uk.gov.in](https://socialwelfare.uk.gov.in)). The duly filled application form, in the prescribed format, must be submitted to the office of the Assistant Social Welfare Officer." - The following documents must be attached with the application form: Aadhaar card of the couple, Disability Certificate, Copy of U.D.I. card, Permanent residence certificate / certificate confirming residence in the state for at least 5 years, Copy of bank account statement, Copy of marriage registration certificate, Affidavit (stating that the applicant is not an income tax payer, not involved in any criminal activities, and does not have any living spouse from before) - The applications will be verified by the Assistant Social Welfare Officer and forwarded to the District Social Welfare Officer with recommendations based on eligibility. At the district level, the District Committee will review the application, and upon approval, the incentive amount will be provided to the applicant as per rules.

Documents Required: 1. Aadhaar Card of both partners 1. Disability Certificate 1. Passport-size photographs 1. Voter ID card or UID card copy 1. Proof of residence (certificate confirming 5 years’ residence in the state) 1. Bank account details of both partners 1. Marriage registration certificate 1. Affidavit stating that both partners are not income tax payers, are not involved in any criminal activities, and do not have any previous spouse alive

schemeName: Scholarship to Divyang Students (Class 1 to 8)
Details:
The scheme “Scholarship to Divyang Students (Class 1 to 8)” is implemented by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to regularly enrolled disable students from Class 1 to 8.
The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹600/- for students in Class 1 to 5 and ₹960/- for students in Class 6 to 8, to regularly enrolled disable students.
Benefits: ***Rate of Scholarships:*** - **Class 1 to 5:** ₹600/- - **Class 6 to 8:** ₹960/-
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be a disabled student. 1. The applicant must be studying in Class 1 to 8. 1. The applicant’s family income must be less than ₹24,000/-. 1. The student must not availing benefits from any other scholarship scheme.

Application Process.process: - Students can apply online for scholarship by visiting the NSP Portal of Government of India [(https://scholarships.gov.in/]((https://scholarships.gov.in/)). - The following documents will be attached with the application: Aadhaar card of the applicant, mobile number, certified photo and CBS bank account which is Aadhaar linked/seeded, previous class passed mark sheet, disability certificate, income certificate, self-declaration certificate that the applicant is not taking benefit of any other scholarship scheme of the government. - The student sends the application to his/her educational institution; the concerned educational institution verifies the application form and forwards it online to the District Social Welfare Officer. - The District Social Welfare Officer examines the received application form and gets the complete application forms physically verified. Incomplete applications (which can be corrected) are temporarily marked as defective, otherwise they are completely rejected. The scholarship amount is paid to the eligible applicants directly in their bank account in the financial year as per the availability of budget.

Documents Required: 1. Aadhaar card 1. Mobile number 1. Verified photo 1. CBS bank account linked/seeded to Aadhaar 1. Previous class mark sheet 1. Disability certificate 1. Income certificate 1. Self-declaration form stating that the student is not availing benefits from any other scholarship scheme

schemeName: Coaching Assistance for Pre-preparation for Competitive Exams of ALL INDIA level like IIM, CEPT, NIFT, NLU and IELTS, TOFEL, GRE for going Foreign
Details:
The scheme "Coaching Assistance for Pre-Preparation for Competitive Exams of All India Level like IIM, CEPT, NIFT, NLU and IELTS, TOEFL, GRE for Going Foreign" was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to financially support SEBC and economically backward students preparing for national-level and international entrance exams. Under this scheme, eligible candidates receive up to ₹20,000/- or the actual tuition fee paid, whichever is lower, as assistance for coaching fees.
The scheme aims to assist SEBC and economically backward students in coaching for premier Indian and international exams, the eligible candidates receive up to ₹20,000/- or the actual fee paid.
Benefits: **Financial Assistance:** - ₹20,000/- or actual coaching fee paid (whichever is lower) for pre-preparation of one competitive exam (IIM, CEPT, NIFT, NLU, IELTS, TOEFL, GRE) **Mode of Disbursement:** - Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to trainee’s bank account.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a student. 1. The applicant must belong to the SEBC or Economically Backward Class category. 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must have passed Class 10 or Class 12 (SSC or HSC). 1. The applicant must be preparing for one of the eligible competitive exams (IIM, CEPT, NIFT, NLU, IELTS, TOEFL, GRE). 1. The applicant must have paid tuition/coaching fees for the exam preparation. 1. The annual family income of the applicant must not exceed ₹6,00,000/-.

schemeName: PMMSY: Construction of  Plant/Storage of Minimum 20 Tonne Capacity - Gujarat
Details:
The scheme “Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY)” with the component of "Construction of Plant/Storage of Minimum 20 Tonne Capacity", introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to strengthen fish storage and cold chain infrastructure for better preservation and delivery of fish in a healthy condition. Through this scheme, financial assistance is provided to beneficiaries for the construction of ice plants/storage units with a minimum capacity of 20 tonnes, ensuring hygienic fish availability and higher returns for sellers. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries of the State Governments, with 60% contribution from the Government of India and 40% contribution from the State Government.
> **Objective of the scheme** - Marine production in the Gujarat state is one of the leading in the country. The state lags behind in exports due to non-norms. So cold storage/ice plant modernization is necessary to keep the fish in healthy condition. - Insulated vehicle, three wheeler with ice box including e-rickshaw, and live fish vending center to deliver the fish in hygienic condition to the consumer, so that the consumer (customer) can get fresh and clean fish from the local area and get good returns to the sellers. - Around 27,000 small and large boats are operating in the state. To strengthen the safety and security of the fishermen and increase the income of the boat owner, replacement of the existing boats is necessary to increase the sea growth of the existing boats.
The scheme aims to provide financial support for the construction of 20-tonne capacity ice plant/storage units, ensuring hygienic fish storage and improving the income of beneficiaries.
Benefits:
> **Construction of Ice Plant/Storage (minimum 20 tonne capacity):** - Unit cost is ₹80,00,000/-. The amount of assistance for the beneficiary of general category will be 40% of the unit cost and for the beneficiary of women and ST/SC category the amount of assistance will be available at the rate of 60% of the unit cost. - The benefit will be available as per the target (category) allocated by the Government of India.
> **Remarks:** 60% contribution from Government of India and 40% contribution from State Governments is paid. > **Minimum Time Limit (in Years) for Reclaiming Benefits:** Once in a lifetime.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a native of Gujarat state. 1. The applicant should have a fishing boat registered under Real Craft software. 1. The applicant should hold a fishing license. 1. The applicant should complete the online registration on the [iKhedut Portal](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/site/).1. The applicant should obtain in-principle approval before purchase of the floor plan. 1. The applicant should have his/her own bank account. > **Preference/Reservation/Relaxation:** - Women, SC, and ST beneficiaries are eligible for 60% assistance of the unit cost. - General category beneficiaries are eligible for 40% assistance of the unit cost.

And for all select the District, Taluka, and Village, choose 'what type of account holder you are?', enter your Account Number and Name, solve the Captcha, and click 'Save and Next'. **Step 4:** Enter your Mobile Number and E-mail address, click 'Send OTP', enter the received OTP, create and confirm a Password, solve the Captcha, and click 'Submit'.
> **Login Process:** **Step 1:** The applicant may visit and apply online at the [I-Khedut Portal](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/). **Step 2:** Click on 'Login' from the top right-hand side of the homepage. On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’. **Step 3:** Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button, and an application page will open. **Step 4:** Click on the "Apply New" button and submit a new application. **Step 5:** Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application. **Step 6:** Once the application is done, confirm it. **Step 7:** Take a printout of the confirmed application.
> **Contact Us:** [Click here](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/Public/frm_Public_Contacts.aspx).

schemeName: Destitute Widow Pension Scheme - Uttarakhand
Details:
The &quot;Destitute Widow Pension Scheme&quot; was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to help destitute widows meet their basic needs and improve their quality of life. Under this scheme, a monthly pension is provided to widows whose family monthly income is up to ₹4,000/- or who belong to the BPL category, and who are not availing of any other pension benefits.
Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹1,500/- is provided to widows whose family income does not exceed ₹4,000/- per month or who belong to the BPL category, and who are not receiving any other pension benefits.
Benefits: A pension of ₹1,500/- per month is provided to eligible beneficiaries.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be a widow. 1. The widow must be at least 18 years of age. 1. The widow’s family monthly income should not exceed ₹4,000/-, or she must possess a valid BPL (Below Poverty Line) certificate. 1. The widow must not be receiving any other pension benefits.

Application Process.process: The applicant can apply online either by themselves or through a Common Service Center (CSC) via the Department’s Pension Portal ([https://ssp.uk.gov.in](https://ssp.uk.gov.in)), the [UMANG](https://web.umang.gov.in) Mobile App, or the Apuni Sarkar Portal ([https://eservices.uk.gov.in](https://eservices.uk.gov.in)). **The following documents are mandatory at the time of applying:** Applicant’s mobile number, Passport-size photograph (attested by Gram Pradhan / V.P.D.O. / certified by Councillor), Photocopy of Aadhaar card and Voter ID card, Husband's Death Certificate, CBS bank account details (linked/seeded with Aadhaar), Valid family income certificate or BPL certificate, Copy of family register (for rural areas only), Copy of the resolution passed in the open meeting of Gram Panchayat (for rural areas) / certified by Councillor (for urban areas) **All the above documents must be issued from the district where the application is being submitted.** > For verification of the online application form in rural areas, the final decision is taken by the District Social Welfare Officer after recommendations from the Gram Panchayat Development Officer, Assistant Social Welfare Officer, and Block Development Officer, respectively. In urban areas, verification and recommendation are done by the Assistant Social Welfare Officer and Sub-District Magistrate. If the application is found correct, the District Social Welfare Officer approves it, after which the pension payment process is initiated. **The pension is credited to the applicant’s bank account one month after the approval of the application.**

Documents Required: 1. Applicant’s mobile number 1. Passport-size photograph (certified by Gram Pradhan / V.P.D.O. / Councillor) 1. Aadhaar card 1. Voter ID card 1. CBS bank account linked/seeded with Aadhaar card 1. Valid family income certificate or BPL certificate 1. Husband's Death Certificate 1. Copy of family register (only for rural areas) 1. Copy of the resolution passed in the open meeting of the Gram Panchayat (for rural areas) or by the Councillor (for urban areas) **Note:** All the above documents must be issued from the district where the application is submitted.

Details:
