schemeName: Distribution of Seeds of more productions varieties/ Hybrids varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area: Castor cake/Neem cake/ Liquid Fermented Organic Manure / Green manure seed (For mix in the soil) Gujarat
Details:
The scheme "Distribution of Seeds of more productive varieties / Hybrid varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area (TASP)" with a component "Castor cake/Neem cake/ Liquid Fermented Organic Manure / Green manure seed (For mix in the soil)" is introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to help Adivasi farmers in Tribal Areas (TASP) and tribal cultivators outside these areas achieve higher production of agricultural crops. Through this scheme, subsidies are provided on various agricultural inputs such as high-yield variety seeds, hybrid seeds, and fertilizers. Farmers are also provided with plant protection equipment, tarpaulins, field demonstrations, micronutrients, water carrying pipelines, and pump sets to increase their crop yield and improve their livelihoods. The scheme's benefits are provided to farmers belonging to Scheduled Tribes and tribal cultivators residing outside tribal areas.
The scheme aims to help tribal farmers improve their livelihood by increasing agricultural crop production. Through this scheme, subsidies are provided on high-yield and hybrid seeds, fertilizers, and other agricultural inputs to Scheduled Tribe farmers.
Benefits:
**SCHEDULE-IV and V under FCO 1985:-** 1. **Castor cake/Neem cake/ Liquid Fermented Organic Manure:** 75% of the purchase price or ₹9,000/- per hectare, whichever is less. This assistance is for a maximum of two hectares per account. OR 1. **Green manuring (hemp/Ikkad seeds):** 75% of the purchase price or ₹3,000/- per hectare, whichever is less. A total of ₹6,000/- per person, whichever is less, is provided for hemp (60 kg) or Ikkad (50 kg) seeds per hectare. This assistance is for a maximum of three hectares per account.
> **Frequency of Disbursement:** The benefit for Castor cake/Neem cake/Liquid Fermented Organic Manure/Green manure seed is provided every year. > **Remark:** As per conditions No. 5, 16, 17, 19 and 22 of [Appendix-1](https://mariyojana.gujarat.gov.in/Schemeatoz.aspx). (Refer Scheme No. 35)
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to a Scheduled Tribe. 1. The applicant should be a farmer. 1. The applicant should be located in tribal areas OR be a tribal cultivator residing outside tribal areas. 1. The scheme excludes farmers from Dang district.

Application Process.process: Approach the Gram Sevak in your village for access to the "Castor cake/Neem cake/ Liquid Fermented Organic Manure / Green manure seed (For mix in the soil)" under the scheme.

Documents Required: 1. 7/12 Certificate 1. Aadhar Card 1. Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque

schemeName: Inter-Caste / Inter-Religious Marriage Award
Details:
The “Inter-Caste / Inter-Religious Marriage Award” scheme is implemented by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Uttarakhand, aims to promote social harmony and discourage caste and religious discrimination. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to married couples where, in the case of an inter-caste marriage, one spouse belongs to a Scheduled Caste, and in the case of an inter-religious marriage, both spouses belong to different religions.
Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹50,000/- is provided to married couples where, in the case of an inter-caste marriage, one spouse belongs to a Scheduled Caste, and in the case of an inter-religious marriage, both spouses belong to different religions.
Benefits: The married couple is jointly provided with a financial amount of ₹50,000/-.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must a married couple who has entered into either an inter-caste or an inter-religious marriage. 1. In the case of an inter-caste marriage, one spouse must belong to a Scheduled Caste. 1. In the case of an inter-religious marriage, both spouses must belong to different religions.

Application Process.process: - The received application is forwarded to the government for approval through the Directorate, along with the recommendation of the District Magistrate, after necessary scrutiny by the District Social Welfare Officer. - It is mandatory to attach the following documents with the application form: a copy of the bride and groom's date of birth certificate (High School Certificate/Birth Certificate/Family Register/Aadhaar Card), marriage registration certificate, and details of a CBS bank account linked/seeded with Aadhaar. - After approval at the government level, the bank draft is issued from the designation of the concerned District Magistrate.

Documents Required: 1. Identity proof 1. Proof of date of birth of the bride and groom (high school certificate / birth certificate / family register / Aadhaar card) 1. Marriage registration certificate 1. CBS bank account which is linked/seeded to Aadhaar 1. Copy of caste/community certificate 1. Proof of residence

schemeName: Grant for Marriage of the Daughter of a Scheduled Caste Individual
Details:
The scheme "Grant for Marriage of the Daughter of a Scheduled Caste Individual" is implemented by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to Scheduled Caste families to help cover the marriage expenses of up to two daughters.
The scheme aims to provide a grant of ₹50,000/- per daughter to Scheduled Caste families, for a maximum of two daughters, whose total monthly family income from all sources does not exceed ₹4,000/- or who belong to a BPL family, to help cover marriage expenses.
Benefits: **Grant Amount:** ₹50,000/- per daughter, for the marriage of up to two daughters.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. 2. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste category. 3. The family’s total monthly income from all sources must not exceed ₹4,000/-, or the family must belong to the BPL category. 4. At the time of marriage, the bride’s age must be between 18 and 45 years. 5. At the time of marriage, the groom’s age must be between 21 and 45 years. 6. The grant is applicable for the marriage of up to two daughters.

Application Process.process: - The applicant can apply online either by themselves or through a Common Service Center (CSC) via the Department’s Pension Portal ([https://ssp.uk.gov.in](https://ssp.uk.gov.in)), the [UMANG](https://web.umang.gov.in) Mobile App, or the Apuni Sarkar Portal ([https://eservices.uk.gov.in](https://eservices.uk.gov.in)). - **The following documents are mandatory at the time of applying:** Applicant&amp;#39;s mobile number, Aadhaar card, Passport-size Photo, Caste Certificate, Domicile/permanent residence certificate of Uttarakhand, CBS Bank Account Details (linked/seeded with Aadhaar), Valid Income Certificate or BPL Certificate, Ration Card, Copy of Family Register (only for rural areas), Bride and groom&amp;#39;s date of birth certificate (High School certificate/Birth certificate/Family register/Aadhar card), Marriage registration certificate, Affidavit (Applicant&amp;#39;s family has taken benefit only once before or has not taken benefit at all) - It is mandatory to apply between 1st March to 28th February of the same year in which marriage takes place. If someone&amp;#39;s marriage takes place in January or February and the documents are not complete at that time, then in such a situation, one can apply before marriage but the benefit will be available only after uploading the marriage registration certificate on the portal. - After applying online, the Assistant Social Welfare Officer will check it and on the basis of the investigation report/recommendation, the District Social Welfare Officer will approve the application form as per rules and the grant amount will be paid to the beneficiary&amp;#39;s account.

Documents Required: 1. Applicant's mobile number 1. Aadhaar card 1. Photograph 1. Caste certificate 1. Original domicile certificate of Uttarakhand / Permanent residence certificate 1. CBS bank account linked/seeded with Aadhaar 1. Valid income certificate or BPL certificate 1. Ration card 1. Copy of family register (only for rural areas) 1. Birth certificates of the bride and groom (School certificate / Birth certificate / Family register / Aadhaar card) 1. Marriage registration certificate 1. Affidavit stating that the applicant or their family has availed this benefit only once before or not at all

schemeName: Cluster Development Scheme
Details:
Launched in 2003-04, the scheme "Cluster Development Scheme" by the Industries & Mines Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to enhance the productivity and competitiveness of artisans in the handloom and handicraft sector through cluster-based development approach, addressing common issues faced by Micro and Small Enterprises such as improvement of technology, skills, quality, market access, and access to capital. The scheme provides various types of assistance like Diagnostic Survey, design Development, Training, Common Facility Centre, margin money, managerial subsidy, publicity, export, and Marketing Facility to clusters of minimum 25 artisans or more who work and produce goods at one place. The applicant must be part of a cluster with minimum 25 artisans and must be engaged in handloom and handicraft activities in Gujarat state. The scheme is implemented by Boards and Corporations working under Cottage Commissionerate and reputed institutions such as National Institute of Design, National Institute of Fashion Technology, etc.
The scheme aims to enhance the productivity and competitiveness as well as capacity building of Micro and Small Enterprises through cluster development approach. It provides various assistance including training, subsidies, and marketing facilities to clusters of 25 or more artisans.
Benefits:
> **Types of Assistance Provided** - **Diagnostic Survey:** Assessment and analysis of cluster needs and potential.- **Design Development:** Support for product design and innovation.- **Training:** Skill development and capacity building programs for artisans.- **Common Facility Centre:** Establishment of shared infrastructure and facilities.- **Margin Money:** Financial assistance for working capital requirements.- **Managerial Subsidy:** Support for management and administrative costs.- **Publicity:** Marketing and promotional support for cluster products.- **Export Assistance:** Support for international market access.- **Marketing Facility:** Domestic and international marketing support.
> **Conditions for Availment/Continuation** - Cluster must maintain minimum 25 artisans working and producing goods at one place. - Beneficiaries must continue to be engaged in handloom and handicraft activities. - Compliance with scheme guidelines and periodic reporting requirements. - Participation in training programs and skill development initiatives as mandated.
Eligibility: - The applicant must be part of a cluster with minimum 25 artisans or more who work and produce goods at one place. - The applicant must be engaged in handloom and handicraft sector activities. - The applicant must be working and producing goods at a common or designated location within Gujarat. - The applicant must be involved in artisan-based activities in handloom and handicraft sector. - The applicant must be classified as Micro or Small Enterprise. - The applicant must be willing to participate in collective cluster activities.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** The representative of the cluster should approach one of the following implementing agency and request the hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the designated staff. - Boards and Corporations working under Cottage Commissionerate - National Institute of Design - National Institute of Fashion Technology - SHRUJAN, SAHAJ, ICCED & Freelance Designers - Gujarat Mahila Khadi Rashtriya Gramin Trust (the Nodal Agency) **Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). **Step 3:** Submit the application for specific assistance required (Diagnostic Survey, Training, Common Facility Centre, etc.). **Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable).
> **Post-Application Processes** **Step 1:** The implementing agency will conduct assessment of the cluster's needs, potential, and eligibility for the requested assistance through diagnostic surveys and field visits. **Step 2:** Upon approval, the implementing agency will provide the sanctioned assistance and support services as per the approved project plan and scheme guidelines. _*Regular monitoring and evaluation will be conducted to ensure proper utilization of assistance and achievement of desired outcomes for cluster development._

Documents Required: > **At Application Stage** - Cluster Formation Certificate - List Of Participating Artisans (Minimum 25) - Identity Proof (Aadhaar Card/Voter ID/Passport) - Address Proof - Business Registration Certificate (If Applicable) - Bank Account Details (Passbook Copy/Cancelled Cheque) - Project Proposal (For Specific Assistance) - Micro Small Medium Enterprise Registration Certificate > **For Verification Stage** - Production Evidence (Product Samples/Photographs) - Facility Details (Workshop/Production Area Documentation) - Skill Certificates (If Available)

schemeName: Higher Education Assistance Scheme
Details:
The "Higher Education Assistance Scheme" by the Gujarat Labour Welfare Board, Labour & Employment Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide encouragement to children of workers and reduce the financial burden of education by offering higher educational assistance to meritorious students, addressing the economic challenges faced by workers' families in pursuing quality education for their children. The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹20,000/- for students securing admission in Bachelor of Medicine Bachelor of Surgery courses and ₹10,000/- for students securing admission in any other graduate level courses for students who have passed Standard 12 board examination in the year 2024 with 70 percent or above percentile. The applicant must be a child of a worker whose parent is working in a factory or institution in Gujarat state and whose parent has been contributing to the Labour Welfare Fund office for the last one year. The applications for this scheme are accepted online. The application deadline is the last date of February of the respective year.
The scheme aims to encourage children of workers and reduce financial burden of education through higher educational assistance. It provides ₹20,000/- for Bachelor of Medicine Bachelor of Surgery admission and ₹10,000/- for other graduate courses to merit students.
Benefits: > **Financial Assistance for Medical Education** Direct Benefit Transfer of ₹20,000/- for students securing admission in Bachelor of Medicine Bachelor of Surgery courses. > **Financial Assistance for Other Graduate Courses** Direct Benefit Transfer of ₹10,000/- for students securing admission in any other graduate level courses.
Eligibility: - The applicant must be a child of a worker employed in a factory or institution in Gujarat state. - The applicant must have passed 12th Standard board examination in the respective year. - The applicant must have secured 70% or above percentile in 12th Standard board examination. - The applicant must have secured admission in Bachelor of Medicine Bachelor of Surgery or any other graduate level course. - The applicant must ensure that their parent is working in a factory or institution located in Gujarat state. - The applicant must ensure that their parent has been contributing to the Labour Welfare Fund office for the last one year continuously. - The applicant must submit the application by the last date of February of the respective year. - The applicant must have completed 12th Standard examination specifically in the respective year.

Application Process.process: > **Registration Process** **Step 1:** The applicant must visit the [Sanman Portal](https://sanman.gujarat.gov.in/) of the Gujarat Labour Welfare Board. **Step 2:** On the home page, navigate to the ‘Citizen Login’ tab, and click ‘Please Register Here’. **Step 3:** On the Registration page, provide your Aadhaar Card Number, select user type and then enter your Labour Welfare Fund Account Number. Click on ‘Fetch’ & verify the details. Enter user details and create a password. > **Application Process** **Step 1:** The applicant must visit the Sanman Portal: https://sanman.gujarat.gov.in/ of the Gujarat Labour Welfare Board. **Step 2:** On the home page, navigate to the ‘Citizen Login’ tab, and click ‘Login’. Login using your User ID and Password. **Step 3:** Navigate to the Online Application Page of the scheme. In the form, fill in all the mandatory fields and upload all the mandatory documents in the specified format and size. For each uploaded document, the corresponding document number must be entered wherever required. **Step 4:** Click "Submit" to submit your application. You'll receive a confirmation message. A confirmation email with the application Number will be sent on the registered email ID. _*Applications made with incomplete/wrong details will not be entertained._ _*The final decision regarding assistance will be with the Welfare Commissioner. The jurisdiction will be Ahmedabad._

Documents Required: - Standard 12 Board Examination Mark Sheet. - Admission Confirmation Letter From College/University. - Parent Employment Certificate From Factory/Institution. - Labour Welfare Fund Contribution Proof. - Income Certificate Of Parent/Guardian. - Bank Account Details. - Aadhaar Card Of Student. - Aadhaar Card Of Parent/Guardian. - Bonafide Certificate From Educational Institution. - Caste Certificate (If Applicable). - Fee Receipt Of Educational Institution. - Identity Verification Documents As Required By Authorities. - Additional Academic Records If Requested During Verification.

schemeName: Funeral Assistance Scheme for Unorganized Workers (Except Construction Workers)
Details:
The scheme "Funeral Assistance Scheme for Unorganized Workers (Except Construction Workers)", launched by the Gujarat Rural Workers Welfare Board, Labour & Employment Department Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance to the heirs of deceased unorganized sector workers to help with funeral expenses and last rites, addressing the financial burden faced by families during such distressing times. The scheme provides a one-time financial assistance of ₹10,000/- to one heir of the deceased worker and is specifically designed for e-Shram card holders in the unorganized sector. The applicant must be an heir of an e-Shram card holder (except e-Nirman card holders and Scheduled Caste individuals) and must have an annual income within specified limits of ₹1,20,000/- for rural areas and ₹1,50,000/- for urban areas. The scheme is implemented by the Labour & Employment Department Government of Gujarat and applications for this scheme are accepted offline through designated government labour offices.
The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to heirs of deceased unorganized sector workers for funeral expenses. It offers ₹10,000/- to eligible heirs of e-Shram card holders.
Benefits: > **Financial Assistance:** ₹10,000/- paid to one heir of the deceased unorganized worker, to assist with funeral expenses and last rites (funeral ceremonies).
Eligibility:
- The applicant must be an heir of a deceased e-Shram card holder from the unorganized sector. - The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant must apply within 3 (three) months from the date of death of the deceased worker. - The deceased worker must have between 16 to 70 years of age at the time of death. - The applicant must have an annual income not exceeding ₹1,20,000/- (One Lakh Twenty Thousand Rupees), if residing in rural areas. - The applicant must have an annual income not exceeding ₹1,50,000/- (One Lakh Fifty Thousand Rupees), if residing in urban areas. - Only one heir per deceased worker is eligible to receive the assistance.
> **Priority Order for Heirs** The legal heirs of the deceased shall be considered in the following order of priority: 1. Husband or Wife. 1. Children (Son/Daughter) - in absence of spouse. 1. Parents - in absence of spouse and children. 1. Grandchildren (Grandson/Granddaughter) - in absence of spouse, children and parents. 1. Unmarried, widowed or abandoned sisters - in absence of spouse, children, parents and grandchildren. 1. Other heirs declared under Indian Succession Act, 1925 - in absence of all above categories.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** The applicant should obtain the prescribed application form as per "Annexure-1" from any of the designated government offices mentioned in the Steps below. **Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, paste the passport-sized photograph (signed across, if required), and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). **Step 3:** The applicant must submit the completed application form along with all required documents to any of the following offices: - Office of Assistant Government Labour Officer. - Office of Government Labour Officer. - Office of Assistant Labour Commissioner. - Office of Deputy Labour Commissioner. **Step 4:** Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicable). _*Applications must be submitted within 3 (three) months from the date of death of the unorganized worker. Applications submitted after this deadline will be automatically cancelled._
> **Post-Application Processes** **Step 1:** Upon receipt of the application, the concerned office will conduct necessary verification and approve/reject the application within 10 working days. If the application contains incomplete documents or information, the applicant will be notified accordingly. **Step 2:** In case of incomplete documentation, the applicant must complete the requirements within 15 days from the date of notification. The concerned office will then process the completed application within 10 working days of receiving the additional documents. **Step 3:** After successful verification and approval, the financial assistance of ₹10,000/- will be disbursed to the eligible heir's bank account as provided in the application.

Documents Required: - Copy of e-Shram Card - Ration Card - Copy of Caste Certificate (Scheduled Tribe/Other Backward Class/Other Caste) - Income Certificate (As per prescribed format in Annexure-2 of the resolution) - Certified Copy of Death Certificate - Advance Receipt of Money Received (As per prescribed format in Annexure-3 of the resolution with Revenue Stamp) - Copy of Bank Passbook Or Cancelled Cheque of bank account - Guarantee Letter (As per prescribed format in Annexure-4 of the resolution stating that assistance has not been received from elsewhere and will not be received) - Age Proof of Deceased: Birth Certificate/Copy of Aadhaar Card/School Leaving Certificate

schemeName: Sri Ram Janmabhoomi Shabari Smriti Yatra Sahay Scheme
Details:
The scheme "Sri Ram Janmabhoomi Shabari Smriti Yatra Sahay Scheme" by the Industry and Mines Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance to scheduled tribes and tribal communities for pilgrimage to Sri Ram Janmabhoomi in Ayodhya, Uttar Pradesh, in memory of "Maa Shabari" and to enable darshan of Lord Sri Ram. The scheme provides financial assistance of ₹5,000/- per pilgrim and covers railway travel expenses through Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation Limited arrangements. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat for twelve years or more and belong to the scheduled tribe or tribal community category. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat Pavitra Yatradham Vikas Board. The applications for this scheme are accepted online through the official website of Gujarat Pavitra Yatradham Vikas Board, Gandhinagar.
The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to scheduled tribes and tribal communities for pilgrimage to Sri Ram Janmabhoomi in Ayodhya in memory of Maa Shabari. The scheme offers ₹5,000/- financial assistance per pilgrim to enable darshan of Lord Sri Ram for eligible tribal beneficiaries.
Benefits: > ***Financial Assistance*** ₹5,000/- per pilgrim as financial assistance towards travel expenses for pilgrimage to Sri Ram Janmabhoomi, Ayodhya. > ***Travel Arrangements*** - Travel arrangements through the Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation Limited. - Railway journey assistance and booking support. > ***Coverage Details*** - First 1,500 scheduled tribe and tribal pilgrims will be eligible for the scheme benefits. - Benefits are available once per person per year for the pilgrimage to Sri Ram Janmabhoomi, Ayodhya. > ***Conditions*** - Pilgrims must complete the journey and submit proof of pilgrimage completion. - Travel must be undertaken within the approved timeframe after receiving permission. - Registration and prior approval from the Gujarat Pavitra Yatradham Vikas Board is mandatory. - Submission of travel documents and pilgrimage proof within one month of journey completion is required.
Eligibility: - The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat state for twelve years or more from the current age. - The applicant must belong to the scheduled tribe or tribal community category. - The applicant must be eligible for only one pilgrimage assistance per person per year to Sri Ram Janmabhoomi, Ayodhya. - The applicant must be above 12 years of age. - The applicant can include up to 8 family members in the group application. - The applicant must obtain prior approval from the Gujarat Pavitra Yatradham Vikas Board before undertaking the journey. ***Priority/Preference*** Priority will be given to the first 1,500 registered applicants from the scheduled tribe and tribal communities.

Application Process.process:
> ***Registration Process*** **Step 1:** Visit the [YatraDham portal](https://yatradham.gujarat.gov.in/) of the Gujarat Pavitra Yatradham Vikas Board. In the top ribbon, hover on "Booking" and click "Shree Ram Janmabhumi Registration". You will be taken to the [online registration page](https://yatradham.gujarat.gov.in/SRJApplicantRegistration). **Step 2:** Complete the registration process by providing all the mandatory details: Name, Mobile Number, and Email. Create a password and confirm. Provide the captcha code and click "Submit".
> ***Application Process*** **Step 1:** Visit the [YatraDham portal](https://yatradham.gujarat.gov.in/) of the Gujarat Pavitra Yatradham Vikas Board. In the top ribbon, hover on "Booking" and click "Shree Ram Janmabhumi Registration". You will be taken to the [online registration page](https://yatradham.gujarat.gov.in/SRJApplicantRegistration). **Step 2:** Click on "Click Here to Login if Already Registered". You will be taken to the [Login Page](https://yatradham.gujarat.gov.in/SRJApplicantLogin). Provide your Username and Password. Click "Login". **Step 3:** The online application form for "Shree Ram JanmBhumi Yatra" will open. In the form, fill in all the mandatory fields and upload all the mandatory documents in the specified format and size. **Step 4:** Acknowledge the declaration by ticking the designated checkbox. Carefully review all the information provided and the documents uploaded. Make any necessary corrections. Click "Submit" to submit your application. You'll receive a confirmation message. _*Apply online before the deadline of 31st March of the respective year._ _*Save and print the acknowledgment receipt or confirmation message containing the application reference number for future tracking and correspondence._
> ***Post-Application Processes*** **Step 1:** _Approval and Travel Permission_ Wait for approval notification from Gujarat Pavitra Yatradham Vikas Board, Gandhinagar office, which will be communicated via post or through the online portal. Once approved, the board will provide detailed travel arrangements and booking confirmations for the pilgrimage journey. **Step 2:** _Pre-Travel Coordination_ Contact the Gujarat Pavitra Yatradham Vikas Board office at least 10 days before the intended travel date to coordinate final arrangements and receive travel instructions. Confirm accommodation arrangements and travel schedule as per the approved itinerary provided by the implementing board. **Step 3:** _Journey Undertaking and Documentation_ Undertake the pilgrimage journey as per the approved schedule and maintain all travel documents, including railway tickets, accommodation receipts, and capture required photographs at the temple premises. Follow all prescribed guidelines and temple regulations during the visit to Ayodhya. **Step 4:** _Post-Travel Submission_ Submit all travel proof documents, including railway tickets, accommodation receipts, and temple photographs to Gujarat Pavitra Yatradham Vikas Board office within one month of journey completion. Upload the required documentation through the official website portal for benefit processing and disbursement.
> **Grievance Redressal / Help & Support** Office Address: Gujarat Pavitra Yatradham Vikas Board, Block 2 & 3, 1st Floor, Dr. Jivraj Mehta Bhavan, Gandhinagar - 382016. Phone Numbers: +91 79 23250708, 23251862. Fax Number: +91 79 23256775. Email: sectourism@gujarat.gov.in For scheme-related queries and grievances, contact the above-mentioned office during working hours.

Documents Required: > **At the Time of Application** - Self-Attested Copy of Aadhaar Card. - Self-Attested Copy of Caste Certificate or Leaving Certificate establishing tribal status. - Self-Attested Copy of Bank Details (first page photocopy of passbook). - Self-Attested Copy of Age Proof Document. > **During Travel** - Original Railway Tickets or Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation Limited tickets. - Valid Identity Proof Documents. > **Post-Travel Documentation** - Railway Journey Tickets (arrival and departure). - Accommodation Proof or Dharamshala Stay Receipts (if applicable). - 2 to 3 Colored Photographs at Ayodhya Temple, including temple premises (selfies are accepted). _*All documents must be self-attested copies._ _*Photocopies or unclear documents will not be accepted._ _*Documents must be submitted within one month of journey completion._

schemeName: Distribution of Seeds of more productions varieties/ Hybrids varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area: Water Carrying Pipe Line (TASP & OTASP) Gujarat
Details:
The scheme "Distribution of Seeds of more productive varieties / Hybrid varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies, etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area (TASP)" with a component "Water Carrying Pipe Line (TASP & OTASP)" is introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to improve agricultural productivity and livelihood opportunities of Scheduled Tribe farmers. Through this scheme, assistance is provided for various components, including Water Carrying Pipe Line (TASP & OTASP) and other recommended practices are provided to Scheduled Tribe farmers.
The scheme aims to improve the agricultural productivity of Scheduled Tribe farmers through subsidized seeds, fertilizers, and equipment. It provides direct support to tribal farmers for enhancing crop production and livelihood.
Benefits:
1. The assistance provided is 75% of the purchase price or ₹ 22,500/- per beneficiary, whichever is less.
> **Remark:** As per conditions No. 5, 16, 17, 19 and 22 of [Appendix-1](https://mariyojana.gujarat.gov.in/Schemeatoz.aspx). (Refer Scheme No. 35) > **Frequency:** Once in 5 Years.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to a Scheduled Tribe. 1. The applicant should be a farmer. 1. The applicant should be located in tribal areas OR be a tribal cultivator residing outside tribal areas. 1. The scheme excludes farmers from Dang district.

Application Process.process:
> **Registration Process:** **Step 1:** The applicant may visit and apply online at the [I-Khedut Portal](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/). **Step 2:** Click on 'Login' from the top right-hand side, then click on "Beneficiary Registration" and select any one from the 'Farmer' or 'Institutional' or 'Except For the Farmer' as the Beneficiary Type. **Step 3:** Enter the 'Company Name' and Address if you have selected 'Institutional' or 'Except For the Farmer' as the Beneficiary Type. And for all select the District, Taluka, and Village, choose 'what type of account holder you are?', enter your Account Number and Name, solve the Captcha, and click 'Save and Next'. **Step 4:** Enter your Mobile Number and E-mail address, click 'Send OTP', enter the received OTP, create and confirm a Password, solve the Captcha, and click 'Submit'.
> **Login Process:** **Step 1:** The applicant may visit and apply online at the [I-Khedut Portal](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/). **Step 2:** Click on 'Login' from the top right-hand side of the homepage. On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’. **Step 3:** Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button, and an application page will open. **Step 4:** Click on the "Apply New" button and submit a new application. **Step 5:** Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application. **Step 6:** Once the application is done, confirm it. **Step 7:** Take a printout of the confirmed application.
> **Contact Us:** [**Click here**](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/Public/frm_Public_Contacts.aspx)**.**

Documents Required: 1. 7/12 Certificate 1. Aadhar Card 1. Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque

schemeName: Coaching Sahay for the Preparation of NEET, JEE, GUJCET Examination to both Socially and Educationally Backward Class Trainees/Students and Female Students and Economically Backward Class Students
Details:
The “Coaching Sahay for the Preparation of NEET, JEE, GUJCET Examination to both Socially and Educationally Backward Class Trainees/Students and Female Students and Economically Backward Class Students” scheme was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. It aims to provide financial aid to underprivileged students for coaching support. Under this scheme, students from SEBC or Economically Backward Class categories receive coaching fee (whichever is lower) for one exam-NEET, JEE, or GUJCET.
The scheme aims to support Socially and Educationally Backward Class (SEBC) and Economically Backward Class (EBC) students with coaching fee assistance. Up to ₹20,000 or actual fee is provided for one exam preparation.
Benefits: **Financial Assistance:** - ₹20,000/- or actual coaching fee paid, whichever is lower. **Applicable Exams:** - NEET (National Eligibility cum Entrance Test) - JEE (Joint Entrance Examination) - GUJCET (Gujarat Common Entrance Test) **Mode of Disbursement:** - Amount is credited via Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) into the student’s bank account.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a student. 1. The applicant must be from the SEBC or Economically Backward Class category. 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must have passed the Secondary School Certificate (SSC/Class 10). 1. The applicant must be enrolled in or preparing for NEET, JEE, or GUJCET. 1. The applicant must have paid a coaching fee and be able to submit a valid receipt. 1. The applicant’s annual family income must not exceed ₹6,00,000/-.

Application Process.process: **Step 01:** The eligible applicant may visit the e-Samaj Kalyan Portal: [https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/](https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/) **Step 02:** On the home page, under the tab ‘Citizen Login’, click on New User ‘[Please Register Here](https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/Registration.aspx)’. **Step 03:** Enter your Full Name as per Aadhaar Card, Gender, Date of Birth, Aadhaar Card Number, Email ID, Caste etc. and then click on ‘Register’. **Step 04:** After successful registration, the applicants can login through their User ID and Password. **Step 05:** Now, click on ‘User Profile’ to update your profile. **Step 06:** Fill in all the mandatory information and then click on ‘Update’. **Step 07:** After updating the profile successfully, select the scheme appearing on the home page; an application form will open. **Step 08:** Fill in all the mandatory details in the application form and upload all the relevant documents. **Step 09:** Now agree with the terms & conditions and click on ‘Save Application’. **Step 10:** Submit the application form and take out the print of the application for future reference. The applicant can note down the application number to track the application status by logging into the portal using their User ID and Password. [User Manual](https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/HelpManual/Citizen-HelpManual.pdf)

Documents Required: - Aadhaar Card - Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque - Income Certificate - Receipt of Fee Paid - Age Proof - Caste Certificate - Marksheet

schemeName: Distribution of Seeds of more productions varieties/ Hybrids varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area: Tarpaulin Gujarat
Details:
The scheme "Distribution of Seeds of more productive varieties / Hybrid varieties Seeds and fertilizer at subsidies etc. to Adivasi farmers in Tribal Area (TASP)" with a component "Tarpaulin" is introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide subsidized agricultural inputs and tools to Scheduled Tribe farmers for enhancing agricultural production. Through this scheme, the purchase price of tarpaulin assistance provided to tribal cultivators is used to improve productivity and livelihood.
The scheme aims to enhance crop production and livelihood. It provides subsidies on seeds, fertilizers, tarpaulins, and other agricultural inputs to Scheduled Tribe farmers.
Benefits:
1. The assistance covers 75% of the purchase price of the tarpaulin or ₹1,875/-, whichever amount is less.
> **Conditions:** A maximum of two tarpaulins can be claimed per account. > **Frequency of Disbursement:** The benefit can be reclaimed once every 3 years. > **Remark:** As per conditions No. 5, 16, 17, 19 and 22 of [Appendix-1](https://mariyojana.gujarat.gov.in/Schemeatoz.aspx). (Refer Scheme No. 35)
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to a Scheduled Tribe. 1. The applicant should be a farmer. 1. The applicant should be located in tribal areas OR be a tribal cultivator residing outside tribal areas. 1. The scheme excludes farmers from Dang district.

Application Process.process:
> **Registration Process:** **Step 1:** The applicant may visit and apply online at the [I-Khedut Portal](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/). **Step 2:** Click on 'Login' from the top right-hand side, then click on "Beneficiary Registration" and select any one from the 'Farmer' or 'Institutional' or 'Except For the Farmer' as the Beneficiary Type. **Step 3:** Enter the 'Company Name' and Address if you have selected 'Institutional' or 'Except For the Farmer' as the Beneficiary Type. And for all select the District, Taluka, and Village, choose 'what type of account holder you are?', enter your Account Number and Name, solve the Captcha, and click 'Save and Next'. **Step 4:** Enter your Mobile Number and E-mail address, click 'Send OTP', enter the received OTP, create and confirm a Password, solve the Captcha, and click 'Submit'.
> **Login Process:** **Step 1:** The applicant may visit and apply online at the [I-Khedut Portal](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/). **Step 2:** Click on 'Login' from the top right-hand side of the homepage. On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’. **Step 3:** Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button, and an application page will open. **Step 4:** Click on the "Apply New" button and submit a new application. **Step 5:** Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application. **Step 6:** Once the application is done, confirm it. **Step 7:** Take a printout of the confirmed application.
> **Contact Us:** [**Click here**](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/Public/frm_Public_Contacts.aspx)**.**

Documents Required: 1. 7/12 Certificate 1. Aadhar Card 1. Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque

schemeName: Scholarship for Engineering and Medical Education
Details:
The scheme "Scholarship for Engineering and Medical Education" is implemented by the State Sainik Board under the Sainik Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to the dependents of ex-servicemen pursuing Engineering, Medical, or Ph.D. courses.
The scheme aims to support the higher education of dependents of ex-servicemen by providing financial assistance for pursuing engineering, medical, and PhD courses. Under this scheme, annual scholarships are awarded to beneficiaries based on their course of study.
Benefits: **Rate of Scholarship:** - ₹12,000/- per year for Engineering students - ₹15,000/- per year for Medical students - ₹10,000/- per year for PhD students
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be a dependent of an ex-serviceman. 1. The applicant should be pursuing a course in Engineering, Medical, or Ph.D. from a recognized institution. **Note:** It is mandatory that the applicant's correct name is mentioned both in the bank account and the discharge book.

Application Process.process: - The applicant must apply online on the official website of the Sainik Welfare Department at [www.sainikkalyan.org](https://sainikkalyan.uk.gov.in/) - The following documents are required for the application: Aadhaar card of the applicant, bank account details, ex-serviceman identity card, discharge book, and a certificate of the course in which the applicant is studying. - After verification of applications at the District Sainik Welfare Office and Directorate level, applicants found eligible are provided the sanctioned amount through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) from the Kargil Shaheed Parivar Mukhyamantri Sahayata Kosh.

Documents Required: 1. Aadhaar Card of the Applicant 1. Bank Account Details 1. Ex-serviceman Identity Card 1. Discharge Book of the ex-serviceman 1. Certificate of the course in which the student is studying

schemeName: Mahila Samriddhi Yojana (GTKVN)
Details:
The "Mahila Samriddhi Yojana" is implemented by the Gujarat Thakor and Koli Vikas Nigam (GTKVN) under the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to empower women entrepreneurs from the Thakor and Koli communities by providing access to micro-loans for self-employment. Under this scheme, financial assistance in the form of low-interest loans is provided to eligible women beneficiaries to help them set up small businesses or trades based on their skills.
The scheme aims to empower women entrepreneurs from Thakor & Koli communities by providing access to micro-loans for self-employment. Under this scheme, financial assistance in the form of low-interest loans is provided to eligible beneficiaries to set up small businesses based on their skills.
Benefits: - **Maximum Loan Amount:** Up to ₹60,000/-.- **Interest Rate:** 4% per annum.- **Loan Coverage:** Up to 100% of the loan will be given for the proposed business/trade.- **Repayment:** The loan amount will have to be repaid in 48 equal monthly installments (4 years) including interest.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should be a woman from Thakor or Koli caste. 1. The applicant should be between 21 to 50 years of age at the time of application. 1. The applicant’s annual family income should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-. 1. The applicant should have relevant technical skills and experience in the proposed trade/business. 1. The applicant will have to provide suitable collateral to get the loan. > **Note:** At least 50% of the total loan amount will be allocated for families with annual income up to ₹1,50,000/-.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** Visit the [official website](https://gtkdconline.gujarat.gov.in/) of the Gujarat Thakor and Koli Vikas Nigam. **Step 2:** On the top menu bar, click on "Apply Now". **Step 3:** Click on the loan scheme name. **Step 4:** Select the loan category and fill in the loan amount. **Step 5:** Fill out the Application Form, enter the following details: - Personal Information: Name, gender, date of birth, caste, etc. - Address Information: Permanent and correspondence address - Income Details: Monthly family income and source - Loan Requirement: Amount needed, proposed use (e.g., business, self-employment) - Bank Account Details: For loan disbursement **Step 6:** Upload scanned copies of the Caste certificate, Income certificate, Aadhaar card, Passport-size photo, Bank passbook (first page), and Residence proof. **Step 7:** Double-check all details. Click on “Preview” to verify. If all details are correct, click “Submit”. **Step 8:** Applicant will receive an Application ID/Reference Number. Save or print the acknowledgement for future tracking.

Documents Required: 1. Aadhaar Card 1. Ration Card 1. Voter ID 1. Passport Size Photos 1. Business Address Proof 1. Birth Certificate 1. Caste Certificate 1. Income certificate 1. Bank Passbook 1. Any other documents as required

schemeName: Pre Matric Scholarship for Students belonging to Scheduled Caste Community
Details:
The scheme "Pre Matric Scholarship for Students Belonging to the Scheduled Caste Community" was launched by the Mizoram Scholarship Board, Government of Mizoram. The scheme aims to support parents from the Scheduled Caste community in the education of their children studying in classes 9th and 10th so that the incidence of drop-out, especially in the transition from the elementary to the secondary stage, is minimized. The scheme also aims to improve participation these children in the pre-matric stage of education so that they perform better and have a better chance of progressing to the post-matric stage of education.
The scheme is to provide financial assistance to students belonging to the Scheduled caste community pursuing Post-Matriculation recognized courses in recognized institutions.
Benefits: Financial assistance is provided to the students. _*The scheme is funded by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs and the Government of Mizoram in 90:10 ratio._
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be permanently settled in Mizoram. 1. The applicant must belong to Scheduled Caste. 1. The income of the parents/guardians of the applicant (from all sources) should not exceed ₹2,50,000/- per annum. 1. The applicant must be studying either in 9th or 10th standard.

Application Process.process: - Normally application is open during July- September through offline where application form is available in Mizoram Scholarship Board during Office working hours. - Application Form duly filled-in along with documents mentioned above must be submitted to the following address - ***Mizoram Scholarship Board, Kaisara Rd, Aizawl, Mizoram 796001***

Documents Required:
1. Aadhaar Card.
1. Bank Account (self-account).
1. Income certificate issued by competent authority (up to date).
1. Previous year mark sheet.
1. Permanent Residential Certificate (up to date).
1. Scheduled Caste Certificate.

schemeName: Documentation And Research Assistantship Scheme
Details:
The scheme "Documentation And Research Assistantship Scheme" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage documentation and digitisation of valuable Tiatr-related materials such as manuscripts, photos, handbills, advertisements, newspaper or magazine clippings, video and audio recordings that are with Tiatr artistes, tiatr lovers and institutions, addressing the high degree of risk that some of these materials may be lost to posterity if efforts are not undertaken to preserve and document them. The scheme provides assistance to possessors of Tiatr-related materials to organize and document their holdings.
The scheme aims to encourage documentation and digitisation of valuable Tiatr-related materials to prevent their loss to posterity. It provides assistance and incentives to holders of such materials and pays honorarium to documentation assistants.
Benefits: - One-time Incentive: A reasonable amount as decided by Tiatr Academy of Goa will be paid to the holder for converting materials into electronic formats. - Hourly Honorarium: Documentation assistants will be paid an honorarium on clock-hour basis as determined by Tiatr Academy of Goa. - Reimbursement: Tiatr Academy of Goa will reimburse costs incurred towards conversion according to rates determined by it if services of other agencies become necessary. - Assistance provided to organize and document materials in holdings. - Copy of digitised material provided to the holder on Digital Versatile Disc or Pen-drive. - Professional documentation and preservation services. > ***Conditions*** _*The work done must be certified by the holder of the material._ _*Tiatr Academy of Goa will periodically review the work undertaken and accordingly extend or curtail the assistantship._ _*Holders must indicate willingness to permit and facilitate documentation tasks._
Eligibility: > ***For Material Holders*** - The applicant must be a possessor of materials related to Tiatr such as manuscripts, photos, handbills, advertisements, newspaper or magazine clippings, video and audio recordings. - The applicant must indicate willingness to permit and facilitate documentation and organization tasks. > ***For Documentation Assistants*** - The applicant must be willing to serve as Documentation Assistant. - The applicant must be capable of performing tasks including compilation and organisation of materials, typing or word-processing of textual materials, scanning and converting by Optical Character Recognition, conversion of images by scanning or photographing with digital camera, and converting video or audio recordings from analogue to digital format.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:** The interested applicant should take a printout of the [prescribed format](https://www.goa.gov.in/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/Citizen-Charter-TAG.pdf) of the application form. The form requires details including name of artiste or documentation assistant, complete address, contact number, email identification, Aadhaar Card number, and specific aspect of Tiatr on which documentation can be done. **Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields including personal details, contact information, and specify the aspect of Tiatr on which documentation work can be undertaken. Attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Sign the application form and mention the date. **Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - **Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001** _*For material holders, indicate willingness to permit and facilitate documentation tasks, and may also indicate proximate candidates willing to undertake the documentation work._ _*Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment received for future reference._
##### ***Post-Application Processes*** **Step 1:****** ***Assignment of Tasks*** Tiatr Academy of Goa will assign documentation tasks to candidates according to the requests received from the holders of materials. The academy will match documentation assistants with appropriate holders based on proximity and requirements. **Step 2:** ***Work Execution and Certification*** Documentation assistants will perform assigned tasks including compilation, organization, digitisation, and conversion of materials under the supervision and certification of the material holder. The quality and progress of work will be periodically reviewed by Tiatr Academy of Goa. **Step 3:** ***Payment and Delivery*** Upon completion and certification of work, documentation assistants will receive honorarium payment on clock-hour basis as determined by Tiatr Academy of Goa. A copy of digitised material will be provided to the holder on Digital Versatile Disc or Pen-drive, while Tiatr Academy of Goa will retain a similar copy for its uses. _*The Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right to make any changes in the rules of the scheme._

Documents Required: - Self-Attested Copy of Aadhaar Card.

schemeName: Promotion of Tiatr Music
Details:
The scheme "Promotion of Tiatr Music" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage youth and others to learn to play blowing instruments, particularly Trumpet and Saxophone, by providing them with financial assistance. The scheme provides financial support for tuition fees, a 50% subsidy on the cost of medium-priced blowing instruments such as Saxophone, Trumpet, or Clarinet, and opportunities for advanced certification from institutions like Trinity College or Royal School of Music. It also offers music classes at the Tiatr Academy of Goa's Conference Hall and awards certificates upon successful course completion. The applicant must identify a suitable tutor, purchase a blowing instrument, submit an undertaking to serve the tiatr stage, and undergo periodical tests. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applications for this scheme are accepted by submitting the prescribed application form available at the office of the Tiatr Academy of Goa.
The scheme aims to encourage individuals to learn blowing instruments crucial for Tiatr music, such as Trumpet & Saxophone, addressing a decline in musicians. It provides financial assistance for tuition and instrument purchase, benefiting youth and other interested persons to preserve Tiatr music.
Benefits: - Reimbursement of tuition fees paid to the tutor, with the exact amount to be decided by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. - A 50% subsidy (refund) on the cost of a blowing instrument (Saxophone, Trumpet, or Clarinet), based on the value of a medium-priced instrument. - Appropriate financial support for students to register and get themselves certified by institutions such as Trinity College or Royal School of Music. - To cover tuition costs incurred for learning blowing instruments vital for Tiatr music. - To reduce the financial burden of purchasing an essential blowing instrument, making learning more accessible. - To support the pursuit of advanced musical qualifications and professional certification. **Conditions:** _*The student must complete the full course._ _*The refund is subject to the availability of funds._ _*The chosen tutor should maintain a record of attendance for the students and submit it to the Tiatr Academy of Goa._ _*Students must undergo periodical tests to verify their performance, and those unable to cope with the syllabus or found not serious may be terminated after evaluation._
Eligibility: - The applicant must be any interested person, young or adult, free to avail the benefit of this scheme. - The applicant must identify a tutor having the credentials to teach him/her the blowing instrument, which will be verified and accepted by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. - The applicant must serve the tiatr stage by playing in any tiatr band or musical group for at least one year after completion of the course.

Application Process.process:
##### ***Pre-Application Process*** The interested person must identify a tutor who possesses the necessary credentials to teach the chosen blowing instrument. The Tiatr Academy of Goa (TAG) will then verify and accept the tutor's credentials. It is advisable to consult with the music teacher regarding the brand or make of the instrument to be purchased. ##### ***Application Process*** **Step 1:** The interested applicant should take a printout of the [prescribed format](https://www.goa.gov.in/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/Citizen-Charter-TAG.pdf) of the application form. **Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Sign the application form and mention the date. **Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the copies of the mandatory documents to - ***Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001*** _*Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment._ *The application will be considered on a 'First Come First Serve' basis and is subject to the availability of funds.
##### ***Post-Application Process*** **Step 1:** ***Purchase the Instrument and Submit the Bill Copy*** Upon acceptance into the scheme, the student is required to purchase a blowing instrument, such as a Saxophone, Trumpet, or Clarinet. While the student has the flexibility to purchase an instrument of higher cost, the Tiatr Academy of Goa will consider only the value of a medium-priced instrument for subsidy calculations. Immediately after purchasing the instrument, a self-attested Xerox copy of the bill must be submitted to the Tiatr Academy of Goa, and the original bill must be carefully preserved by the student.
**Step 2:****** ***Undergo Course Training and Periodical Assessments*** The student will commence and undergo the music course, which will follow a syllabus framed by a panel of expert musicians appointed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. The course duration is structured into two levels and is spread over a period of two years, or as otherwise determined by the expert panel. Students are required to undergo periodical tests to verify their progress and performance. The tutor is responsible for maintaining and submitting attendance records to the Tiatr Academy of Goa. Students who cannot cope with the syllabus or are deemed not serious in their learning may be terminated from the scheme after an evaluation report from the expert panel. The Tiatr Academy of Goa also encourages students to register and get certified by institutions such as Trinity College or Royal School of Music through appropriate financial support.
**Step 3:****** ***Submit Undertaking and Original Bill for Reimbursement*** Upon the successful completion of the full course, the student must submit the original bill of the purchased instrument to the Tiatr Academy of Goa in order to claim the 50% subsidy on its cost. Concurrently, the student must provide a formal undertaking to the Tiatr Academy of Goa, committing to serve the tiatr stage by actively playing in any tiatr band or musical group for a minimum period of one year following the completion of the course.
**Step 4:** ***Receive Financial Subsidy and Course Completion Certificate*** After successful verification of all submitted documents and subject to the availability of funds, the Tiatr Academy of Goa will process and refund 50% of the cost of the instrument (calculated based on a medium-priced instrument) to the eligible student. Additionally, upon the successful completion of the course, students will be awarded official certificates by the Tiatr Academy of Goa, acknowledging their achievement and new skills.

Documents Required: > **At Application Stage** ◦ Self Attested Copy Of Aadhaar Card ◦ Self Attested Copy Of PAN Card > **At Post-Application / During Course** ◦ Self Attested Xerox Copy Of The Bill Of The Instrument Purchased (To Be Submitted Immediately After Purchase Of The Instrument) > **At Benefit Disbursal Stage (for instrument subsidy)** ◦ Original Bill Of The Instrument Purchased (To Be Preserved By The Student And Submitted Upon Completion Of The Course) ◦ Undertaking (To Serve The Tiatr Stage By Playing In Any Tiatr Band Or Musical Group For At Least One Year After Completion Of The Course) > **Tutor Related (submitted by tutor, not applicant)** ◦ Record Of Attendance Of The Students (To Be Maintained And Submitted To The Tiatr Academy Of Goa) ◦ Merit Report (For Finalizing Applicant Names)

schemeName: Mukhyamantri Yuba Yogayog Yojana-Special
Details:
The scheme "Mukhyamantri Yuba Yogayog Yojana-Special" by the Directorate of Information Technology, Government of Tripura, aims to digitally empower students and help them leverage the advantages of an interconnected world. Through this scheme, a grant or the cost of the phone, whichever is lower, is provided for the purchase of a smartphone to students who pursued a final-year undergraduate degree in Government Institutes in Tripura. The Directorate of Information Technology is responsible for implementing the scheme. > **Objective:** The need for a Smart Phone in this digitally connected world cannot be over emphasised. The Smart Phone is helpful in opening up huge opportunities for developing skills, finding resources to enhance knowledge and availing employment opportunities. Providing a grant for the purchase of smart phones to the students of the final year will empower them digitally and help them leverage the advantages of an interconnected world.
The scheme aims to digitally empower students and help them leverage the advantages of an interconnected world.
Benefits:
1. Eligible students receive a grant of ₹5,000/- or the cost of the phone, whichever is lower, for the purchase of a smartphone.
> **Mode of Disbursement:** The grant is credited directly to the eligible applicant's registered bank account using the Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) mode. > **Expected Time of Disbursement:** The payment processing by the State Level Authority is expected to take place from the launch date of the scheme to 2 months after. > **Frequency of Disbursement:** The benefit can be availed once in a lifetime.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must belong to Tripura and be registered in a Tripura Ration Card. 1. The applicant must have pursued a final year undergraduate degree course during the academic year 2022-23. 1. The course must have been from a Government College/Institute/University in Tripura. 1. The phone must be purchased on or after July 1, 2022. 1. The phone must be purchased in the name of the applicant or their parents. 1. The applicant must have passed the previous academic year or semester before the final year.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** Visit the [Beneficiary Management System (BMS) portal](https://bms.tripura.gov.in) and click the "Citizen" link. **Step 2:** Click on "Beneficiary Schemes" to see the available schemes. **Step 3:** Find "Mukhyamantri Yuba Yogayog Yojana-Special (AY 2022-2023)" from the list and click "Enroll". **Step 4:** First-time users must click "New User? Register" and provide their full name, mobile number, and email ID. **Step 5:** Enter the One-Time Passwords (OTPs) received on the mobile number and email to complete registration. **Step 6:** Log in with the registered email ID or mobile number and the new OTP received. **Step 7:** Enter your 12-digit Ration Card number, select your name from the family members list, and fill out your personal and address details. **Step 8:** Provide your bank account details, including the bank name, account number, IFSC code, and account holder name. **Step 9:** Fill in the scheme-specific information, such as college name, year of study, invoice details (invoice number, date, amount, GSTIN), and phone's IMEI number. **Step 10:** Upload all mandatory documents. All documents except the photograph must be in PDF format with a maximum size of 2 MB. The photograph must be an image file (e.g., JPG, JPEG) with a maximum size of 2 MB. **Step 11:** Submit the application. An acknowledgement slip will be generated for future reference.

Documents Required: 1. Applicant Photograph (image format, up to 2 MB) 1. Valid GST Invoice of the Mobile Phone (Invoice date must not be before July 1, 2022) 1. Final Year/Semester Marksheet (PDF format, up to 2 MB) 1. Applicant Bank Passbook or Bank Account Document (PDF format, up to 2 MB) 1. Ration Card (PDF format, up to 2 MB)

schemeName: Maulana Azad Education Finance Foundation Scheme
Details:
The scheme “Maulana Azad Education Finance Foundation Scheme” was launched by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide interest-free loans to students from minority communities for pursuing higher education in India and abroad.
The scheme aims to provide interest-free loans of up to ₹5 lakh to students from minority communities for pursuing higher education in India and abroad.
Benefits: Under this scheme, students from minority communities are provided interest-free loans of up to ₹5 lakh for pursuing higher education in India and abroad.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must belong to a minority community (Muslim, Sikh, Christian, Parsi, Buddhist, or Jain). 1. The age of the applicant should be between 18 and 35 years. 1. The applicant must have passed Class 12. 1. The applicant must be studying in or have taken admission to a university/college/institute recognized by the Central Government, State Government, or any other competent authority. 1. The annual family income of the applicant from all sources should not exceed ₹2,50,000/-. 1. The beneficiary availing the loan must repay it within 3 years after the completion of education or upon gaining employment, whichever is earlier.

Application Process.process: - The application form is obtained from the district office and must be submitted to the same office by August 31. The application process is currently offline. - Along with the application form, the applicant is required to submit a recent passport-size color photograph, Aadhaar card, permanent residence certificate, minority certificate, birth certificate, previous year’s mark sheet, admission certificate from the college or institute, fee structure, college identity card, passbook of a nationalized bank, and an affidavit declaring that the loan scheme is being availed for the first time. In addition, the guarantor’s documents, such as salary or income certificate, PAN card, recent photograph, Aadhaar card, ration card, and status certificate report, must also be attached. - After submission, the district office forwards the applications to the corporation headquarters by September 15. These applications are then presented before the selection committee constituted by the Government of Uttarakhand. Once approved by the loan selection committee, the sanctioned loan amount is transferred to the account of the concerned district in accordance with the applicant’s requirement. The district office then disburses the amount directly into the applicant’s bank account. - Proposals are approved only within the budget limit available for the financial year, and any applications that exceed this limit are treated as automatically cancelled.

Documents Required: > **For the Applicant:** 1. Colour Photograph 1. Aadhaar Card 1. Permanent Residence Certificate 1. Minority Proof Certificate 1. Proof of Birth 1. Marksheet of last year 1. College/Institution Admission Certificate 1. Fee structure 1. College ID 1. Nationalized Bank Passbook 1. Affidavit to the effect that the loan scheme is being availed of for the first time > **For the 2(two) Guarantors:** 1. Salary/Income Certificate 1. PAN card 1. Photographs 1. Aadhaar Card 1. Ration Card 1. Status certificate/report

schemeName: Self-Employment Scheme for Unemployed Minority Communities
Details:
The scheme “Self-Employment Scheme for Unemployed Minority Communities” was launched by the Minority Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide a grant of 25% of the loan amount to individuals belonging to minority communities who are permanent residents of Uttarakhand. The grant is available when a loan of ₹1 lakh to ₹10 lakh is taken for starting self-employment activities.
The scheme aims to provide a grant of 25% of the loan amount (for loans ranging from ₹1 lakh to ₹10 lakh) to individuals belonging to minority communities, who are permanent residents of Uttarakhand, for the purpose of self-employment.
Benefits: - Under this scheme, a grant is provided for self-employment. On taking a loan of ₹1 lakh to ₹10 lakh, a grant of 25% of the loan amount is given, with a minimum grant of ₹25,000/- and a maximum of ₹2,50,000/-. - The benefit of the scheme is available only on taking a loan, in which 60% of the project cost is provided as a loan, 25% as grant/subsidy by the department, and 15% as contribution by the applicant. - Interest on the loan will be charged according to the current prevailing rates of the bank.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must belong to a minority community (Muslim, Sikh, Christian, Parsi, Buddhist, or Jain). 1. The applicant’s age should be between 18 and 55 years. 1. The annual family income from all sources should not exceed ₹2,50,000/-, or the applicant should be a member of a BPL family.

Application Process.process: - Advertisement is issued by the department to select the beneficiary. Thereafter, the application form can be obtained from the district offices of the state (District Minority Welfare Officer / District Social Welfare Officer). - Along with the application form, the applicant must attach the prescribed income certificate / BPL certificate, caste certificate, permanent residence certificate, Aadhaar card, bank account details, and a project report for the proposed scheme. The completed application form should then be submitted to the office of the District Minority Welfare Officer / District Social Welfare Officer of the concerned district. - Thereafter, an interview is conducted by a selection committee constituted under the chairmanship of the Chief Development Officer at the district level. The application forms of candidates who are successful in the interview are forwarded to the applicant’s bank for loan sanction. - After the bank sanctions the loan, the district office sends the application form to the corporation headquarters for the release of 25% of the grant amount upon completion of all formalities. The grant amount is made available to the district office after approval from the Managing Director at the Corporation Headquarters. - Thereafter, the district office, after receiving 15% of the beneficiary’s share, transfers 40% of the total amount to the concerned bank, after which the bank releases the loan to the applicant. Currently, the application process is offline, while the online process is under development.

Documents Required: - Income certificate / BPL certificate - Caste certificate - Permanent residence certificate - Aadhaar card - Bank account details - A project report for the proposed scheme

schemeName: Financial Assistance to Dramatic Troupes participating in Kala Academy’s Annual Tiatr Competition
Details:
The scheme "Financial Assistance to Dramatic Troupes participating in Kala Academy’s Annual Tiatr Competition" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to encourage non-commercial dramatic troupes participating in Kala Academy’s yearly Tiatr Festival to produce Tiatrs of better quality. The scheme provides financial support for specific aspects of drama, including Direction, Stage Setting, Live Band Music with at least 2 blowing instruments, Light Effects, Background Music, Costumes, Make-up, and Transport. It also features the video recording of the Tiatr for the Tiatr Academy of Goa Library, with a free Digital Versatile Disc copy provided to the institution, and offers expertise through compulsory workshops in various Tiatr components.
The scheme aims to encourage non-commercial dramatic troupes participating in Kala Academy’s Annual Tiatr Competition to produce higher quality Tiatrs. It provides financial support for various production aspects, video recording, and expert workshops, benefiting dramatic troupes.
Benefits:
##### ***1. Financial Support*** - For improving aspects of Tiatr production, including Direction, Stage Setting, Live Band Music with at least 2 blowing instruments, Light Effects, Background Music, Costumes, Make-up, and Transport. - The extent of the financial support shall be fixed by Tiatr Academy of Goa. - Direct payment to the Institution based on submitted bills. ***Conditions*** _*The troupe must compulsorily participate in workshops organized by Tiatr Academy of Goa by deputing at least one of its members; otherwise, they will not be entitled to avail the benefits of this scheme._ _*The Tiatr must not contain any adverse remark in any form, either written or verbal, against any Government/Individual/Institution, etc., or anything against one’s caste, creed, and religion which may lead to hurting of religious sentiments; if proved so, Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right to disqualify the performance and refrain from making any payment or recall the payment if already made._ _*All advertisements, oral, print or electronic media, banners/standees, etc., must insert/publish and announce before the performance and during the interval that ‘This Tiatr is staged in collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa’._
##### ***2. Video Recording of Tiatr and Digital Versatile Disc Copy*** - Tiatr Academy of Goa will video record the said Tiatr for its Library and other uses. One copy of the Digital Versatile Disc will be given to the Institution free of cost. To preserve the presentation of Tiatr for future generations. - The dramatic troupe will have the freedom to use the Digital Versatile Disc in any manner, but cannot make use of the logo of Tiatr Academy of Goa on the said Digital Versatile Disc. *The videographer will be appointed by Tiatr Academy of Goa.
##### ***3. Expertise and Workshops*** Tiatr Academy of Goa will provide expertise to the troupes in the different compartments of Tiatr (Direction, Stage Setting, Live Band Music, Light Effects, Background Music, Costumes, Make-up, Transport) by organizing workshops in those aspects. ***Conditions*** _*The troupe will have to compulsorily participate in these workshops by deputing at least one of the members of the troupe._
Eligibility: - The applicant must be a dramatic troupe. - The applicant must be participating in the Tiatr Competitions organized by Kala Academy. - The applicant must fulfill the conditions laid down in the scheme as per the format enclosed. - The applicant's Tiatr script will be scrutinized by a scrutiny committee who will submit a report on whether the Tiatr is as per the format. - The applicant must ensure that one typed copy of the Tiatr script and one typed copy each of the lyrics of the songs are submitted to Tiatr Academy of Goa along with the application form. - The applicant must ensure that handwritten copies of scripts and lyrics will not be accepted. - The applicant's Tiatr, in any form either written or verbal, must not contain any adverse remarks against any Government/Individual/Institution, etc., or anything against one’s caste, creed, and religion which may lead to hurting of religious sentiments of anybody. - The applicant must compulsorily participate in workshops organized by Tiatr Academy of Goa by deputing at least one of the members of the troupe.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** The interested applicant should take a printout of the [prescribed format](https://www.goa.gov.in/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/Citizen-Charter-TAG.pdf) of the application form. **Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Sign the application form and mention the date. **Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the copies of the mandatory documents to - ***Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001*** _*Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment._ *The application will be considered on a 'First Come First Serve' basis and is subject to the availability of funds. ##### ***Post-Application Processes*** **Step 1:** ***Await Script Scrutiny*** Upon submission, the Tiatr script will be scrutinized by a scrutiny committee to determine if it aligns with the prescribed format. The Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right to disqualify the performance and recall or refrain from payment if any adverse remarks against Government/Individual/Institution, caste, creed, or religion are found. **Step 2:** ***Participate in Workshops*** The applicant troupe must compulsorily participate in workshops organized by Tiatr Academy of Goa by deputing at least one member to receive benefits. Failure to participate will result in ineligibility for the scheme's benefits. **Step 3:** ***Ensure Proper Public Announcement and Promotion*** The applicant must ensure that all advertisements, whether oral, print, or electronic media, banners, or standees, prominently include the statement: ‘This Tiatr is staged in collaboration with Tiatr Academy of Goa’. This announcement must also be made before the performance and during the interval. **Step 4:** ***Submit Financial Documents for Disbursement*** To receive financial assistance, the institution must submit original bills along with a statement of expenditure to the Tiatr Academy of Goa. Payments will be made directly to the Institution for services rendered, and service providers must provide receipts, with stamped receipts mandatory for amounts exceeding ₹5,000/-.
