schemeName: "Orthodox or Specialty Tea Production Subsidy" under the "Assam Tea Industries Special Incentives Scheme"
Details:
Launched in 2020, the scheme "Assam Tea Industries Special Incentives Scheme (ATISIS)" by the Finance (Institutional Finance) Department, Government of Assam, aims to ensure long-term financial sustainability of the Tea industry and to incentivize manufacturers to move from Crush, Tear, Curl tea to Orthodox tea production. The scheme is implemented by the Finance Department and the Industries & Commerce Department, Government of Assam, through multiple implementing agencies, including banks and the District Industries & Commerce Centre. The applications for this scheme are accepted online through a dedicated portal with a Direct Benefit Transfer mechanism for reimbursement.
The scheme aims to ensure long-term financial sustainability of the Tea industry and to incentivize manufacturers to move from Crush, Tear, Curl tea to Orthodox tea production. The scheme is implemented by the Finance Department and the Industries & Commerce Department, Government of Assam.
Benefits: **Benefit Amount:** ₹10/- per kilogram for Orthodox tea, Green tea, White tea, Oolong tea, Singhpo tea, Purple Tea, Yellow tea, or other Specialty tea **Special Rate:** ₹12/- per kilogram for applications of Financial Year 2023-24 only (tea production year 2022-23). **Validity Period:** Extended from Financial Year 2023-24 to 2027-28. **Disbursement Mode:** Direct Benefit Transfer as reimbursement. **Claim Deadline:** Latest by 30th June on completion of every financial year. **Additional Benefit:** Provided in addition to any other subsidy claimed from the Tea Board of India or any other agency.
Eligibility:
**General Eligibility** - The applicant must be a tea plantation across all sizes - The applicant must be a tea manufacturing unit manufacturing Crush, Tear, Curl Tea, Orthodox Tea, or Speciality tea including Green tea, Oolong Tea, White tea, Yellow tea and Purple tea - The applicant must be located entirely in Assam - The applicant must not have any part of the plantation or manufacturing facility located outside the State of Assam
**Production Subsidy Specific Eligibility** - The applicant must be manufacturing Orthodox tea, Green tea, White tea, Oolong tea, Singhpo tea, Purple Tea, Yellow tea or other Speciality tea (not manufactured through Crush, Tear, Curl process). - The applicant must have started production on or after 1st of April, 2020.

Application Process.process:
**Registration Process** **Step 1:** Visit the [dedicated portal](https://atisis.assam.gov.in/atsisver/login.html) of "Assam Tea Industries Special Incentives" Scheme. Click on the "New User Registration" option. **Step 2:** In the registration form, fill in basic details including name, mobile number, and email address. Create a username and password following the portal's password policy. Verify your mobile number through one-time password verification. Complete Captcha Code verification. Submit the registration form. **Step 3:** Check your registered email for the account activation link. Click on the activation link to activate the account. Log in to the portal using registered credentials. **Step 4:** Upload all supporting documents of eligibility in the prescribed format. Fill in complete unit details, including location, type of tea production, and capacity. Submit the unit registration form. Wait for registration approval.
**Application Process** **Step 1:** Log in to the portal using registered credentials. Navigate to the "Apply for Benefits" section. Select the scheme component that you intend to apply for. **Step 2:** Fill in the prescribed application form with all mandatory fields. Upload all supporting documents as mentioned in the portal. Ensure file formats and file size restrictions are followed as per the portal guidelines. Review all entered information for accuracy. **Step 3:** Upload documents in the specified format and size. Ensure all documents are clear and legible. Complete document verification checklist. **Step 4:** Review the complete application before submission. Apply online. _*Note down the application reference number. Save a copy of the submitted application form._ _*Applicants are strongly encouraged to save a copy of the submitted application, confirmation message, and application reference number for future reference and tracking purposes._
**Application Status Tracking** Log in to the portal to check application status. Track application progress through different stages of verification. Receive Short Message Service alerts throughout the process, including registration, fund release, etc. _*For Technical Support, please write to atisis.assam@gmail.com._
**Disbursement Process** The Finance Department releases the benefit directly to the beneficiary's bank account. Short Message Service alerts sent for funds disbursement. The beneficiary receives the Direct Benefit Transfer in a registered bank account.

Documents Required: - Monthly E-Returns of Tea Production submitted to Tea Board India. - Tea Production Certificate. - Tea Manufacturing License. - Orthodox/Speciality Tea Production Evidence.

schemeName: Mobile Food Court Van (DAADC)
Details:
The "Mobile Food Court Van" scheme is implemented by the Dr. Ambedkar Antyodaya Development Corporation (DAADC) under the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to generate self-employment opportunities in the food and beverage sector by providing loan assistance to unemployed scheduled caste individuals belonging to Antyodaya families. Under this scheme, loan is provided to the eligible beneficiaries at a concessional interest rate.
The scheme aims to generate self-employment opportunities in the food and beverage sector by providing credit to unemployed scheduled caste individuals belonging to Antyodaya families. Under this scheme, loans are provided to the eligible beneficiaries at a concessional interest rate.
Benefits: **Loan Amount:** Up to ₹6,00,000/- **Interest Rate:** 6% per annum **Contribution:** - State Government Contribution: 95 % - Beneficiary Contribution: 5% **Possible Installment Amount:** - ₹11,020/- per month (for 5 years) - ₹ 9,447/- per month (for 6 years) - ₹ 8,327/- per month (for 7 years)
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category. 1. The applicant should belong to an Antyodaya Anna Yojana (AAY) family. 1. The applicant’s annual family income should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-. 1. The applicant should provide two guarantors to get the loan.

schemeName: Loan for Small Businesses (DAADC)
Details:
The "Loan for Small Businesses" scheme is implemented by the Dr. Ambedkar Antyodaya Development Corporation (DAADC) under the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to promote self-employment among Scheduled Caste (SC) individuals belonging to Antyodaya Anna Yojana (AAY) families by providing financial assistance for starting small businesses or self-employment ventures. Under this scheme, eligible beneficiaries are provided a loan of up to ₹1,25,000 at a concessional interest rate.

schemeName: Late Jaswantsinhji Thakor and Late Rasiklal Andhariya Classical Music Scholarship
Details:
The scheme "Late Jaswantsinhji Thakor and Late Rasiklal Andhariya Classical Music Scholarship" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to preserve and promote classical music in Gujarat by offering financial support to eligible Gurus for imparting training and to their disciples for receiving it. The scheme facilitates a 10-month classical music training period where selected Gurus can train up to 2 disciples, and both Gurus and disciples receive monetary assistance. The scheme is implemented by Gujarat Rajya Sangeet Natak Akademi, Gandhinagar, which releases a public advertisement annually inviting applications. <br>
The scheme "Late Jaswantsinhji Thakor and Late Rasiklal Andhariya Classical Music Scholarship" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department aims to promote classical music education by providing annual scholarships to eligible Gurus and their disciples across Gujarat.
Benefits: > **For Gurus:** - Financial assistance of ₹1,000/- per month for a duration of 10 months (i.e., ₹10,000/- per disciple) for training up to 2 disciples. > **For Disciples:** - A scholarship of ₹10,000/- per annum, calculated at ₹1,000/- per month for 10 months, for receiving classical music training from the selected Guru.
Eligibility: > **For Gurus:** - The applicant should be a classical music artist. - The applicant should have completed formal education in classical music or must possess at least 7 years of experience in teaching classical music. - The applicant should be capable of training a maximum of 2 disciples during the 10-month training period. > **For Disciples:** - The applicant should be a student of classical music residing in Gujarat. - The applicant should be undergoing training under an eligible Guru selected under this scheme. - The applicant should submit a certificate of training provided by the Guru.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** Applications are invited once every year through a public advertisement by Gujarat Rajya Sangeet Natak Akademi. **Step 2:** Applicants must submit the prescribed application form along with required documents to the designated address. **Step 3:** The selection committee evaluates the applications and selects eligible Gurus and disciples. **Step 4:** Both Guru and disciple must submit a report of training conducted and received over 10 months. **Step 5:** Upon successful verification, scholarship amounts are disbursed directly to the beneficiary accounts.

Documents Required: 1. Aadhar Card. 1. Age Proof. 1. Attested copy of PAN Card. 1. Copy Bank Details. 1. Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque.

schemeName: Khel Pratibha Puraskar
Details:
The scheme “Khel Pratibha Puraskar” by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to financially support and honour sportspersons from Gujarat who have earned medals at national and international levels by awarding them cash prizes between ₹10,000/- and ₹5,00,00,000/- depending on the level and nature of their sporting achievement. The scheme intends to inspire athletic excellence and acknowledge the hard work and dedication of Gujarat’s athletes on prestigious platforms.
The scheme “Khel Pratibha Puraskar” by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat aims to recognize and encourage sportspersons by providing cash prizes ranging from ₹10,000 to ₹5,00,00,000 to national and international medal winners across the state.
Benefits: - **Cash Prize:** An amount ranging from ₹10,000/- to ₹5,00,00,000/-.
Eligibility: - The applicant should be a sportsperson. - The applicant should have won a medal at a national or international level. - The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat or should be representing Gujarat officially in the sporting event.

Application Process.process: **Registration Process:** **Step 1:** Visit the homepage of the [Sports Authority of Gujarat](https://sportsauthority.gujarat.gov.in/). **Step 2:** Click on the “Registration” button on the upper-right side of the page. **Step 3:** Fill in all the required details as per the form and submit it. **Application Process:** **Step 1:** After registration, check your registered email for login credentials. **Step 2:** Select “Player” as the user type and log in using the credentials received. **Step 3:** Click on the concerned scheme name and proceed with the application.

schemeName: Scholarship for Self Finance Colleges Students of NT/DNT
Details:
The scheme "Scholarship for Self Finance Colleges Students of NT/DNT" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to support students belonging to Nomadic Tribes and De-notified Tribes (NT/DNT) categories in accessing quality education in self-financed colleges by reducing the financial burden. Through this scheme, financial assistance of up to ₹50,000/- is provided to cover tuition fees, registration charges, education fees, and other scholarship-related expenses for students enrolled in self-financed colleges. The scheme is implemented by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, and seeks to empower NT/DNT students with improved access to higher education opportunities.
The scheme "Scholarship for Self Finance Colleges Students of NT/DNT" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, provides financial assistance to Nomadic and De-notified Tribe students for pursuing higher education in self-financed colleges.
Benefits: - **Financial Assistance:** Up to ₹50,000/- for tuition fee, registration fee, education fee, and other scholarship-related charges.

schemeName: Micro Finance (GBCDC)
Details:
The scheme "Micro Finance (GBCDC)" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to create self-employment for men from the backwards classes. Through this scheme, low interest rates and financial help are provided to the backwards class men. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat Backwards Classes Development Corporation.
The scheme aims to create self-employment for the backwards class men. Through this scheme, low interest rates and financial help are provided to the backwards class men.
Benefits: 1. The maximum loan limit under this scheme is up to ₹1,25,000/-. 1. The interest rate in these schemes is 5 percent per annum. 1. In these schemes, 90 per cent of the unit cost will be provided as a loan, with 90 per cent from the national corporation, 5 per cent from the state government, and 5 per cent from the beneficiary contribution. 1. This loan is to be repaid in 48 equal monthly instalments, including interest.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to a socially and educationally backwards class. 1. The total annual income of the applicant's family should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-. 1. The applicant's age should be between 21 and 45 years as on the date of application. 1. The applicant must have experience in a business requiring technical and other skills.

Select “Micro Finance Scheme” from the list of available schemes. **Step 6:** Fill out the Application Form, enter the following details: - Personal Information: Name, gender, date of birth, caste, etc. - Address Information: Permanent and correspondence address - Income Details: Monthly family income and source - Loan Requirement: Amount needed, proposed use (e.g., business, self-employment) - Bank Account Details: For loan disbursement **Step 7:** Upload scanned copies of the Caste certificate, Income certificate, Aadhaar card, Passport-size photo, Bank passbook (first page), and Residence proof. **Step 8:** Double-check all details. schemeName: Transportation Scheme (Gujarat Gopalak Vikas Nigam)
Details:
The scheme "Transportation Scheme" by the Gujarat Gopalak Vikas Nigam, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide loans for the purchase of auto rickshaws and loading vehicles. Through this scheme, financial assistance for vehicle purchase is offered to the Rabari and Bharwad castes from the socially and educationally backwards classes. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat Gopalak Vikas Nigam.
The scheme aims to provide loans for the purchase of auto rickshaws and loading vehicles. Through this scheme, financial assistance for vehicle purchase is provided to the Rabari and Bharwad castes from the socially and educationally backwards classes.
Benefits: Loans are provided on an individual basis to purchase auto rickshaws and loading vehicles. - Maximum Loan Limit: ₹2,00,000/- - Interest Rate: 6% per annum - Loan Amount: 95% of the vehicle cost - Beneficiary Contribution: 5% of the vehicle cost
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to the Rabari and Bharwad castes from the socially and educationally backwards classes. 1. The applicant's age should be between 21 and 45 years. 1. The applicant's annual income should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-.

Application Process.process:
**Step 1: Register on the Official Portal** - Go to the [Official Website](https://ggdconline.gujarat.gov.in/) Gujarat Gopalak Development Corporation.- Scroll down on the homepage, find the "Transportation Scheme," and click on "Apply Now". - You will be directed to the [application form](https://ggdconline.gujarat.gov.in/SchemeTransport/AddEdit). **Step 2: Access and Fill Out the Application Form** - Select "Transport", enter Unit Cost, and specify the Required Loan Amount. - Provide Aadhaar, Ration, Voter ID, full name (Last, First, Father/Husband), address, district, taluka, village, PIN, date of birth, age (21-45 as of 14/08/2023), caste, subcaste, phone, mobile, email, gender, and marital status. - Enter income certificate number, issue date, issuing officer's name, total annual family income (up to ₹ 3,00,000/-), and parent/guardian's occupation. - If "Physically Handicapped," select "Yes" or "No". If you selected "Yes", provide the percentage (in %). - Indicate if any family member works in a government or private job. If "Yes," provide their Name, Designation, Place, and Salary details. - Select your Education Qualification: Uneducated, Educated, Graduation, Post Graduation, or Other Degree. - If you have taken a past loan, select "Yes" or "No". If you selected "Yes", provide loan details (date, amount, paid, remaining) and your account number. - Enter driving license number and expiry date. For passenger vehicles, select "Yes" or "No". If you selected "Yes", provide the base number. For transport vehicles, select "Yes" or "No". If you selected "Yes", provide the transport license number. - Provide the dealer's name, address, vehicle name, and vehicle price. - Provide bank account number, bank name, branch name, name as per account, account type (Saving/Current), MICR code, and IFSC code. **Step 3: Review and Final Submission** - Carefully review each module. Use the preview option to examine the application before final submission. Fill out the provided "CAPTCHA" and Click on “Submit”.
**Track and Review Status** - Applicant will receive an Application ID/Reference Number. Save or print the acknowledgement for future tracking. - Go to the [Official Website](https://ggdconline.gujarat.gov.in/) Gujarat Gopalak Development Corporation.- Scroll down and locate the Know App Status. Click on "Know App Status". - Select the Scheme name, Enter App No., and Birth Date. Fill out the Captcha and click on Submit.

Bank Account Details (Bank Account Number, Bank Name, Branch Name, Name as per Account, Account Type, MICR Code, IFSC Code)

schemeName: Mahila Samruddhi Yojana (GSKVN)
Details:
The scheme "Mahila Samruddhi Yojana (GSKVN)" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat Government, aims to provide financial assistance to female Safai Kamdars and their dependents to start small businesses. Through this scheme, loans for various self-employment ventures are provided to eligible female individuals. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat Safai Kamdar Vikas Nigam (GSKVN).
The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to female Safai Kamdars and their dependents to start small businesses. Through this scheme, loans for various self-employment ventures are provided to eligible female individuals.
Benefits: 1. An individual loan of ₹1,00,000/- is provided. 1. The interest rate on the loan is 4%. 1. The loan is intended for various businesses/occupations such as Mandap Decoration, Computer, Electrical Shop, Animal Husbandry, Grocery Shop, Bamboo Work, Sewing Work, Embroidery, Beauty Parlour, Mobile Repairing, etc.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a native resident of Gujarat State. 1. The applicant must be a sanitation worker or a dependent woman. 1. The applicant must be female. 1. The applicant's age should not be less than 18 years and not more than 50 years on the date of the advertisement.

schemeName: The Post-Matric Scholarship For Scheduled Tribes Students
Details:
The scheme "Post-Matric Scholarship for Scheduled Tribes Students" by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Government of India, and the Government of Mizoram aims to provide financial assistance to Scheduled Tribe students pursuing post-matriculation education. Through this scheme, financial support is provided to ST students enrolled in recognized professional, technical, non-professional, and non-technical courses, including correspondence, distance, and continuing education. The scheme is implemented by the Mizoram Scholarship Board, Government of Mizoram. It ensures that students can pursue higher education without financial constraints. The assistance supports education at various levels and promotes educational advancement among Scheduled Tribes. The funding is shared in a 90:10 ratio between the Ministry of Tribal Affairs and the Mizoram State Government.
The scheme "Post-Matric Scholarship for Scheduled Tribes Students" by the Ministry of Tribal Affairs, Government of India, and Government of Mizoram aims to provide financial assistance to ST students pursuing post-matriculation education. It covers various recognized courses.
Benefits: 1. Financial assistance for post-matric education. 1. Support for ST students pursuing recognized professional, technical, non-professional, non-technical, and correspondence courses.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Tribes community. 1. The applicant should be permanently settled in the state of Mizoram. 1. The applicant should be pursuing studies from Class XI up to a Post-Doctoral Fellowship. 1. The applicant’s parents’/guardians’ income from all sources should not exceed ₹2,50,000 (Rupees Two Lakh Fifty Thousand only) per annum.

Application Process.process: 1. Open the official website of NSP [https://scholarships.gov.in/](https://scholarships.gov.in/)1. Register yourself on the portal if you are not registered already. 1. schemeName: Stipends to Students of Economically Backward Class for Technical and Vocational Courses after SSC
Details:
The scheme “Stipends to Students of Economically Backward Class for Technical and Vocational Courses after SSC” by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat aims to promote inclusive education by financially supporting students from economically weaker sections pursuing technical and vocational education after SSC. The initiative offers a stipend of ₹400 per month to aid the academic progress and reduce the dropout rate among underprivileged youth. The scheme is implemented by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department. It specifically benefits those enrolled in professional or Government ITI courses and belonging to families with an annual income not exceeding ₹6,00,000/-.
The scheme “Stipends to Students of Economically Backward Class for Technical and Vocational Courses after SSC” by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, supports education for backward class students by providing a monthly stipend for one year.
Benefits: - **Stipend:** A monthly stipend of ₹400/- is given to socially and economically backward class students for one year of recognized professional and Government ITI courses.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should belong to Economically Weaker Section category. 1. The applicant should be a student who has passed the Secondary School Certificate (SSC) examination. 1. The applicant should be enrolled in a recognized professional or Government Industrial Training Institute (ITI) course. 1. The applicant’s individual and family income should not exceed ₹6,00,000/- per annum.

schemeName: Taluka Level Personality Development and Yogasan Training Camp for Scheduled Caste
Details:
The scheme "Taluka Level Personality Development and Yogasan Training Camp for Scheduled Caste" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to facilitate holistic personality development—physical, mental, and spiritual—among Scheduled Caste youth aged between 14 and 35 years by organizing 7-day free training camps. These camps are conducted across all 250 talukas in 41 Scheduled Caste-majority districts of Gujarat and are designed to empower 50 youth participants per taluka through structured personality enhancement and Yogasana sessions.
The scheme "Taluka Level Personality Development and Yogasan Training Camp for Scheduled Caste" aims to provide personality development and Yogasana training to Scheduled Caste youths through free residential training camps held at the taluka level across the state.
Benefits: - **Personality Development:** Participants undergo structured sessions for enhancing communication, confidence, discipline, and overall character. - **Physical Development:** Daily Yogasana training and exercises aimed at physical fitness. - **Mental and Spiritual Development:** Yoga and related practices to foster mental peace and spiritual well-being.
Eligibility: - The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste category. - The applicant should be between 14 and 35 years of age.

schemeName: Sanction of Motorized Three Wheeler to Orthopedically Challenged
Details:
The A.P. Differently Abled & Senior Citizens Assistance Corporation, Andhra Pradesh launched scheme "Sanction of Motorized Three Wheeler to Orthopedically Challenged" under its Action Plan 2017-18, aims to provide Motorized Three Wheelers to orthopedically challenged persons. The Motorized Three Wheelers are distributed by the Assistant Directors, Department for the Welfare of Differently Abled & Senior Citizens, and District Managers, A.P. Differently Abled & Senior Citizens Assistance Corporation.
The "Sanction of Motorized Three Wheeler to Orthopedically Challenged" scheme aims to provide motorized three wheelers to orthopedically challenged persons. This initiative ensures that eligible individuals receive support to enhance their mobility and independence.
Benefits: - Eligible persons with disabilities are provided with a motorized three-wheeler (customized/adapted for their use) to enhance their independence, mobility, and access to education or livelihood opportunities.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should be between 18 to 45 years of age. 1. The applicant should have a disability of 70% or above. 1. The applicant's family annual income should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-. 1. The applicant should be a bonafede student pursuing graduation or higher courses regularly. 1. The applicant should be self-employed (including in agriculture and allied activities) or wage/salary employed for a minimum period of one year, and must have passed at least the 10th class. 1. The applicant should obtain a valid driving licence for driving an adapted vehicle (previously called an invalid carriage) as per the Motor Vehicle Act within two months from the date of selection. 1. The applicant is eligible for sanction only once in a lifetime.

schemeName: Tool Assistance Scheme for Pottery Artisans
Details:
The "Tool Assistance Scheme for Pottery Artisans" by the Gujarat Matikam Kalakari & Rural Technology Institute, Industries and Mines Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial support to individual artisans for procuring essential tools like electric chalk and electric footmill, offering a substantial 75% subsidy on the tool cost. The scheme offers this significant subsidy, requiring a 25% beneficiary contribution, and ensures that assistance is provided solely in the form of instrumental support, rather than cash. The applicant must fulfill specific criteria, including being directly involved in pottery work, belonging to the Prajapati/Kumbhar caste or being another associated artisan, and falling within the prescribed age group of 18 to 50 years. The procurement of Tool under this scheme is managed by the Gujarat Rural Industries Marketing Federation (GRIMCO), and applications are accepted at the office of the institution as per the prescribed format.
The scheme aims to provide essential tools like electric chalk and electric footmill to individual artisans with a 75% subsidy. It benefits pottery workers, particularly those of Prajapati/Kumbhar caste, by offering instrumental assistance and requiring a 25% beneficiary contribution.
Benefits:
- Provision of tools such as an electric chalk and an electric footmill. - 75% subsidy on the cost of the tool. - The instrument assistance is to be used solely for the purpose for which it was given and for the potter's work. - The assistance will be given only in the form of instrumental assistance and not in cash.
_*The beneficiary must submit 25% of their contribution amount to the office of the institution through a demand draft in the name of 'GMK & RTI' of an authorized bank on the day disclosed by the organization._ _*The applicant must use the instrument assistance only for the purpose for which it has been given and for the matter involving the potter's work._ _*If the applicant misuses the assistance, the amount of tool assistance given will be recovered by the revenue organization._ _*During verification by an officer of the institution, if the instrument assistance is found not to have been used for the intended purpose, the amount of the instrument assistance given will be withdrawn._ _*The benefit of resource support will be available to only one person per family._ _*The delivery of the tool must be checked upon receipt, as no complaint of any kind of instrument will be taken into account after delivery._
Eligibility:
- The applicant should be directly involved in the business of the Prajapati/Kumbhar caste. - The applicant should be directly involved in pottery work or pottery. - The applicant will have to give a certificate of competent authority for the purpose of doing pottery along with the application form. - The applicant can be another artisan associated with the pottery business who does pottery, provided they give a certificate of meaning along with the application form. - The applicant's age should be between 18 and 50 years. - The applicant must be the only person in their family applying for the benefit of resource support.
**Post-Selection Conditions** - The applicant shall have to use the instrument assistance for the purpose for which the instrument assistance has been given, only for that purpose and for the matter involving the potter's work. - The applicant must ensure the instrument assistance is used as intended; otherwise, the assistance amount will be withdrawn by the institution.

A copy of the receipt of this payment must be submitted to the organization. **Step 4:** The application form, along with all the complete details and necessary documents, including a copy of the beneficiary contribution receipt, must be sent to the office of the institution - ***Gujarat Matikam Kalakari & Rural Technology Institute, Nr. schemeName: Coir Udyami Yojana
Details:
Coir Udyami Yojana is a credit-linked subsidy scheme for setting up coir units with a project cost up to ₹10,00,000/- plus one cycle of working capital, which shall not exceed 25% of the project cost. Working capital will not be considered for subsidy. Coir Udyami Yojana is a Central Sector Scheme to be administered by the Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises. The Scheme will be implemented by the Coir Board a statutory organization under the Ministry of MSME, as the Nodal Agency at the national level. > **Financial Institutions providing loan under CUY** - All the Scheduled Commercial Banks listed in the 2nd schedule of the RBI Act - All Regional Rural Banks - Co-operative Banks that are Member Lending Institutions (MLIs) of the Credit Guarantee Trust Fund for MSME, as well as through SC/ST/OBC Finance and Development Corporations.
The scheme "Coir Udyami Yojana" by the Coir Board, Ministry of MSME, Government of India, aims to modernize the coir industry and generate rural employment. It offers credit-linked financial assistance to establish coir units by eligible applicants.
Benefits: - **Beneficiary’s contribution (of Project Cost):** 5%- **Bank credit:** 55%- **Rate of Subsidy (of project cost):** 40% > **Note****:** - The maximum admissible cost of the project is ₹10,00,000/- plus working capital. Working capital shall not exceed 25% of the project cost. Subsidy will be computed excluding the working capital component. - The Bank will sanction 95% of the project cost after adjusting 5% beneficiary contribution deposited and disburse the full amount of the project cost, including the beneficiary contribution, in installments for setting up the project.
Eligibility: > **Eligibility conditions of the Beneficiaries:** 1. The applicant must be an individual above 18 years of age with Indian Citizenship. 1. The applicant will not be subject to any income ceiling for receiving assistance under the scheme. 1. The applicant must set up a project related to the production of coir fibre, yarn, or products under the coir sector. 1. The applicant may be an individual, a Company, Self self-help group (SHG), a Non-Governmental Organization (NGO), Institution registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860, a Production Co-operative Society, a Joint Liability Group, or a Charitable Trust. 1. The applicant must not have already availed a government subsidy under any other scheme of the Government of India or the State Government for the same purpose. > **Other eligibility conditions:** 1. The applicant belonging to special categories must produce a certified copy of the caste/community certificate issued by the competent authority. 1. The applicant, if applying as an institution, must submit a certified copy of the bylaws wherever applicable. 1. The applicant must ensure that the project cost includes capital expenditure such as building and machinery. 1. The applicant may include one cycle of working capital in the project proposal, but it will not be considered for subsidy. The loan for working capital will only be sanctioned and released after the unit is set up, and the working capital must not exceed 25% of the total project cost. 1. The applicant, if already owning a work shed, will have the cost of only the required machinery considered as the project cost under the scheme. > **Note :** 1. Special focus on SC/ST and beneficiaries from the North Eastern Region (NER). 1. The scheme encourages women and youth participation in rural areas.

Application Process.process:
1. The applicant must fill out the prescribed application form and attach all required documents.
1. Apply to the nearest Field Office of the Coir Board.
1. Undergo a mandatory 5-day Entrepreneurship Development Programme (EDP) before or after submission, but before bank recommendation.
1. The application is scrutinized and forwarded to the Regional Level Selection Committee.
1. The committee evaluates and forwards approved cases to the bank.
1. On bank approval, the applicant deposits 5% beneficiary contribution within 30 days.
1. Coir Board deposits a subsidy (40%) with the bank.
1. The bank disburses a term loan within 30 days of the subsidy deposit.
1. The project must be completed within 6 months.
1. Coir Board and the bank conduct physical verification before final subsidy adjustment.

Documents Required:
1. Prescribed Application Form for Scheme assistance
1. Copy of the Title Deed of the property on which the unit is proposed to be set up/already located
1. Proof of Coir Industry experience
1. Proof of training availed from the Coir Board
1. Machinery is proposed to be purchased along with the Invoice
1. Industrial Establishment Certificate issued by the District Industries Centre (DIC)
1. Plan & Estimate for the construction of a workshed duly certified by a Chartered Engineer
1. Project Profile of the proposed project
1. In case of SC/ST, a copy of the Caste Certificate
1. Any other supporting documents

schemeName: Swachh Bharat Mission – Grameen PHASE I
Details:
Launched in 2014, the scheme "Swachh Bharat Mission – Grameen (Phase I)" by the Department of Drinking Water and Sanitation, Ministry of Jal Shakti, Government of India, aims to eliminate open defecation in rural India through behavioral change and construction of household and community toilets. Through this scheme, financial assistance and awareness interventions for toilet construction were provided to poor, underprivileged, and marginalized households in rural areas. **Objectives:** 1. To bring about mass-scale behavior change regarding sanitation and hygiene 1. To ensure the construction and usage of household-owned and community-owned toilets 1. To establish an accountable mechanism for achieving ODF (Open Defecation Free) India 1. To promote Solid and Liquid Waste Management (SLWM)
The scheme aims to eliminate open defecation and improve rural sanitation by supporting toilet construction and promoting usage among poor and marginalized rural households.
Benefits: 1. ₹12,000 financial assistance per toilet to rural households for construction. 1. Enhanced rural sanitation coverage through individual and community toilets. 1. Significant reduction in open defecation practices across India. **Activities under the Scheme:** - Construction of Individual Household Latrines (IHHL) - Construction of Community Sanitary Complexes (CSCs) - Solid Liquid Waste Management (SLWM) activities - Information, Education and Communication (IEC) - Human Resource Development (HRD) activities
Eligibility: - The applicant should be from a rural household that lacked a toilet before the scheme. - The applicant should belong to poor, underprivileged, or marginalized sections. > **Note:** Preference given to households led by women, elderly, disabled, or socio-economically weaker sections.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** The applicant contacts the local Gram Panchayat or Swachhagrahi. **Step 2:** Submit the necessary documents listed above. **Step 3:** The toilet is constructed using financial assistance. **Step 4:** The toilet is geo-tagged and verified through the MIS portal. **Step 5:** The incentive amount is credited to the beneficiary’s bank account.

Documents Required: 1. Aadhaar Card 1. Bank Passbook 1. Photograph of Constructed Toilet (for verification and geo-tagging) 1. Any other documents if required

schemeName: Promotion of Organic Farming under State Organic Policy
Details:
The scheme "Promotion of Organic Farming under State Organic Policy" by the Agriculture and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat aims to promote sustainable agricultural practices by encouraging farmers to adopt organic farming methods. The scheme provides financial support for the registration and certification processes conducted by the Gujarat Organic Products Certification Agency (GOPCA) and Agricultural and Processed Food Products Export Development Authority (APEDA)-approved agencies. It also offers input cost assistance per hectare, enabling farmers to reduce chemical usage and enhance soil health.
The scheme "Promotion of Organic Farming under State Organic Policy" by the Agriculture and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to promote organic agriculture by providing financial assistance for certification, transportation, and organic inputs to farmers across the state.
Benefits: - **Organic Farming Registration and Certification Assistance (GOPCA):** The scheme provides 75% at-source assistance in cost to the farmer for registration and certification when undertaken through the Gujarat Organic Products Certification Agency (GOPCA).- **Organic Farming Registration, Certification, and Transportation Assistance (APEDA-approved agencies):** When certification is done through APEDA-approved organic certification agencies, the scheme offers 50% assistance in registration, certification, and transportation fees. The maximum benefit for certification support is limited to ₹2,000/- per hectare.- **Input Assistance for Organic Farming:** Farmers are also eligible for input assistance amounting to ₹5,000/- per hectare to promote organic farming practices.
Eligibility: - The applicant should be a farmer. - The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat. - The applicant should be engaged in organic farming activities.

Application Process.process: > **Registration Process:** **Step 1:** The applicant may visit and apply online at the [I-Khedut](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/) Portal. **Step 2:** Click on &#39;Login&#39; from the top right-hand side, then click on &quot;Beneficiary Registration&quot; and select any one from the &#39;Farmer&#39; or &#39;Institutional&#39; or &#39;Except For the Farmer&#39; as the Beneficiary Type. **Step 3:** Select the District, Taluka, and Village, choose &#39;what type of account holder you are?&#39;, enter your Account Number and Name, solve the Captcha, and click &#39;Save and Next&#39;. **Step 4:** Enter your Mobile Number and Email address, click &#39;Send OTP&#39;, enter the received OTP, create and confirm a Password, solve the Captcha, and click &#39;Submit&#39;. > **Login Process:** **Step 1:** The applicant may visit and apply online at the [I-Khedut](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/site/) Portal. **Step 2:** Click on &#39;Login&#39; from the top right-hand side of the homepage. On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’. **Step 3:** Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button, and an application page will open. **Step 4:** Click on the &quot;Apply New&quot; button and submit a new application. **Step 5:** Click on the &quot;Update Application&quot; button to add corrections to the application. **Step 6:** Once the application is done, confirm it. **Step 7:** Take a printout of the confirmed application. > **Contact Us:** [Click here](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/Public/frm_Public_Contacts.aspx).

schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland): Establishment of New Fresh Water Fin Fish Hatchery - Gujarat
Details:
The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland)" with the component of the Establishment of New Fresh Water Fin Fish Hatchery, introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims provide financial assistance for various inland fisheries activities, establishment of freshwater hatcheries, and support for advanced fish farming methods are provided to individuals, societies, self-help groups, associations, reservoir leaseholders, and private entities involved in inland fisheries activities. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries of the State Governments, with 60% contribution from the Government of India and 40% from the Government of Gujarat.
> **Objective:** - Increase fish production by rearing fish in reservoirs and provide employment to people involved in inland fisheries activities. - Assistance is provided for accelerating inland fish farming activities in freshwater bodies, increasing inland fish production and boosting inland fisheries. - Except for water bodies or ponds, in less land, less water, Biofloc with source as well, Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS). By creating fish tanks with this method, more fish production can be obtained on less land and less water. If more beneficiaries get the benefit of the subsidy of this scheme, more fish production can be achieved with less water sources and less land. - Inland fish production capacity can be increased by the establishment of freshwater hatcheries.
The scheme aims to increase fish production by rearing fish in reservoirs and provide employment to people involved in inland fisheries activities.
Benefits:
For the Establishment of New Fresh Water Fin Fish Hatchery, the unit cost of the project is ₹30,00,000/-. Assistance is provided as follows: 1. **General category:** 40% of the unit cost.1. **Women, Scheduled Caste (SC), and Scheduled Tribe (ST) categories:** 60% of the unit cost.1. **Funding structure:** - 60% contribution from the Government of India. - 40% contribution from the State Government.
> **Frequency of Disbursement:** Once in a lifetime benefit per eligible beneficiary for this specific component.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant must be an individual, society, self-help group, association, reservoir lease holder, or private entity involved in inland fisheries activities. 1. The applicant must be above 18 years of age. 1. The applicant must have their own bank account. 1. The applicant must have their own private land or a minimum 10-year lease agreement for land to avail construction-related assistance on land. In case of co-owners, the consent form of co-owners must be submitted. 1. The applicant must have a Voter ID/Ration Card/Aadhar Card/Passport as proof of identity.
> **Preference/Priority/Reservation/Relaxation:** - All categories (General, Women, Scheduled Caste, and Scheduled Tribe) will receive benefits under the Inland Schemes. - Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries are required to have a Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe certificate to avail benefits under the inland components.

Application Process.process:

And for all select the District, Taluka, and Village, choose 'what type of account holder you are?', enter your Account Number and Name, solve the Captcha, and click 'Save and Next'. **Step 4:** Enter your Mobile Number and E-mail address, click 'Send OTP', enter the received OTP, create and confirm a Password, solve the Captcha, and click 'Submit'.

Lease Agreement (minimum 10 years, if applicable). 1. Consent Form of Co-owners (in case of co-owned land). 1. schemeName: Mukhyamantri Medhavi Vidhyarti Yojana
Details:
The scheme "Mukhyamantri Medhavi Vidyarthi Yojana" by the state government of Madhya Pradesh aims to ensure that the students who have secured 70% or more marks in the 12th examination conducted by the Board of Secondary Education or 85% or more marks in the 12th board examination conducted by CBSE/ICSE and are residents of Madhya Pradesh and their father/guardian's annual income is less than ₹8,00,000/-, the state government will bear the tuition fee of such students under the Mukhyamantri Medhavi Vidyarthi Yojana on getting admission in the following graduate level education courses. Under the scheme, as expenditure fee for graduation level, only the admission fee and the actual fee (excluding mess fee and caution money), which has been determined by the Fee Regulatory Committee or M.P. Private University Regulatory Commission or the Government of India/State Government will be paid.
The scheme aims to cover the tuition fees for meritorious students from Madhya Pradesh admitted to graduate courses. Financial assistance for admission and course fees is provided to eligible students through this scheme.
Benefits: **1. General Coverage:** - Only the admission fee and the actual fee (excluding mess fee and caution money), as determined by the Fee Regulatory Committee or Madhya Pradesh Private University Regulatory Commission or the Government of India/State Government, will be paid as an expenditure fee for graduation level. **2. For Engineering Studies (after securing a rank within 1,50,000 in the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) Mains exam):** - Full fees on admission to a government engineering college. - ₹1,50,000/- on admission to a grant-in-aid/private engineering college, or the actual tuition fee, whichever is less. **3. For Medical Studies (after securing admission through National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET)):** - Tuition fee for admission in the MBBS/BDS course of Central or State Government Medical/Dental College. - Tuition fee for admission in the MBBS course of a private medical college situated in Madhya Pradesh. - Tuition fee for the MBBS course in Government of India institutions, where admission is obtained on the basis of an examination conducted by the institution itself. **4. For Law Studies (after securing admission through the Common Law Admission Test (CLAT) or self-conducted examination):** - Tuition fee for admission in National Law Universities and Delhi University. **5. For Other Graduate and Integrated Postgraduate Programs:** - Tuition fees for admission in graduation programs, integrated post-graduation programs, and dual degree courses (which include a bachelor&#39;s degree along with a master&#39;s degree) run in all universities/institutions of the Government of India. - Tuition fee for admission in all courses run in all government and aided colleges/universities of the state government. - Tuition fee for diploma courses of polytechnic colleges (in which admission is obtained on the basis of the 12th examination).
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Madhya Pradesh. 2. The annual income of the applicant's father/guardian must be less than ₹8,00,000/-. 3. The applicant must have secured 70% or more marks in the 12th examination conducted by the Board of Secondary Education from the academic session 2018-19 onwards. 4. The applicant must have secured 85% or more marks in the 12th examination conducted by the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) or the Indian Certificate of Secondary Education (ICSE). 5. The applicant who obtained the specified marks in the 12th examinations prior to 2016 will also be eligible. 6. **For Engineering Studies:** [**Course List**](https://medhavikalyan.mp.gov.in/MedhaviChhatra/Public/CoursesAndInstitutes.aspx) - The applicant should have obtained a rank within 1,50,000/- in the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) Mains exam. - The applicant should have gained admission to any government or private engineering college on this basis. If an engineering college provides admission based on a separate entrance examination, and the student holds a JEE Mains rank within 1,50,000/-, the applicant is also eligible. 7. **For Medical Studies:** [**Course List**](https://medhavikalyan.mp.gov.in/MedhaviChhatra/Public/CoursesAndInstitutes.aspx) - The applicant should have obtained admission based on the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) into an MBBS/BDS course of a Central or State Government Medical/Dental College. - The applicant should have also obtained admission into an MBBS course of a private medical college situated in Madhya Pradesh. Applicants who have obtained admission to MBBS courses in Government of India institutions based on examinations conducted by the institutions themselves will also be eligible. 8. **For Law Studies:** [**Course List**](https://medhavikalyan.mp.gov.in/MedhaviChhatra/Public/CoursesAndInstitutes.aspx) - The applicant should have obtained admission after the twelfth class to National Law Universities (NLU) and Delhi University through the Common Law Admission Test (CLAT) or through an examination conducted by the university itself. 9. **For Other Graduate and Integrated Postgraduate Programs:** [**Course List**](https://medhavikalyan.mp.gov.in/MedhaviChhatra/Public/CoursesAndInstitutes.aspx) - The applicant should have obtained admission to a Graduation Program, an Integrated Post Graduation Program, or a Dual Degree Course (which includes a Master&#39;s degree along with a Bachelor&#39;s degree) operated in any university/institution of the Government of India. 10. The applicant should have obtained admission to any course operated in all government and grant-in-aid colleges/universities of the state government. 11. The applicant must have obtained admission to diploma courses in polytechnic colleges (where admission is based on the 12th examination).

Application Process.process:
> **Registration Process:** **Step 1:** Visit the [Official Website](https://www.medhavikalyan.mp.gov.in/) of Mukhyamantri Medhavi Vidhyarti Yojana. **Step 2:** Click on the link titled 'Application for MMVY Only' from the options displayed on the home page. **Step 3:** Choose the relevant academic year, "Register for Academic Year 2024-25(Fresh/Renewal)", and click on it. **Step 4:** Click on the ‘[New Applicant](https://www.medhavikalyan.mp.gov.in/MedhaviChhatra/Public/Check_EKYC.aspx)’ button to begin the registration process. **Step 5:** Enter your 9-digit Samagra ID and then click on the ‘Verify’ button. **Step 6:** You will receive a one-time password (OTP) on your registered mobile number. Enter this OTP and submit it for verification. **Step 7:** Fill in all the required personal details and other information in the ‘Registration Form’ and then submit it. **Step 8:** Upon successful registration, you will receive a confirmation message that includes your reference number, user ID, and password.
> **Application Process:** **Step 1:** Visit the official website again and click on the ‘[Login](https://www.medhavikalyan.mp.gov.in/sLogin.aspx)’ tab. **Step 2:** Enter your User ID, Password, and the displayed Captcha code to log in. **Step 3:** Select the desired scheme from the available options and click on the ‘Apply’ button. **Step 4:** Fill in all the required details in the online application form. **Step 5:** Scan and upload all the necessary documents as specified. **Step 6:** Carefully review all the information you have entered to ensure accuracy, and then click on the ‘Submit’ button to complete your application.

Documents Required:
1. Resident certificate of Madhya Pradesh.
1. Marks list of 10th and 12th exam.
1. Income certificate.
1. Aadhaar number.
1. Aadhaar-linked bank account in case of admission in aided/ private universities or colleges.
1. Item-wise fee details and receipt.

schemeName: Kumar Rajratna Bhimrao Ambedkar Medical Assistance Scheme
Details:
The scheme "Kumar Rajratna Bhimrao Ambedkar Medical Assistance Scheme" was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial support to individuals belonging to Scheduled Caste category suffering from incurable and serious diseases. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to Scheduled Caste patients diagnosed with life-threatening conditions such as Tuberculosis (TB), Leukemia, and other critical illnesses.
The scheme aims to provide financial support to individuals belonging to SC category suffering from incurable & serious diseases. Under this scheme, Medical Assistance is provided to Scheduled Caste patients diagnosed with life-threatening conditions such as TB, Leukemia, & other critical illnesses.
Benefits: - Medical Assistance is provided to Scheduled Caste patients for treatment of incurable and critical diseases like TB, Leukemia, and other serious conditions.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should be a permanent resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category. 1. The applicant should be suffering from an incurable or critical disease such as TB or Leukemia, as certified by a civil surgeon. 1. The family income of the applicant should not exceed ₹6,00,000/- per annum.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** The interested applicant should write the application on plain paper. **Step 2:** Attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required) along with the application. **Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application along with the documents to the office of the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat.

Documents Required: 1. Aadhaar Card 1. Bank Details Copy of Hier 1. Birth Certificate 1. Certificate by Civil Surgeon 1. Income Certificate 1. Copy of Election Card 1. Age Proof 1. Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque 1. Caste Certificate 1. Ration Card 1. Copy of Electricity Bill

schemeName: New Swarnim Yojana (for women only) GNTDNT
Details:
The scheme "New Swarnim Yojana (For Women Only)" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to empower women of nomadic and denotified castes living below the poverty line to achieve economic upliftment by getting self-employment with dignity. Under this scheme, women beneficiaries will be able to do business/occupation of their choice. The Gujarat Nomadic and Denotified Tribes Development Corporation implement the scheme.
The scheme aims to achieve economic upliftment by providing self-employment with dignity. Through this scheme, loans for self-employment at an annual interest rate are provided to women beneficiaries of nomadic and denotified castes living below the poverty line.
Benefits:
1. The maximum loan limit is up to ₹2,00,000/-. 1. The interest rate will be 5% per annum. 1. Under this scheme, 100% loan of the business/occupation amount is provided. 1. The loan amount will consist of 95% National Corporation contribution, 5% State Government contribution and zero beneficiary contribution.
> **Repayment:** The loan amount, including interest, will have to be repaid in 60 equal monthly instalments.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant must be a woman from a nomadic or denotified caste. 1. The applicant's family annual income limit for income eligibility will be up to ₹3,00,000/- (with effect from 1/4/2018). 1. The applicant's age should be at least 21 years and not more than 50 years as on the date of application. 1. The applicant must have experience in a technical and skilled trade/business.
> **Preference/Priority/Reservation/Relaxation:** > At least 50% of the total loan amount will be allocated for families having an annual income of up to ₹1,50,000/-.

Application Process.process: > **Step 1: Visit the Official Portal** - Go to the [Official Website](https://gndcdconline.gujarat.gov.in/) Gujarat Nomadic and Denotified Tribes Development Corporation. - Scroll down on the homepage, find the "New Swarnim Yojana" and click on "Apply Now". - You will be directed to the [application form](https://gndcdconline.gujarat.gov.in/SchemeEducation/AddEdit). > **Step 2: Access and Fill Out the Application Form** - Complete all sections under "Applicant information," including full name, father/husband's name, gender, complete address details, contact numbers, Aadhaar No., parents/husband/guardian occupation and income details. Also provide Date of Birth, Age, Caste, and Subspecies. Also, if you are disabled and provide a percentage. - For each applicable qualification (SSC, HSC, Diploma, Degree, Graduation), tick the checkbox and fill in the Degree, Board/University Name, Academic year, and Percentage obtained. - Fill in details about the college/institution admitted to, university affiliation, course name, enrollment number, organisation address, website, course duration (in years and semester), and date of admission. - Specify who accredited the course/institution, their name, and address. Proof of accreditation must be submitted. - Select "Yes" or "No" for "Have you obtained admission through government-mandated admission?". - If staying in a hostel, provide the Hostel name, Hostel address, and Hostel contact number. - Fill in the requested loan amounts for Admission Fee, Tuition Fee, Examination Fee, Hostel Fee, Estimated cost of books/stationery, and Other fees. - List details of any physical assets owned (land, house, government property, NCC, LIC, KVP, etc.). - Indicate if anyone in the family works in a government/private sector job. If "Yes," provide Name, Designation, Place, and Salary details. - Fill in the Bank Account Number, select the Bank Name from the dropdown, provide the Branch Name, Name as per Account, select Bank Account Type (Saving/Current), and enter the MICR Code and IFSC Code. > **Step 3: Review and Final Submission** - Carefully review each module. Use the preview option to examine the application before final submission. Fill out the provided "CAPTCHA" and Click on “Submit”. > **Track and Review Status** - Applicant will receive an Application ID/Reference Number. Save or print the acknowledgement for future tracking. - Go to the [Official Website](https://gndcdconline.gujarat.gov.in/) Gujarat Nomadic and Denotified Tribes Development Corporation. - Scroll down and locate the Know App Status. Click on "Know App Status". - Select the Scheme name, Enter App No., and Birth Date. Fill out the Captcha and click on Submit.

Documents Required: 1. Aadhaar Card. 1. Ration Card. 1. Domicile Certificate. 1. Caste Certificate. 1. Passport-size Photograph. 1. Proof of Technical and Skilled Trade/Business Experience. 1. Collateral Documents. 1. Bank Account Details.

schemeName: Various Awards to Individuals/Organizations who have made Outstanding Contributions in the Field of Social Welfare
Details:
The “Various Awards to Individuals/Organizations who have made Outstanding Contributions in the Field of Social Welfare” scheme was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to recognize and honor the exceptional work carried out by individuals and organizations in the field of social welfare, particularly benefiting the Scheduled Caste (SC) community. Under this scheme, awards along with financial assistance are provided as a mark of appreciation for impactful work done in improving the lives of marginalized communities.
The scheme aims to recognize and honor the exceptional work carried out by individuals and organizations in the field of social welfare, particularly benefiting the Scheduled Caste (SC) community. Under this scheme, awards along with financial assistance are provided as a mark of appreciation.
Benefits: - Under this scheme, individuals and organizations receive various awards in recognition of their exceptional contributions to social welfare.
Eligibility: - The applicant should be either an individual or an organization. - If the applicant is an individual, they should be a resident of Gujarat; if an organization, it should operate within Gujarat. - The applicant should have made outstanding contributions in the field of social welfare. - The contributions should specifically benefit or directly impact the Scheduled Caste (SC) community in Gujarat.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) office of the Social Justice and Empowerment Department and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. **Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). **Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the office of the Social Justice and Empowerment Department.

Documents Required: 1. Identity proof 1. Caste Certificate 1. Proof of Residence 1. Detailed Report of Work/Contribution 1. Bank Details 1. Any other document if required

schemeName: Small Business (GBCDC)
Details:
The scheme "Small Business (GBCDC)" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide financial assistance to the Socially and Educationally Backward Classes (SEBC) for undertaking small businesses like grocery store, dairy parlour, animal fodder sales centre, mobile-computer repairing shop, etc., for casual business. Through this scheme, a loan amount is provided at a low interest rate to promote self-employment among SEBC individuals across the state. The scheme is implemented by the Gujarat Backward Classes Development Corporation (GBCDC). Beneficiaries can apply online without any application fee through the official GBCDC portal.
The scheme aims to provide financial assistance at a low interest rate to SEBC individuals for small business ventures.
Benefits: 1. Financial assistance in the form of a loan up to ₹2,00,000/-. 1. The loan can be utilised for starting small businesses such as grocery stores, dairy parlours, animal fodder sales centres, mobile and computer repairing shops, etc.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant should belong to a socially and educationally backward class. 1. The applicant's total annual individual/family income should not exceed ₹3,00,000/-. 1. The applicant should be a resident of Gujarat.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** Visit the [official website](https://gbcdconline.gujarat.gov.in/) of the Gujarat Backwards Caste Development Corporation. **Step 2:** On the top menu bar, click on "Apply Online". **Step 3:** If you’re a new user, click on "New Registration" Enter personal details (name, mobile number, email, aadhaar number, etc.), create a password, and complete OTP verification. **Step 4:** Use your registered credentials (User ID and password) to log in. **Step 5:** Click on “New Application”. Select “Small Business Scheme” from the list of available schemes. **Step 6:** Fill out the Application Form, enter the following details: - Personal Information: Name, gender, date of birth, caste, etc. - Address Information: Permanent and correspondence address - Income Details: Monthly family income and source - Loan Requirement: Amount needed, proposed use (e.g., business, self-employment) - Bank Account Details: For loan disbursement **Step 7:** Upload scanned copies of the Caste certificate, Income certificate, Aadhaar card, Passport-size photo, Bank passbook (first page), and Residence proof. **Step 8:** Double-check all details. Click on “Preview” to verify. If all details are correct, click “Submit”. **Step 9:** Applicant will receive an Application ID/Reference Number. Save or print the acknowledgement for future tracking.

Documents Required: 1. Aadhar Card 1. Age Proof 1. Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque 1. Birth Certificate 1. Business Address Proof 1. Caste Certificate 1. Income Certificate 1. Passport Size Photos 1. Ration Card 1. School Leaving 1. True Copy of Election Card

schemeName: Financial Assistance to Helpless Artists
Details:
The “Financial Assistance to Helpless Artists” scheme was launched by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide financial security to artists who are aged, physically disabled, and living in extreme poverty. Under this scheme, monthly financial assistance is provided to artists and their dependents who are physically disabled, above 60 years of age, have a monthly income of less than ₹600, and are unable to sustain themselves due to age or disability.
Under this scheme, monthly financial assistance is given to artists and their dependents who are physically disabled, over 60 years old, have a monthly income of less than ₹600, and are unable to sustain themselves due to age or disability.
Benefits: Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to artists to help them sustain themselves in old age or in case of disability.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must be an artist who has made significant contributions in the field of art and literature. 1. The applicant must be 60 years of age or above. 1. The applicant must have a monthly income of less than ₹600/- (₹7,200/- annually). 1. The applicant must be physically disabled. 1. The applicant must be in poor economic condition.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** The interested applicant should write the application on plain paper. **Step 2:** Attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required) along with the application. **Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application along with the documents to the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department.

Documents Required: 1. Aadhaar Card 1. Birth Certificate 1. Income Certificate 1. Ration Card 1. Age Proof 1. Identity Card 1. Passport Size Photo

schemeName: Artist Honor (Gaurav Award)
Details:
The “Artist Honor (Gaurav Award)” scheme is implemented by the Gujarat State Lalit Kala Academy under the Sports, Youth and Culture Activities Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to recognize and honor artists who have made a lifetime contribution in the field of fine arts, specifically in painting, sculpture, and graphic arts, and have achieved outstanding accomplishments. Every year, a total of nine (9) artists are honored under this scheme, three in painting, three in sculpture, and three in graphic arts with the Gaurav Award. This award has been conferred annually since 1964-65.
The scheme aims to recognize and honor artists who have made a lifetime contribution in the field of fine arts, specifically in painting, sculpture, and graphic arts, and have achieved outstanding accomplishments.
Benefits: **Award Details:** - Cash prize of ₹51,000/- per artist. - Copper plate, citation, and shawl presented during the award ceremony. - Exhibition of artworks held for 5–7 days at Ravishankar Raval Kala Bhavan, Ahmedabad. - Catalogue publication of Gaurav Award-winning artists and their art. **Number of Awards:** - Total of 9 artists are honored every year. - 3 in painting, 3 in sculpture, and 3 in graphic arts.
Eligibility: 1. The artist must be a resident of the State of Gujarat. 1. The artist must be associated with the field of fine arts, specifically in Painting, Sculpture or Graphic Arts. 1. The artist must have made a lifetime contribution in their respective field. 1. The artist should have achieved outstanding accomplishments or the highest level of recognition in their art form. 1. The applicant must be active in the art community and have a recognized body of work.

Application Process.process: > **Application Process: Applications are invited annually through public advertisements (daily newspapers).** **Step 1:** The interested applicant should visit (during office hours) the Gujarat State Lalit Kala Academy and request a hard copy of the prescribed format of the application form from the staff exclusively entrusted to issue and collect filled-in applications. **Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attested, if required). **Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to the Gujarat State Lalit Kala Academy. > **Post-Application Process:** **Step 1:** A committee reviews and shortlists applicants based on merit. **Step 2:** The final selected artists are notified and invited to the award ceremony. **Step 3:** Awards are distributed along with the art exhibition and catalogue release.

Documents Required: 1. Proof of identity 1. Proof of residence 1. Portfolio of artworks 1. Passport Size Photograph 1. Any Other Document if Required

schemeName: PMMSY: Construction of New Rearing ponds - Haryana
Details:
The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matasya Sampada Yojana: Construction of New Rearing Ponds (nursery/seed rearing ponds)" by the Ministry Of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of India, aims to expand fisheries in various urban/semi-urban areas only under the construction of new ponds. Through this scheme, central assistance and subsidy are provided for the construction of new rearing units and initial crop costs in newly constructed ponds.
The scheme aims to expand fisheries in various urban/semi-urban areas. Through this scheme, financial assistance and subsidies are provided for the construction of new rearing ponds.
Benefits: - Provides financial assistance for the construction of New Rearing Ponds (nursery/seed rearing ponds). - The project cost of ₹ 7,00,000/- per Hectare is provided. - The subsidy will be limited to 40% of the project cost for the General Category and 60% of the project cost for SC/Women beneficiaries.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant must have a Parivar Pehchan Patra (PPP).
1. The construction of new rearing ponds subsidy will be provided by the State Government for the expansion of fisheries in various urban/semi-urban areas, only under the construction of new ponds under the PMMSY scheme.
1. The applicant shall be provided with central assistance for the Construction of New Rearing unit costs for the initial crop only in the newly constructed ponds.
1. The projects having land on long-term registered lease shall also be considered for Central financial assistance under the scheme. However, the lease period/agreement shall not be less than a minimum period of 7 (seven) years.
1. The applicant, having their land, must furnish revenue records with a clear land title.

schemeName: Maintenance Grant for Children with Disabilities from Birth
Details:
The scheme “Maintenance Grant for Children with Disabilities from Birth” is implemented by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Uttarakhand. It aims to provide financial assistance to parents or guardians for caring for their children below 18 years of age with more than 40% disability.
The scheme aims to provide financial assistance of ₹700/- per month to parents or guardians for the care of children below 18 years of age with more than 40% disability.
Benefits: ₹700/- per month is provided to parents or guardians for caring for their children.
Eligibility: - The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. - The applicant must be the parent or guardian of a child with more than 40% disability. - The child must be below 18 years of age. - The family’s monthly income must be less than ₹4,000/- or the family must belong to the Below Poverty Line (BPL) category.

Application Process.process: - The applicant can apply online either by themselves or through a Common Service Center (CSC) via the Department’s Pension Portal ([https://ssp.uk.gov.in](https://ssp.uk.gov.in)), the [UMANG](https://web.umang.gov.in/) Mobile App, or the Apuni Sarkar Portal ([https://eservices.uk.gov.in](https://eservices.uk.gov.in)). - The following documents are mandatory at the time of applying: Applicant’s mobile number, Passport-size photograph (attested by Gram Pradhan / V.P.D.O. / certified by Councillor), Photocopy of Aadhaar card and Voter ID card, CBS bank account details (linked/seeded with Aadhaar), Valid family income certificate or BPL certificate, Certificate of disability of more than 40%, child&#39;s birth certificate, Copy of family register (for rural areas only), Copy of the resolution passed in the open meeting of Gram Panchayat (for rural areas) / certified by Councillor (for urban areas) - All the above documents must be issued from the district where the application is being submitted. - For verification of the online application form in rural areas, the final decision is taken by the District Social Welfare Officer after recommendations from the Gram Panchayat Development Officer, Assistant Social Welfare Officer, and Block Development Officer, respectively. In urban areas, verification and recommendation are done by the Assistant Social Welfare Officer and Sub-District Magistrate. If the application is found correct, the District Social Welfare Officer approves it, after which the pension payment process is initiated. - But along with the above documents, a certificate of disability of more than 40% and a UID certificate from the Chief Medical Officer will also have to be given. - The pension amount will be credited to the parent&#39;s bank account within one month after the application is approved.
