schemeName: Mukhyamantri Nidan Yojana
Details:
Launched in 2015-16, the scheme "Mukhyamantri Nidan Yojana" (also known as "Free Laboratory Testing Scheme") by the Health and Family Welfare Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide quality diagnostic facilities without charge at all government health institutions and ensure timely and accurate diagnosis of diseases like malaria, tuberculosis, cancer, diabetes, hypertension to reduce morbidity and mortality in communities. The scheme provides free essential pathology, biochemistry, hematology, microbiology testing services at all government health institutions and strengthens existing laboratory facilities with quality equipment and trained staff along with regular supply of reagent kits. The applicant must be seeking healthcare services at government health facilities and require diagnostic testing for medical conditions. The scheme is implemented through a three-tier healthcare structure consisting of Sub Health Centers, Primary Health Centers, Community Health Centers, Sub-District Hospitals, District Hospitals and Medical Colleges with a total budget allocation of ₹200.94 crores, and applications are accepted offline at respective government healthcare facilities.
The scheme aims to provide free quality diagnostic facilities at all government health institutions in Gujarat. It benefits rural population by offering essential laboratory tests, X-ray, sonography services without charge at nearby government healthcare centers.
Benefits: > **Primary Benefits** - Free Laboratory Testing Services: All essential pathology, biochemistry, hematology, and microbiology tests provided without any charge. - Diagnostic Facilities: X-ray, sonography, and Electrocardiography services at Community Health Centers - Comprehensive Healthcare Coverage: Testing for communicable and non-communicable diseases, maternal and child health conditions. > **Service Delivery** - Timely Diagnosis: Early detection of diseases like malaria, tuberculosis, cancer, diabetes, hypertension. - Quality Equipment: Modern diagnostic equipment and trained laboratory technicians. - Regular Supply: Continuous availability of reagent kits and testing materials. - Accessibility: Services available at doorstep through Sub Health Centers, Primary Health Centers, Community Health Centers, Sub-District Hospitals, District Hospitals, and Medical College hospitals. > **Implementation Structure** - Total Budget: ₹200.94 crores allocated for the scheme. - Two-Phase Implementation: First phase focuses on strengthening existing facilities, second phase adds new equipment and services. - Coordination System: Multi-tier coordination cells from state to facility level for effective implementation. > **Conditions for Availment** - Services available only at government healthcare institutions. - Testing must be prescribed by qualified medical officers. - Regular maintenance and quality checks of equipment ensured through designated coordination cells.
Eligibility: - The applicant must be seeking healthcare services at any government health facility in Gujarat. - The applicant must require diagnostic testing as prescribed by a qualified medical officer. - The applicant must visit designated government healthcare institutions including Sub Health Centers, Primary Health Centers, Community Health Centers, Sub-District Hospitals, District Hospitals, or Medical College hospitals.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** _Visit Government Healthcare Facility_ Visit the nearest government healthcare facility (Sub Health Center, Primary Health Center, Community Health Center, Sub-District Hospital, District Hospital, or Medical College hospital) during working hours with all required documents. **Step 2:** _Medical Consultation_ Consult with the qualified medical officer or doctor available at the facility who will assess your medical condition and determine the necessary diagnostic tests required for proper diagnosis and treatment. **Step 3:** _Prescription Receipt_ Obtain a written prescription from the medical officer specifying the required laboratory tests, X-ray, sonography, or Electrocardiography services needed for your medical condition. **Step 4:** _Laboratory Registration_ Proceed to the laboratory or diagnostic section of the healthcare facility with your prescription and identity documents, where the laboratory technician will register your case and assign a unique identification number. **Step 5:** _Sample Collection and Testing_ Undergo the prescribed diagnostic procedures including sample collection for laboratory tests, X-ray imaging, sonography, or Electrocardiography as per the medical officer's prescription under the supervision of trained technical staff. **Step 6:** _Report Collection_ Collect your diagnostic test reports from the laboratory or diagnostic section as per the timeline specified by the facility, which may vary depending on the type of tests conducted. **Step 7:** _Follow-up Consultation_ Return to the medical officer with your test reports for interpretation of results, further medical advice, and continuation of treatment as necessary for your healthcare needs.

Documents Required: - **Medical Prescription:** From qualified government medical officer (original)- **Patient Identity Proof:** Any government-issued identity document (original and photocopy)- **Medical History Records:** Previous medical reports if available (original) _*Specific document requirements may vary based on the type of diagnostic test prescribed and the healthcare facility's protocols._

schemeName: Vahan Aksmat Sahay Scheme
Details:
Launched in 2020, the scheme "Vahan Aksmat Sahay Scheme" by the Health and Family Welfare Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to provide immediate medical assistance and financial support to victims of road traffic accidents to ensure timely treatment and reduce mortality rates. The scheme provides medical treatment packages ranging from ₹1,000/- to ₹45,000/- for various types of injuries and covers emergency medical procedures, surgeries, and hospitalization for accident victims. The applicant must be a victim of road traffic accident requiring immediate medical treatment and the treatment must be provided at empanelled hospitals under the scheme. The scheme is implemented by Health and Family Welfare Department, Government of Gujarat and applications are accepted through participating hospitals where treatment is provided.
The scheme aims to provide immediate medical assistance and financial support to road traffic accident victims. It offers comprehensive medical treatment packages for various injury types with cashless treatment at empanelled hospitals.
Benefits:
**Medical Treatment Packages** Comprehensive treatment packages ranging from ₹1,000/- to ₹45,000/- covering various types of injuries:
**Package-wise Benefits** - Simple Injury-I (Package 1): ₹1,000/- for treating simple wounds, injection Tetanus Vaccination, analgesic, antibiotics, general conditions check, cleaning, suturing and dressing - Simple Injury-II (Package 2): ₹2,500/- including face and scalp wounds, change of soiled cloth with disposable dress, intravenous line, multiple lacerated wounds suturing - Deglove Injury of Extremities (Package 3): ₹12,000/- for wound debridement in operation theatre under anaesthesia, intravenous line, intravenous antibiotics, remaining wounds suturing and inpatient treatment - Simple Fracture Without Anaesthesia (Package 4): ₹1,500/- for closed reduction, cleaning, suturing, dressing of wounds, fracture stabilization with splint - Closed Fracture Reduction Under Anaesthesia for First Fracture (Package 5): ₹4,000/- including closed fracture reduction under short general anaesthesia with plastering and inpatient treatment - Closed Fracture Reduction Under Anaesthesia for Additional Fracture (Package 6): ₹5,500/- for additional fractures with similar treatment as Package 5 - Dislocation Reduction Under Anaesthesia (Package 7): ₹8,000/- for joint dislocation reduction under general anaesthesia and inpatient treatment - Open Reduction Internal Fixation-Small Bone (Package 8): ₹17,250/- including internal/external fixation of fracture in compound fractures, flap cover and inpatient treatment - Open Reduction Internal Fixation-Large Bone (Package 9): ₹40,250/- for large bone fractures with similar treatment as Package 8 - Inter Costal Drainage One Side (Package 10): ₹8,000/- including intercostal drainage and inpatient treatment - Inter Costal Drainage Bilateral (Package 11): ₹11,000/- for bilateral intercostal drainage with inpatient treatment - **Mode of Disbursement** Cashless Treatment: Treatment provided at empanelled hospitals without upfront payment.
Eligibility: - The applicant must be a victim of road traffic accident. - The applicant must require immediate medical treatment for injuries sustained in the accident. - The applicant must receive treatment at hospitals empanelled under the Vahan Aksmat Sahay Scheme. - The applicant must have Medico Legal Case registered for the accident. - The applicant must have police intimation with acknowledgment for the road traffic accident.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** _Emergency Treatment at Empanelled Hospital_ In case of a road traffic accident, the victim should be immediately taken to the nearest empanelled hospital under the Vahan Aksmat Sahay Scheme for emergency medical treatment. The hospital will provide immediate medical care as per the severity of injuries. **Step 2:** _Medico Legal Case Registration_ The hospital authorities will ensure that a Medico Legal Case is registered with the local police station as it is mandatory for all road traffic accident cases. The hospital will coordinate with the police for proper documentation of the accident and injuries. **Step 3:** _Treatment Package Assessment_ The treating doctor will assess the nature and severity of injuries and determine the appropriate treatment package from the 27 available packages under the scheme. The treatment will be provided as per the standardized protocols defined for each package. **Step 4:** _Documentation Collection_ The hospital staff will collect all required documents including Medico Legal Case register details, police intimation copy, pre and post-treatment photographs, medical records, investigation reports, and hospital bills as specified for the respective treatment package. **Step 5:** _Cashless Treatment Provision_ The empanelled hospital will provide cashless treatment to the accident victim as per the approved package amount. No upfront payment is required from the patient or family members for the covered treatment under the scheme. **Step 6:** _Claim Processing and Settlement_ The hospital will submit the claim along with all required documents to the scheme authorities for processing and settlement. The payment will be directly settled between the government and the empanelled hospital. **Step 7:** _Discharge and Follow-up Care_ Upon completion of treatment, the patient will be discharged with proper discharge summary and follow-up instructions. Patients are advised to retain copies of all medical records and treatment documents for future reference and any follow-up care requirements.

Documents Required: **At Time of Treatment** - Scanned Copy of Medico Legal Case Register Showing the Details of Injury - Police Intimation Copy with Police Acknowledgment - Two Photos Showing the Wound Before and After Treatment with Patient Face Clearly Along with the Treating Doctor (Includes Patient Photo for Identity) - Out-Patient Record/Case Sheet Details Showing the Treatment Given (Including Operation Theatre Notes If Any) - Investigation Done Report - Hospital Bill **Package-Specific Additional Documents** - For Fracture Cases: X-Rays To Rule Out Fracture, X-Ray Showing the Fracture Before and After Stabilization - For Chest Injuries: Chest X-Ray Before and After Intercostal Drainage - For Abdominal Injuries: Blood Investigation, Chest X-Ray and X-Ray of Erect Abdomen, Ultrasound, Computed Tomography Scan Report (If Required), Electrocardiogram with Report (If Required) - For Spine Injuries: X-Ray Spine Anterior Posterior/Lateral, Computed Tomography/Magnetic Resonance Imaging - For Head Injuries: Computed Tomography Scan Report, Other Relevant Investigations

schemeName: Farmer Pension Scheme
Details:
The "Farmer Pension Scheme" was launched by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide financial support to elderly farmers residing in the state of Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, a monthly pension is provided to farmers who are above 60 years of age, own up to 2 hectares of land, and cultivate their own land.
The scheme aims to provide financial support to elderly farmers residing in the state of Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, a monthly pension of ₹1200/- is provided to farmers who are above 60 years of age, own up to 2 hectares of land, and cultivate their own land.
Benefits: A pension of ₹1,200/- per month is provided to eligible farmers.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be a farmer actively engaged in cultivating their own land. 1. The applicant must be above 60 years of age. 1. The applicant must own and cultivate up to 2 hectares of agricultural land.

Application Process.process: The applicant can apply online either by themselves or through a Common Service Center (CSC) via the Department’s Pension Portal ([https://ssp.uk.gov.in](https://ssp.uk.gov.in)), the [UMANG](https://web.umang.gov.in) Mobile App, or the Apuni Sarkar Portal ([https://eservices.uk.gov.in](https://eservices.uk.gov.in)). **The following documents are mandatory at the time of applying:** Applicant’s mobile number, Passport-size photograph (attested by Gram Pradhan / V.P.D.O. / certified by Councillor), Photocopy of Aadhaar card and Voter ID card, An attested copy of the Khatauni (land records), Permanent Residence Certificate, A ₹10/- stamp paper affidavit declaring that the applicant cultivates their own land and owns up to 2 hectares of land, or less than 2 hectares, along with the relevant land documents, CBS bank account details (linked/seeded with Aadhaar), Copy of family register (for rural areas only), Copy of the resolution passed in the open meeting of Gram Panchayat (for rural areas) / certified by Councillor (for urban areas) **The land ownership certificate is issued by the Revenue Officer/Assistant Agriculture Officer, who certifies it in the prescribed form/letter. There is no requirement for an income certificate.** **All the above documents must be issued from the district where the application is being submitted.** > For verification of the online application form in rural areas, the final decision is taken by the District Social Welfare Officer after recommendations from the Gram Panchayat Development Officer, Assistant Social Welfare Officer, and Block Development Officer, respectively. In urban areas, verification and recommendation are done by the Assistant Social Welfare Officer and Sub-District Magistrate. If the application is found correct, the District Social Welfare Officer approves it, after which the pension payment process is initiated. **The pension is credited to the applicant’s bank account one month after the approval of the application.**

Documents Required: 1. Applicant’s mobile number 1. Passport-size photograph (certified by Gram Pradhan / V.P.D.O. / Councillor) 1. Aadhaar card 1. Voter ID card 1. CBS bank account linked/seeded with Aadhaar card 1. An attested copy of the Khatauni (land records) 1. Permanent Residence Certificate 1. A ₹10/- stamp paper affidavit declaring that the applicant cultivates their own land and owns up to 2 hectares of land, or less than 2 hectares, along with the relevant land documents 1. Copy of family register (only for rural areas) **Note 1:** All the above documents must be issued from the district where the application is submitted. **Note 2:** The land ownership certificate is issued by the Revenue Officer/Assistant Agriculture Officer, who certifies it in the prescribed form/letter.

schemeName: Combined Merit Scholarship
Details:
The scheme "Combined Merit Scholarship" by the Higher Education Department, Government of Assam, aims to provide financial assistance to students of Assam studying in first semester degree courses and master's degree courses in any recognized colleges or universities in the state and other states of the country, focusing on students with uniformly good academic records and at least 60% marks in last qualifying examinations. The scheme provides access to poor students of the state and helps them achieve the benefits of higher education through merit-based scholarship support for undergraduate and postgraduate studies. The applicant must be selected and admitted in degree or master's degree courses in any recognized universities or colleges and must be domiciled in Assam. The scheme is implemented by Higher Education Department. The applications for this scheme are accepted online.
The scheme aims to provide merit-based scholarship to students of Assam studying in first semester degree and master degree courses in recognized institutions. It benefits academically meritorious students who have obtained at least 60% marks in their last qualifying examination.
Benefits: > **Financial Assistance** - For Degree Courses: ₹300/- per month. - For Master Degree Courses: ₹500/- per month. - The scheme provides 200 scholarships for degree students (three years duration) and 100 scholarships for master degree students (two years duration). **Selection:** Based on merit and budget allocation. **Coverage:** Students pursuing general degree and master degree courses in Arts, Science, and Commerce disciplines. > **Mode of Disbursement** **Mode:** Direct Benefit Transfer system. **Conditions:** Subject to selection by the selection committee and financial sanction approval. > **Conditions for Availment** - The applicant must maintain enrollment in the respective degree or master's degree course throughout the scholarship period. - Academic performance standards must be maintained as per institutional and scheme requirements. - Regular attendance and compliance with all institutional rules and regulations. - Bank account must remain active and updated for Direct Benefit Transfer disbursement.
Eligibility: - The applicant must be pursuing general degree or master's degree courses in Arts, Science, or Commerce discipline in any recognized institution. - The applicant must be domiciled in Assam (Permanent Resident Certificate document mandatory). - The applicant must have obtained minimum 60% marks in Higher Secondary examination for those applying for Combined Merit Degree Scholarship scheme. - The applicant must have obtained minimum 60% marks in General Degree (Three Year Degree Course) examination for those applying for Combined Merit Master Degree Scholarship scheme. - The applicant must possess relevant qualification from any recognized institution. - The applicant must have a valid bank account in their name (preferably in State Bank of India).

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** _Online Application Submission_ Visit the official website of the [Directorate of Higher Education, Government of Assam](https://directorateofhighereducation.assam.gov.in/portlets/scholarships), and complete the online application form within the specified application period with all required personal, academic, and bank account details. **Step 2:** _Document Upload and Verification_ Upload scanned copies of all required documents including Permanent Resident Certificate, mark sheets, institutional certificate, photograph, and signature as per the prescribed format and specifications. **Step 3:** _Application Form Printout_ After successful online submission, take a printout of the completed application form and ensure all information is accurate and complete before proceeding to the next step. **Step 4:** _Physical Submission to Institution_ Submit the printed application form along with necessary copies of certificates and testimonials to the Registrar, Principal, or Head of the Institution where currently enrolled for verification and forwarding. **Step 5:** _Institutional Verification and Forwarding_ The Registrar, Principal, or Head of the Institution will collect, verify, and submit the hard copies of online forms along with all relevant certificates and testimonials under their seal and signature to the Directorate of Higher Education, Assam, Kahilipara, Guwahati - 781019. **Step 6:** _Selection Process_ The selection committee will evaluate applications strictly on the basis of merit in all cases and selection will be restricted as per budget allocation for the respective categories. **Step 7:** _Benefit Disbursement_ Selected beneficiaries will receive scholarship amounts through Direct Benefit Transfer system directly to their registered bank accounts on a monthly basis. _*Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment received for future reference and correspondence with the implementing authorities._

Documents Required: > **At Application Stage** - Permanent Resident Certificate from District Collector or Sub Divisional Officer as Proof of Domicile of State of Assam (scanned copy) - Certificate from the Registrar or Head of the Institution in which the candidate is at present studying (scanned copy) - Final Mark Sheet of Last Qualifying Examinations (Higher Secondary for degree applicants or Three Year Degree Course for master degree applicants) (scanned copy) - Recent Photograph (scanned copy) - Signature of the Applicant (scanned copy) - Valid Bank Account Details (Bank Name, Account Number, Branch Name, Indian Financial System Code) > **At Document Submission Stage** - Hard copies of online application form along with all relevant certificates and testimonials - All documents to be submitted under seal and signature of Registrar, Principal, or Head of the Institution to Directorate of Higher Education, Assam

schemeName: Grant for Purchase and Repair of Various Assistive Devices/Equipment for Persons with Disabilities
Details:
The scheme “Grant for Purchase and Repair of Various Assistive Devices/Equipment for Persons with Disabilities” is implemented by the Social Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to enhance the mobility and functional independence of persons with disabilities by providing financial assistance for the purchase and repair of essential assistive devices. Under this scheme, a grant of up to ₹3,500 (maximum ₹7,000 in special cases) is provided for the purchase of individual aids and ₹500 for the repair of prosthetic limbs and assistive equipment.
Under this scheme, a grant of up to ₹3,500 is provided for the purchase of individual aids, which may be increased to a maximum of ₹7,000 in special cases. Additionally, ₹500 is provided for the repair of prosthetic limbs and other assistive equipment.
Benefits:
> **Grant Amount:**


- ₹50 to ₹3,500 for the purchase of assistive devices (maximum ₹7,000 in special cases).
- ₹500 for repair of artificial limbs and assistive equipment.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should be a resident of Uttarakhand.
1. The applicant should be a person with a disability.
1. The applicant should have a minimum disability of 40%.
1. In the case of a minor beneficiary, the monthly income of parents/guardians should not exceed ₹4,000/-.
1. The applicant should have a medical recommendation from a Government Medical Officer or specialist recommending the device or its repair.

Application Process.process: The medical officer must recommend the applicant for fitting with a prosthetic limb or hearing aid. The applicants should complete the application form himself/herself and submit it to the concerned Assistant Social Welfare Officer. The District Social Welfare Officer’s office will process the application as per the prescribed rules. Thereafter, payment will be made to the beneficiary through the treasury.

Documents Required:
1. Identity proof
1. Disability Certificate
1. Recommendation Letter (from a government doctor for the device or repair)
1. Any Other Document if Required

schemeName: Post-Matric Scholarship for Backward Classes- Uttarakhand
Details:
The scheme "Pre-Matric Scholarship for Backward Classes- Uttarakhand" by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Uttarakhand, aims to provide financial assistance to students belonging to the Backward Classes category in Uttarakhand for pursuing education after Class 10th.
The scheme "Post-Matric Scholarship for Backward Classes- Uttarakhand" by the Department of Social Welfare, Government of Uttarakhand, has been introduced to support students from the Backward Classes category to continue their education after Class 10th.
Benefits: - **For Hostellers:** ₹750/- per month.- **For Day Scholars:** ₹350/- per month.
Eligibility: - The applicant should belong to the Backward Classes category. - The applicant should be a permanent resident of Uttarakhand. - The applicant must have passed Class 10th. - The applicant must be pursuing any course after passing Class 10th. - The applicant’s parental annual income must not exceed ₹2,50,000/-. - The applicant should not be availing benefits from any other government scholarship scheme for the same purpose.

Application Process.process: - Students can apply online for scholarship by visiting the NSP Portal of Government of India ([https://scholarships.gov.in/](https://scholarships.gov.in/)). - The following documents will be attached with the application: Aadhaar card of the applicant, caste certificate, mobile number, certified photo and CBS bank account which is Aadhaar linked/seeded, previous class passed mark sheet, self-declaration certificate that the applicant is not taking benefit of any other scholarship scheme of the government. - The student sends the application to his educational institution with his own ID; the concerned educational institution forwards the received online application form online to the District Social Welfare Officer. - The District Social Welfare Officer examines the received application form and gets the complete application forms physically verified. Incomplete application forms, which can be corrected, are temporarily defected and those which cannot be corrected are permanently rejected. The amount is sent directly to the account of the eligible applicants as per the availability of budget.

Documents Required: 1. Aadhaar Card. 1. Caste Certificate. 1. Mobile Number. 1. Passport Size Photograph (Attested). 1. Bank Account Details (Should be linked/ seeded with Aadhaar). 1. Previous Class Marksheet. 1. Self-Declaration (Stating the applicant is not availing benefits from any other government scholarship scheme). 1. Income Certificate (Showing annual income up to ₹2,50,000/-).

schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland): Establishment of Small RAS Culture System Gujarat
Details:
The scheme "Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana (PMMSY-Inland) with the component of Establishment of Small RAS (with 1 tank of minimum 100m3/tank capacity 10t/crop) culture system" by the Department of Fisheries, Government of India, aims to increase inland fish production by promoting fish rearing in reservoirs and providing employment to individuals involved in inland fisheries activities. Through this scheme, financial assistance is provided for setting up Small Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS) units, enabling higher fish yield using minimal land and water resources. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries of the State Governments, with 60% contribution from the Government of India and 40% from the Government of Gujarat.
> **Objective:** - Assistance is provided for accelerating inland fish farming activities in freshwater bodies, increasing inland fish production and boosting inland fisheries. - Except for water bodies or ponds, in less land, less water, Biofloc with source as well, Recirculating Aquaculture System (RAS). By creating fish tanks with this method, more fish production can be obtained in less land and less water. If more beneficiaries get the benefit of the subsidy of this scheme, more fish production can be achieved with less water sources and less land. - Inland fish production capacity can be increased by the establishment of freshwater hatcheries.
The scheme aims to boost inland fish production and create employment. It provides financial support for setting up Small RAS units for eligible beneficiaries.
Benefits:
Beneficiaries can receive assistance for the Establishment of Small RAS (with 1 tank of a minimum 100m3/tank capacity 10t/crop) culture system. 1. For the general category, the standard of assistance will be 40% of the unit cost ₹7,50,000/unit or 40% of the actual cost, whichever is less. 1. For women, Scheduled Caste (SC), and Scheduled Tribe (ST) categories, the standard of assistance will be 60% of the unit cost or 40% of the actual cost, whichever is less.
> **Mode of Disbursement:** Assistance is paid through 60% contribution from the Government of India and 40% contribution from State Governments. > **Validity:** The benefit can be reclaimed once in a lifetime.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant must be an individual, society, self-help group, association, reservoir lease holder, or private entity involved in inland fisheries activities. 1. The applicant must be above 18 years of age. 1. The applicant must have their own bank account. 1. The applicant must have their own private land or a minimum 10-year lease agreement for land to avail construction-related assistance on land. In case of co-owners, the consent form of co-owners must be submitted. 1. The applicant must have a Voter ID/Ration Card/Aadhar Card/Passport as proof of identity.
> **Preference/Priority/Reservation/Relaxation:** - All categories (General, Women, Scheduled Caste, and Scheduled Tribe) will receive benefits under the Inland Schemes. - Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries are required to have a Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe certificate to avail benefits under the inland components.

And for all select the District, Taluka, and Village, choose 'what type of account holder you are?', enter your Account Number and Name, solve the Captcha, and click 'Save and Next'. **Step 4:** Enter your Mobile Number and E-mail address, click 'Send OTP', enter the received OTP, create and confirm a Password, solve the Captcha, and click 'Submit'. > **Login Process:** **Step 1:** The applicant may visit and apply online at the [I-Khedut Portal](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/). **Step 2:** Click on 'Login' from the top right-hand side of the homepage. On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’. **Step 3:** Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button, and an application page will open. **Step 4:** Click on the "Apply New" button and submit a new application. **Step 5:** Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application. **Step 6:** Once the application is done, confirm it. **Step 7:** Take a printout of the confirmed application.

Lease Agreement (minimum 10 years, if applicable) 1. Consent Form of Co-owners (in case of co-owned land) 1. Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe Certificate (for Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries)

schemeName: To Increase Fish Seed Production And Inland Fisheries Equipment In Tribal Areas: Training of Tribal Trainees Gujarat
Details:
The scheme "To Increase Fish Seed Production And Inland Fisheries Equipment In Tribal Areas", with a component of "Training of Tribal Trainees", introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, the training scholarships are provided to Scheduled Tribe trainees involved in inland fisheries to enhance their capacity and skill set. The training is conducted at tribal area training centres run by the Fisheries Department, located in Khedbrahma, Kadana, Chhota Udepur, Rajpipla, Madhuban, and Ukai. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries.
> **Objectives:** - To increase fish production by rearing fish in reservoirs and provide employment to people involved in inland fisheries activities. - To boost fish farming or fishing activities in freshwater bodies. - Fishing in reservoirs, aquaculture in ponds, and catch from rivers increase fish production and boost inland fisheries. - The main objective is to provide employment opportunities to Scheduled Tribe fishermen in the state and increase fish production.
The scheme aims to boost fish production and provide employment through inland fisheries. Under this scheme, Financial assistance is provided as a scholarship to tribal trainees undergoing fisheries training.
Benefits:
A trainee is paid a scholarship of ₹2,000/- per month for three months, amounting to a total of ₹6,000/-.
> **Training Details** > **Duration:** 3 months > **Location:** Tribal area training centers run by the Fisheries Department at Khedbrahma, Kadana, Chhota Udepur, Rajpipla, Madhuban, and Ukai. > **Conditions for Receiving Benefits:** A trainee is eligible for the scholarship only if they maintain a minimum of 60% attendance during the training period. > **Validity:** The benefit is available once in a lifetime for each eligible trainee.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be Individuals/societies/self-help groups/associations/reservoir monopolies/private units, etc., involved in inland fisheries activities can avail the benefits of inland schemes. 1. The applicant must be from the Scheduled Tribes. 1. The applicant must be involved in the Inland Schemes. 1. The applicant should be above 18 years. 1. The beneficiary fisherman must have his own bank account. 1. The applicant must have an Aadhaar Card/Voter ID/Ration Card/Passport as proof of identity.

schemeName: Private Tuition Assistance to Socially and Educationally Backward Class Students Studying in Science Stream of Class 11 & 12
Details:
The "Private Tuition Assistance to Socially and Educationally Backward Class Students Studying in Science Stream of Class 11 & 12" scheme was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. It aims to provide financial assistance for private tuition to socially and educationally backward class (SEBC) students pursuing science education in higher secondary classes. Under this scheme, a total of ₹15,000 is granted to each class of 11th and 12th to cover private tuition fees.
Under this scheme, a grant of ₹15,000 each for class 11 and class 12 to cover private tuition fees for eligible SEBC students pursuing science education in higher secondary classes.
Benefits: - Financial assistance of ₹15,000 for Class 11th- Financial assistance of ₹15,000 for Class 12th
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must belong to the Socially and Educationally Backward Class (SEBC). 1. The applicant must be studying in the science stream in Class 11th or Class 12th in a recognized higher secondary school.1. The applicant must be availing of private tuition during the academic year. 1. The applicant’s annual family income must not exceed ₹6,00,000/-.

Application Process.process: > **Application Process:** **Step 1:** The applicant may visit the Digital Gujarat Portal: [https://www.digitalgujarat.gov.in/](https://www.digitalgujarat.gov.in/) **Step 2:** On the home page, click on ‘Register’ and the applicant will be redirected to the registration form page. **Step 3:** Enter your Mobile Number, Email, Set Password, and then click on ‘Save’. **Step 4:** After successful registration, the applicant can login through his/her User Name (Mobile No./Email ID) and Password. **Step 5:** Now, click on ‘My Profile’ to update your profile and fill in all the mandatory information. **Step 6:** After filling in profile details, click on ‘Update Profile’. The profile will be updated after entering the verification Code (OTP). **Step 7:** Now under services, select ‘Scholarship Services’ and then click on ‘SC Scheme’. **Step 8:** Select the Financial Year for which you want to apply for and then click on ‘Change Financial Year’. **Step 9:** Select the scheme, read the interaction carefully, and then click on ‘Continue to Service’. **Step 10:** Fill in the application form completely and upload all the relevant documents. **Step 11:** Now, click on ‘Save as Draft’ and agree with the terms &amp; conditions, and submit the application form by clicking on ‘Confirm &amp; Final Submit’. > **Instructions:** **Note 1:** Photo uploading for all applicants is mandatory. **Note 2:** Application will be considered complete only when all sections are completed. **Note 3:** Only one application per applicant will be acceptable for a scholarship. If any student submits more than one application either from a single institute or from multiple institutions his/her all applications will be rejected by the competent authority and no request from any side will be entertained. **Note 4:** In case of any wrong/misleading information provided in the application shall lead to rejection of the application by Department Authorities. **Note 5:** All required documents must be carefully scanned as per the instructions given. **Note 6:** The student has to fill his/her application carefully as there is no provision for institution change once the application is submitted successfully. **Note 7:** The unreadable uploaded documents will allow the competent authority to reject the student application. **Note 8:** Direct Individual submission of this application form will not be accepted in case of students studying inside the state. Only outside students have to fill out their form online and submit his/her application form to their native district officer. schemeName: To Increase Fish Seed Production And Inland Fisheries Equipment In Tribal Areas: Fish Cage Culture Gujarat
Details:
The scheme "To Increase Fish Seed Production and Inland Fisheries Equipment in Tribal Areas," with a component of "Fish Cage Culture" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to increase fish production by rearing fish in reservoirs and generate employment opportunities for individuals engaged in inland fisheries. Through this scheme, financial assistance is provided for activities such as fish cage culture and fish seed stocking, benefiting primarily the Scheduled Tribe (ST) communities involved in inland fisheries. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries.
> **Objectives:** - To increase fish production by rearing fish in reservoirs and provide employment to people involved in inland fisheries activities. - To boost fish farming or fishing activities in freshwater bodies. - Fishing in reservoirs, aquaculture in ponds, and catch from rivers increase fish production and boost inland fisheries. - The main objective is to provide employment opportunities to Scheduled Tribe fishermen in the state and increase fish production.
The scheme aims to increase fish production and provide employment through reservoir-based inland fisheries. It offers financial assistance to Scheduled Tribe fishermen.
Benefits:
Scheduled Tribe beneficiaries are eligible for 60% assistance of the unit cost of ₹3,00,000/- to ₹1,80,000/-, or 60% of the actual cost, whichever is less.
> **Minimum Time Limit for Reclaiming Benefits:** 3 year from the date of availing benefit.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be Individuals/societies/self-help groups/associations/reservoir monopolies/private units, etc., involved in inland fisheries activities can avail the benefits of inland schemes. 1. The applicant must be from the Scheduled Tribes. 1. The applicant must be involved in the Inland Schemes. 1. The applicant should be above 18 years. 1. The beneficiary fisherman must have his own bank account. 1. The applicant must have an Aadhaar Card/Voter ID/Ration Card/Passport as proof of identity.

Application Process.process:
> **Registration Process:** **Step 1:** The applicant may visit and apply online at the [I-Khedut Portal](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/). **Step 2:** Click on 'Login' from the top right-hand side, then click on "Beneficiary Registration" and select any one from the 'Farmer' or 'Institutional' or 'Except For the Farmer' as the Beneficiary Type. **Step 3:** Enter the 'Company Name' and Address if you have selected 'Institutional' or 'Except For the Farmer' as the Beneficiary Type. And for all select the District, Taluka, and Village, choose 'what type of account holder you are?', enter your Account Number and Name, solve the Captcha, and click 'Save and Next'. **Step 4:** Enter your Mobile Number and E-mail address, click 'Send OTP', enter the received OTP, create and confirm a Password, solve the Captcha, and click 'Submit'.
> **Login Process:** **Step 1:** The applicant may visit and apply online at the [I-Khedut Portal](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/). **Step 2:** Click on 'Login' from the top right-hand side of the homepage. On the home page, click on ‘Schemes’ and then click on ‘Agricultural Schemes’. **Step 3:** Now select the scheme, click on the ‘Apply’ button, and an application page will open. **Step 4:** Click on the "Apply New" button and submit a new application. **Step 5:** Click on the "Update Application" button to add corrections to the application. **Step 6:** Once the application is done, confirm it. **Step 7:** Take a printout of the confirmed application.
> **Contact Us:** [Click here](https://ikhedut.gujarat.gov.in/Public/frm_Public_Contacts.aspx).

Documents Required: 1. Aadhaar Card/Voter ID/Ration Card/Passport (as proof of identity) 1. Scheduled Tribe Certificate 1. Bank Account Details

schemeName: Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Fisheries: Training of Scheduled Caste trainees Gujarat
Details:
The scheme "Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Fisheries" with the component of "Training of Scheduled Caste Trainees" introduced by the Agriculture, Farmers Welfare and Co-operation Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to increase fish production and provide employment opportunities to Scheduled Caste (SC) people engaged in inland fisheries activities. Through this scheme, financial assistance in the form of a stipend is provided to SC beneficiaries undergoing fisheries training to enhance their knowledge and skills. The scheme is implemented by the Commissioner of Fisheries, Government of Gujarat. **Objectives:** - To increase fish production by rearing fish in reservoirs and provide employment to scheduled caste (SC) people involved in inland fisheries activities. - To boost fish farming or fishing activities in freshwater bodies by scheduled caste (SC) fish farmers and fishermen. - Fishing in reservoirs, aquaculture in ponds, and catch from rivers increase fish production and boost inland fisheries through scheduled caste (SC) fish farmers and fishermen. - The main objective is to provide employment opportunities to Scheduled Caste fishermen in the state and increase fish production.
The scheme aims to increase fish production and provide employment opportunities to Scheduled Caste (SC) people engaged in inland fisheries activities.
Benefits:
1. The trainee is paid a stipend of ₹1,250/- after completing ten days of training. 1. The stipend is paid at the rate of ₹125/- per day.
> **Training Duration:** 10 days of fisheries training. > **Frequency of Disbursement:** Once in a lifetime.
Eligibility:
1. The applicant should belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) community. 1. The applicant should be above 18 years of age. 1. The applicant should be involved in inland fisheries activities. 1. The applicant can be an individual, a society, a self-help group, an association, a reservoir monopoly, or a private unit. 1. The applicant must have a bank account in their own name. 1. The applicant must have an Aadhar Card/Voter ID/Ration Card/Passport as proof of identity.
> **Preference/Reservation:** The scheme specifically benefits Scheduled Caste fishermen under the inland fisheries scheme.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** Visit the Nearest District Fisheries Office in your respective district. **Step 2:** Collect the Prescribed Application Form for the training component, i.e, "Training of Scheduled Caste Trainees" under Assistance to Scheduled Castes for Fisheries. **Step 3:** Fill the Application Form completely with accurate details. **Step 4:** Attach the Required Documents, including identity proof, SC certificate, and bank account proof. **Step 5:** Submit the Application in person to the concerned official at the District Fisheries Office.

Documents Required: 1. Aadhar Card/Voter ID/Ration Card/Passport (as proof of identity) 1. Bank Account Passbook 1. Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe Certificate

schemeName: Satfera Samuhlagna (DCW) Scheme
Details:
The "Satfera Samuhlagna (DCW)" scheme was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. It aims to promote social welfare and support financially weaker sections through community marriages. Under this scheme, an incentive amount is given to newly married couples belonging to socially and educationally backward classes and economically backward classes. Additionally, ₹3,000 per couple (up to ₹75,000) is provided to the organizing institution.
The scheme aims to encourage community marriages among economically and socially backward classes. Incentives are provided to couples and the organizing institutions.
Benefits: **Monetary Incentive to Couples:** - ₹12,000 is provided to each newly married couple from socially and educationally backward classes and economically backward classes. **Support to Organizing Institutions:** - ₹3,000 per couple is granted to the organizing institution, up to a maximum of ₹75,000 per event.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a newly married female. 1. The applicant should belong to a Socially and Educationally Backward Class (SEBC) or Economically Backward Class. 1. The applicant’s annual individual income should not exceed ₹6,00,000/-.

Application Process.process: **Step 01:** The eligible applicant may visit the e-Samaj Kalyan Portal: [https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/](https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/) **Step 02:** On the home page, under the tab ‘Citizen Login’, click on New User ‘[Please Register Here](https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/Registration.aspx)’. **Step 03:** Enter your Full Name as per Aadhaar Card, Gender, Date of Birth, Aadhaar Card Number, Email ID, Caste etc. and then click on ‘Register’. **Step 04:** After successful registration, the applicants can login through their User ID and Password. **Step 05:** Now, click on ‘User Profile’ to update your profile. **Step 06:** Fill in all the mandatory information and then click on ‘Update’. **Step 07:** After updating the profile successfully, select the scheme appearing on the home page; an application form will open. **Step 08:** Fill in all the mandatory details in the application form and upload all the relevant documents. **Step 09:** Now agree with the terms & conditions and click on ‘Save Application’. **Step 10:** Submit the application form and take out the print of the application for future reference. The applicant can note down the application number to track the application status by logging into the portal using their User ID and Password. [User Manual](https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/HelpManual/Citizen-HelpManual.pdf)

Documents Required: - Aadhaar Card - Bank Pass Book/Cancelled Cheque - Caste Certificate - Certificate of Institution(Satfera Samuh Lagna Yojana) - Income Certificate - Marriage Certificate

schemeName: Maintenance of Govt Boys and Girls Hostels (SC)
Details:
The “Maintenance of Govt Boys and Girls Hostels (SC)” scheme was launched by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Government of Gujarat. It aims to provide free residential facilities, meals, and educational support to scheduled caste (SC) students. Under this scheme, students who have passed class 10th and are pursuing further studies are accommodated in government-run hostels with free food, lodging, and academic resources.
Under this scheme, it provides free hostel, food, and academic facilities to scheduled caste students pursuing post-SSC education.
Benefits: - Free Accommodation in Government Hostels. - Free Meals (Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner). - Free Educational Facilities such as textbooks and study material.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must belong to the Scheduled Caste (SC) category. 1. The applicant must be a permanent resident of Gujarat. 1. The applicant must have passed class 10th (SSC) or higher from GSEB/CBSE.1. The applicant must be enrolled in a regular course in a college within the same district as the hostel. 1. The boy student's annual family income must not exceed ₹2,50,000. No income limit for girl students. 1. The applicant must have scored at least 50% marks in the last annual exam.

Application Process.process: **Step 01:** The eligible applicant may visit the e-Samaj Kalyan Portal: [https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/](https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/) **Step 02:** On the home page, under the tab ‘Citizen Login’, click on New User ‘[Please Register Here](https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/Registration.aspx)’. **Step 03:** Enter your Full Name as per Aadhaar Card, Gender, Date of Birth, Aadhaar Card Number, Email ID, Caste etc. and then click on ‘Register’. **Step 04:** After successful registration, the applicants can login through their User ID and Password. **Step 05:** Now, click on ‘User Profile’ to update your profile. **Step 06:** Fill in all the mandatory information and then click on ‘Update’. **Step 07:** After updating the profile successfully, select the scheme appearing on the home page; an application form will open. **Step 08:** Fill in all the mandatory details in the application form and upload all the relevant documents. **Step 09:** Now agree with the terms & conditions and click on ‘Save Application’. **Step 10:** Submit the application form and take out the print of the application for future reference. The applicant can note down the application number to track the application status by logging into the portal using their User ID and Password. [User Manual](https://esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in/HelpManual/Citizen-HelpManual.pdf)

Documents Required: - Passport-size Photograph - Aadhaar Card - Caste Certificate - Gender Certificate (obtained from a competent authority) - Proof of Residence (Electricity Bill, Rent Agreement, Voter ID, or Ration Card) - Annual Family Income Certificate - Mark Sheet of Last Examination Passed - Admission Receipt or Letter from School/College - School Leaving Certificate - Bank Passbook (first page) or Cancelled Cheque - Graduate/Postgraduate Mark Sheets (if applicable) - Disability Certificate (if applicable) - Certificate for Child of Widow/Divorcee (if applicable) - Orphan Certificate (if applicable)

schemeName: PM-Special Training of Geriatric Caregivers
Details:
The scheme "PM-Special Training of Geriatric Caregivers" was launched by the Department of Social Justice & Empowerment, Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment, Govt. of India. The scheme aims to bridge the gap in supply and increasing demand in the field of geriatric caregivers, provide more professional services to senior citizens, and create a cadre of professional caregivers in geriatrics. The scheme provides training in four specific job roles: Geriatric Caregiver (Institutional & Home Care), Elderly Caretaker (Non-Clinical), Elderly Care Companion, and Wellness Therapist for Elderly, with an emphasis on physical, mental, and overall well-being of the elderly through a multi-disciplinary approach, including on-job training for specific courses. The scheme is implemented by the Department of Social Justice & Empowerment with the help of the National Institute of Social Defence. The applications for this scheme are accepted through registration on the Skill India Digital Hub (SIDH).
The scheme aims to train and create a professional cadre of geriatric caregivers to meet the increasing demand for specialized care for senior citizens. It offers skill development and certification in geriatric care job roles to Indian citizens, ensuring professional services for the elderly.
Benefits: > ***Skill Training*** The scheme provides training to candidates in four specific job roles: Geriatric Caregiver (Institutional & Home Care) (480 hours), Elderly Caretaker (Non-Clinical) (360 hours), Elderly Care Companion (450 hours), and Wellness Therapist for Elderly (570 hours). > ***On-Job Training (OJT)*** For job roles as mandated by the National Council for Vocational Education and Training, On-Job Training is provided, with its duration guided by the approved qualification pack. > ***Assessment and Certification*** The skill assessment is conducted by empaneled Assessment Agencies, and a certificate is made available to candidates in physical and digital form, along with corresponding 'credits' as per the National Credit Framework of MSDE. The assessment fee is provided under the scheme. > ***Re-assessment Opportunity*** Every candidate is offered one chance of re-assessment free of cost, to be borne from the scheme. > ***Placement Support*** Apprenticeship is promoted, and training linked to captive placements (training and placement within the same industry) will be encouraged. Trainees are also encouraged to participate in Rozgar Melas for placement, with Training Institutes having tie-ups for proper placement.
Eligibility: - The applicant must be a citizen of India. - The applicant must meet the minimum age as specified in the respective job role. - The applicant must be less than 40 years of age. - The applicant must have the minimum education qualification as per the required job roles. - The applicant must not indulge in any substance abuse.

Application Process.process:
##### **Official Website** [https://www.skillindiadigital.gov.in](https://www.skillindiadigital.gov.in)
**Step 1:****** ***Account Registration*** Navigate to the Skill India Digital Hub (SIDH) at https://www.skillindiadigital.gov.in, and click "Register". Provide your mobile number and verify via OTP. Provide your email ID. Set a strong password of minimum 8 characters. Complete the basic registration form and proceed to profile creation. **Step 2:****** ***Profile Creation and e-KYC*** Fill in your complete personal details including full name, date of birth, gender, category, and current address. Enter your Aadhaar number and click "Verify Aadhaar" for automatic e-KYC. The system will auto-populate your basic details and send OTP to your Aadhaar-linked mobile number for final authentication. Ensure all information matches exactly with your Aadhaar card. Upload the required documents in the specified file format and file size. **Step 3:****** ***Course and Institute Selection*** Browse through available geriatric caregiver training courses. Select your preferred training course. Choose up to three empaneled training institutes in order of preference. The system will allocate seats based on availability and your preference order during final selection process. **Step 4:****** ***Application Review and Submission*** Carefully review all entered information, uploaded documents, and selected preferences in the application preview section before submission. Read and accept the terms and conditions, scheme guidelines, and declaration. Click "Submit Application" to generate unique Application Reference Number (ARN) and receive confirmation SMS and email.
##### ***Post-Application Processes*** **Step 1:****** ***Verification and Selection*** The application verification (15-30 working days) by Project Appraisal Committee under Joint Secretary of DoSJE. Selected candidates receive training institute allocation, batch schedule, and joining instructions through registered communication channels. **Step 2:****** ***Training Enrollment and Support*** Report to assigned training institute as per schedule provided in selection notification with original documents for physical verification. Complete the free training program. Upon successful completion, receive government-recognized certification.
##### **Grievance Redressal** **Email:** secretary-sje@nic.in **Phone:** +91-11-23382065 **Address:** Shastri Bhavan, Dr. Rajendra Prasad Road, New Delhi - 110001

Documents Required: - Aadhaar Card - Proof of Age - Proof of Education - Proof of Residence

schemeName: Free Pre-Recruitment Training
Details:
The scheme "Free Pre-Recruitment Training" is implemented by the State Sainik Board under the Sainik Welfare Department, Government of Uttarakhand. The scheme aims to provide 8 weeks of free pre-recruitment training for the Military, Paramilitary, and Police forces to the sons of ex-servicemen aged between 16 and 21 years.
The scheme aims to provide 8 weeks of free pre-recruitment training for recruitment into the Military, Paramilitary, and Police Forces to sons of ex-servicemen aged between 16 and 21 years who have passed high school with at least 45% marks.
Benefits: Under this scheme, 8 weeks of free pre-recruitment training for recruitment into the Military, Paramilitary, and Police Forces is provided to eligible beneficiaries.
Eligibility: 1. The applicant must be a resident of Uttarakhand. 1. The applicant must be a son of an ex-serviceman. 1. The applicant's age should be more than 16 years and less than 21 years. 1. The applicant should have passed high school with 45% marks. ***All expenses incurred on training (honorarium of trainers + food + accommodation) are borne by the Directorate of Sainik Welfare.*** **Note: 5** courses are conducted each year.

Application Process.process: - The District Sainik Welfare Office invites applications from sons of ex-servicemen through public notifications. - Applicants are required to submit the following documents: Ordinary Application Form, Birth Certificate, Aadhaar Card, Educational Certificate (at least High School or Higher Secondary), Medical Certificate, Ex-Serviceman Identity Card, and Discharge Book. - The above documents should be submitted to the concerned District Sainik Welfare Office. Once the applications are processed, selected trainees are informed about the training schedule, after which the training is conducted in the Garhwal and Kumaon divisions of the state.

Documents Required: 1. Ordinary Application Form 1. Birth Certificate 1. Aadhaar Card 1. Educational Certificate (at least High School or Higher Secondary) 1. Medical Certificate 1. Ex-Serviceman Identity Card 1. Discharge Book

schemeName: Craftsmen Training Scheme
Details:
The "Craftsmen Training Scheme" was launched by the Directorate General of Training, Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship, Government of India. The scheme aims to ensure a steady flow of skilled workers in different trades for the domestic industry, to raise quantitatively and qualitatively the industrial production by systematic training, to reduce unemployment among the educated youth by providing them with employable skills, and to cultivate and nurture a technical and industrial attitude in the minds of the younger generation. The scheme provides systematic vocational training through a network of Industrial Training Institutes and National Skill Training Institutes located all over the country, offering comprehensive skill development programs in various trades and conducting All India Trade Tests for certification.
The scheme aims to ensure steady flow of skilled workers in different trades for domestic industry and reduce unemployment among educated youth. It provides systematic vocational training through Industrial Training Institutes and National Skill Training Institutes across India.
Benefits: ##### ***Vocational Training and Skill Development*** - **Training Duration:** Varies from 6 months to 2 years, depending on the trade.- **Trade Certification:** National Council for Vocational Training certificate upon successful completion.- **Skill Development:** Hands-on practical training in various industrial trades.- **Employment Opportunities:** Enhanced employability in domestic and international markets. ##### ***Training Infrastructure and Facilities*** - **Training Network:** Access to 15,042 Industrial Training Institutes and 33 National Skill Training Institutes.- **Modern Equipment:** Training on the latest industrial equipment and technology.- **Expert Instruction:** Training by qualified instructors and industry experts.- **Workshop Facilities:** Well-equipped workshops for practical training. ##### ***Assessment and Certification*** - **All India Trade Tests:** Conducted by the Directorate General of Training under the aegis of the National Council for Vocational Training at the end of training.- **National Recognition:** Certificates recognized across India for employment.- **Industry Standards:** Training aligned with current industry requirements and standards. ##### ***Conditions*** - Minimum 80% attendance is required to appear in the Final Trade Test. - Regular participation in practical training sessions and workshops. - Compliance with the institute rules and regulations. - Successful completion of periodic assessments and tests.
Eligibility: - The applicant must be an Indian citizen. - The applicant must meet the age requirements as specified for different trades (generally between 14 to 40 years). - The applicant must have completed the minimum educational qualifications as prescribed for specific trades (ranging from 8th standard to 12th standard). - The applicant must be able to read and write in the local language / Hindi / English. - The applicant must be physically and medically fit to undergo the specific trade training. - The applicant must not have any physical disabilities that would prevent them from performing the trade activities. - The applicant must meet specific requirements for certain trades (such as color vision for electrical trades). - The applicant must demonstrate basic aptitude for the chosen trade.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** The candidate must visit the Industrial Training Institute and obtain the prescribed application form. **Step 2:** The applicant should fill out the application form completely with accurate personal details, educational background, trade preference, and attach all required documents with proper attestation. **Step 3:** The candidate must pay the prescribed application and training fees as applicable and submit the completed application form along with all supporting documents to the authorised staff of the Institute, within the specified deadline. _*Request a receipt or acknowledgement from the concerned authority to whom the application has been submitted. Ensure that the receipt contains essential details such as the date and time of submission, and a unique identification number (if applicabl_e). ***Post-Application Processes*** **Step 1:** _Merit List and Selection Process_ The institutes will prepare merit lists based on educational qualifications and other criteria, and selected candidates will be notified about their admission through official communication channels. **Step 2:** _Admission Confirmation and Document Verification_ Selected candidates must report to the institute on the specified date for document verification, admission confirmation, and completion of remaining formalities, including medical examination if required. **Step 3:** _Training Commencement_ After successful admission confirmation, candidates will begin their vocational training as per the institute's academic calendar and training schedule for their respective trades. > **Application Deadlines** Application deadlines vary by institute and are typically announced before the commencement of each academic session (usually April-May for the August session and October-November for the February session).

Documents Required: ***At the Application Stage*** - Educational Certificates - Age Proof Certificate (Birth Certificate/10th Standard Certificate) - Caste Certificate (For Reserved Category Candidates) - Income Certificate (For Fee Concession If Applicable) - Medical Fitness Certificate (From Registered Medical Practitioner) - Passport Size Photographs (Recent) - Aadhaar Card (Copy) - Domicile Certificate (For State Quota If Applicable) ***For Admission Confirmation*** - Admission Fee Receipt - Character Certificate (From Last Educational Institution) - Transfer Certificate (From Previous Institution) - Migration Certificate (If Changing Board/University) ***For Final Examination*** - Attendance Certificate - Internal Assessment Records - Project Work Completion Certificate

schemeName: Oral Documentation of History of Tiatr
Details:
The scheme "Oral Documentation of History of Tiatr" was launched by the Tiatr Academy under the Art, Culture and Museums Department, Government of Goa. The scheme aims to preserve the rich experiences of veteran tiatr artistes who have contributed immensely to the development of Tiatr, as their experiences form a part and parcel of the history of Tiatr for future generations. The scheme provides video recording of artistes' experiences on High Definition or higher format camera with preservation on Digital Versatile Disc at Tiatr Academy of Goa's Library and a onetime remuneration as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. The applicant must have made at least 20 years contribution to the Konkani stage and must be a script writer, director, actor, singer, musician, backstage artiste or organizer involved in tiatrs. The scheme is implemented by the Tiatr Academy of Goa and applications for this scheme are accepted offline.
The scheme aims to preserve the oral history of tiatr for future generations through documentation of veteran artistes' experiences. It provides video recording and remuneration to eligible veteran tiatr artistes.
Benefits: > ***Financial Benefits*** - Onetime remuneration as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa to the artiste to be documented. - Additional amount as decided by the Tiatr Academy of Goa for artistes living outside Goa. - Remuneration to the interviewer as fixed by the Tiatr Academy of Goa. > ***Non-Financial Benefits*** - Video recording of artiste's experiences on High Definition or higher format camera. - Preservation of documentation on Digital Versatile Disc at Tiatr Academy of Goa's Library. - One copy of the Digital Versatile Disc provided to the artiste concerned. - Potential upload of recording on Tiatr Academy of Goa's website, other internet sites, or other media channels.
Eligibility: - The applicant must be a veteran artist who has contributed to the development of Tiatr. - The applicant must be a script writer, director, actor, singer, musician, backstage artiste involved in stage setting, light effects, background music, costumes, make-up, or those involved in organizing tiatrs. - The applicant must have made at least 20 years of contribution to the Konkani stage. - The applicant who is a writer or director must have scripted at least 15 tiatrs. - The applicant who is other than writer or director must have participated in at least 20 tiatrs. > ***Preference, Selection and Implementation*** - At least five artistes will be considered for documentation in a financial year. - Artistes will be selected by the Managing Committee of Tiatr Academy of Goa. - Preference will be given to old and sick artistes.

Application Process.process: **Step 1:** The interested applicant should take a printout of the [prescribed format](https://www.goa.gov.in/wp-content/uploads/2021/06/Citizen-Charter-TAG.pdf) of the application form. The application form requires details including the name of the artiste, address, contact number, email, Aadhaar Card number, and aspects of tiatr on which the artiste has contributed to the tiatr stage. **Step 2:** In the application form, fill in all the mandatory fields, and attach copies of all the mandatory documents (self-attest, if required). Provide detailed information about your contribution to the tiatr stage on a separate sheet as indicated in the form. Sign the application form and mention the date. **Step 3:** Submit the duly filled and signed application form along with the documents to - **Tiatr Academy of Goa, AS-1 / AS-4, Block A, 2nd Floor, Campal Trade Centre, Opposite Kala Academy, Campal, Panaji, Goa, India – 403001** _*Applicants are advised to save a copy of the submitted application form and any acknowledgment received for future reference._ _*The Tiatr Academy of Goa reserves the right to make any changes in the rules of the scheme._

Documents Required: - Self Attested Copy Of Aadhaar Card - Application Form (Oral Documentation Of History Of Tiatr Data Form) - Photographs Of The Artiste - Video Clippings Of The Artiste (If Available)

schemeName: SAKSHAM - KVK 2.0
Details:
The scheme "SAKSHAM - KVK 2.0"was launched by the Gujarat Skill Development Mission (GSDM), Labour and Employment Department, Government of Gujarat. The scheme aims to provide access to skill development programmes to a wide range of beneficiaries at taluka/village level, enhancing employability and competitiveness in the job market while promoting entrepreneurship. The scheme provides Short-Term Training in National Skills Qualifications Framework Level 1, 2, and 3 courses along with Gujarat Council of Vocational Training courses, and implements Special Projects for marginalized and vulnerable groups. The applicant must be a domicile of Gujarat, looking for fresh skills, reskilling, upskilling opportunities. The scheme is implemented by GSDM through empanelled Implementation Partners across all 33 districts of Gujarat. The applications are accepted online through the GSDM portal.
The scheme aims to equip beneficiaries with skills for employability and entrepreneurship at taluka/village level across Gujarat. It provides skill development training through Short-Term Training and Special Projects for diverse beneficiaries.
Benefits: ##### ***Training Benefits*** - Short-Term Training of approximately 300 hours duration in National Skills Qualifications Framework/Gujarat Council of Vocational Training aligned courses. - On-the-Job Training as an integral part of Short-Term Training with duration determined by specific job roles. - Specialized training courses for Special Projects tailored to meet specific needs of marginalized and vulnerable groups. - Training conducted at Saksham Centers established at taluka/village level. - Access to certified Training of Trainers trainers endorsed by respective Sector Skill Councils. - Industry expert and entrepreneur guest lectures on rotational basis. ##### ***Assessment and Certification Benefits*** - Assessment and certification carried out by Sector Skill Councils/Gujarat Council of Vocational Training. - Assessment and certification fees paid directly by Gujarat Skill Development Mission. - Candidates eligible for assessment with minimum 70% attendance for classroom training and 70% for On-the-Job Training. ##### ***Employment Support Benefits*** - Placement assistance and employment opportunities from Implementation Partners. - Multiple placement options including wage employment, probation with stipend/salary, service aggregator portal registration, job work acceptance, self-employment, and apprenticeship opportunities. - Post-placement tracking and support services. ##### ***Infrastructure and Facility Benefits*** - Training centers with basic amenities including drinking water and separate toilets for boys and girls. - Aadhaar-based biometric attendance system and Internet Protocol-based Closed-Circuit Television cameras with Digital Video Recorder systems. - Teaching aids, furniture, fittings, and equipment as per job role requirements. ##### ***Conditions*** - Minimum 70% attendance required for classroom training to be eligible for completion. - Minimum 70% attendance required for On-the-Job Training to be eligible for completion. - Original Aadhaar card verification required during assessment to prevent duplication. - Adherence to batch timings from earliest 7:00 AM to latest 7:00 PM with minimum 4 hours and maximum 8 hours per day training.
Eligibility: - The applicant must be a domicile of Gujarat. - The applicant must be minimum 14 years of age as per labour law for non-hazardous occupations. - The applicant must be maximum 59 years of age for Short Term Training. - The applicant must be maximum 65 years of age for Special Projects. - The applicant must be looking for fresh skills, reskilling, or upskilling opportunities for Short Term Training. - The applicant must be out of education, school/college dropout, or unemployed youth for Short Term Training. - The applicant must belong to marginalized, vulnerable groups requiring special attention or specific job roles for Special Projects. > ***Eligibility for Special Projects*** The applicant must belong to one of the following categories: _Jail Inmates, Former Prisoners, Juvenile homes, Scheduled Castes, Women, Members of the Transgender Community, Members of the Beggar Community, Senior Citizens and Old age homes, Patients recovered from Mental illness, Children in Shelter Homes and Orphanages, Scheduled Tribes, Economically Backward Communities, Persons with Disabilities, Rural Artisans, or Migrant Workers._

Application Process.process:
**Step 1:****** ***Registration, Login and Profile Setup*** - Visit the [official website](https://skills.gujarat.gov.in) of Gujarat Skill Development Mission and navigate to the SAKSHAM - KVK 2.0 application portal. - Create a new user account on the portal by providing basic personal information including name, mobile number, and email address. Verify your mobile number through OTP sent via SMS and verify email address through verification link. - Login to your registered account using credentials and complete your detailed profile including personal information, educational qualifications, employment status, and contact details. Upload a recent passport-size photograph in JPEG format with maximum file size of 100kb. **Step 2:****** ***Selection of Scheme, Job Role, and Training Center*** - Navigate to the SAKSHAM - KVK 2.0 scheme section and select the appropriate training category - either Short Term Training or Special Projects based on your eligibility and requirements. Browse through the available NSQF/GCVT aligned job roles listed on the portal. - Select your preferred job role based on your interest, aptitude, and career objectives from the available options in your district/taluka. - View the list of empanelled Implementation Partners and their Saksham Centers in your preferred taluka/village location. - Select your preferred training center based on location convenience and course availability. **Step 3:****** ***Filling Application Form and Document Upload*** - Fill the comprehensive application form with mandatory fields including personal details, educational background, employment history, family information, and preference details.
